1.quote: In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can.
1.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

2.quote: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
2.author: St. Jerome

3.quote: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
3.author: Charles R. Swindoll

4.quote: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
4.author: Og Mandino

5.quote: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
5.author: Robert H. Schuller

6.quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
6.author: Walt Disney

7.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
7.author: Confucius

8.quote: It always seems impossible until it's done.
8.author: Nelson Mandela

9.quote: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
9.author: Og Mandino

10.quote: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
10.author: Sam Levenson

11.quote: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
11.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

12.quote: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
12.author: Ayn Rand

13.quote: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
13.author: Theodore Roosevelt

14.quote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
14.author: Thomas A. Edison

15.quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
15.author: Confucius

16.quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
16.author: Mark Twain

17.quote: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
17.author: Norman Vincent Peale

18.quote: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
18.author: Ralph Marston

19.quote: Accept the challenges so that you can feel the exhilaration of victory.
19.author: George S. Patton

20.quote: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
20.author: Aristotle

21.quote: We should not give up and we should not allow the problem to defeat us.
21.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

22.quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
22.author: Aldous Huxley

23.quote: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.
23.author: Rabindranath Tagore

24.quote: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
24.author: Arthur Ashe

25.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
25.author: William James

26.quote: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.
26.author: Bradley Whitford

27.quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
27.author: Walt Disney

28.quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
28.author: Helen Keller

29.quote: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
29.author: Tony Robbins

31.quote: Look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see, and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious.
31.author: Stephen Hawking

32.quote: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
32.author: Dalai Lama

33.quote: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
33.author: Lao Tzu

34.quote: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
34.author: Maya Angelou

35.quote: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.
35.author: Bo Jackson

36.quote: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.
36.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

37.quote: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.
37.author: W. Clement Stone

38.quote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
38.author: Zig Ziglar

39.quote: If you're going through hell, keep going.
39.author: Winston Churchill

40.quote: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
40.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

41.quote: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
41.author: Og Mandino

42.quote: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
42.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

43.quote: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
43.author: Benjamin Franklin

44.quote: Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another.
44.author: John Dewey

45.quote: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
45.author: Woodrow Wilson

46.quote: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
46.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

47.quote: Well done is better than well said.
47.author: Benjamin Franklin

48.quote: Expect problems and eat them for breakfast.
48.author: Alfred A. Montapert

49.quote: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
49.author: Epictetus

50.quote: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
50.author: Thomas Paine

51.quote: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.
51.author: George S. Patton

52.quote: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
52.author: Thomas Jefferson

53.quote: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
53.author: Nelson Mandela

54.quote: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
54.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

55.quote: Do something wonderful, people may imitate it.
55.author: Albert Schweitzer

56.quote: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
56.author: Les Brown

57.quote: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
57.author: Samuel Beckett

58.quote: I know where I'm going and I know the truth, and I don't have to be what you want me to be. I'm free to be what I want.
58.author: Muhammad Ali

59.quote: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.
59.author: Leo Buscaglia

60.quote: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
60.author: Elon Musk

61.quote: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
61.author: Amelia Earhart

62.quote: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
62.author: Jim Rohn

63.quote: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.
63.author: Robert H. Schuller

64.quote: Even if you fall on your face, you're still moving forward.
64.author: Victor Kiam

65.quote: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.
65.author: John F. Kennedy

66.quote: There's a way to do it better - find it.
66.author: Thomas A. Edison

67.quote: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
67.author: Wayne Dyer

69.quote: If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.
69.author: Jim Rohn

70.quote: Follow your dreams, work hard, practice and persevere. Make sure you eat a variety of foods, get plenty of exercise and maintain a healthy lifestyle.
70.author: Sasha Cohen

71.quote: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
71.author: Henry Ford

72.quote: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.
72.author: Pope John XXIII

73.quote: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
73.author: Simone de Beauvoir

74.quote: Poverty was the greatest motivating factor in my life.
74.author: Jimmy Dean

75.quote: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
75.author: Jim Rohn

76.quote: Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th.
76.author: Julie Andrews

77.quote: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.
77.author: William Blake

78.quote: Leap, and the net will appear.
78.author: John Burroughs

79.quote: Either I will find a way, or I will make one.
79.author: Philip Sidney

80.quote: Pursue one great decisive aim with force and determination.
80.author: Carl von Clausewitz

81.quote: I attribute my success to this - I never gave or took any excuse.
81.author: Florence Nightingale

82.quote: One finds limits by pushing them.
82.author: Herbert Simon

83.quote: Whatever you want in life, other people are going to want it too. Believe in yourself enough to accept the idea that you have an equal right to it.
83.author: Diane Sawyer

84.quote: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
84.author: Jim Rohn

85.quote: You must take action now that will move you towards your goals. Develop a sense of urgency in your life.
85.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

86.quote: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.
86.author: Oprah Winfrey

87.quote: Set your sights high, the higher the better. Expect the most wonderful things to happen, not in the future but right now. Realize that nothing is too good. Allow absolutely nothing to hamper you or hold you up in any way.
87.author: Eileen Caddy

88.quote: Be Impeccable With Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.
88.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

89.quote: The hardships that I encountered in the past will help me succeed in the future.
89.author: Philip Emeagwali

90.quote: The people who influence you are the people who believe in you.
90.author: Henry Drummond

91.quote: True happiness involves the full use of one's power and talents.
91.author: John W. Gardner

92.quote: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
92.author: Peter Marshall

93.quote: You simply have to put one foot in front of the other and keep going. Put blinders on and plow right ahead.
93.author: George Lucas

94.quote: Begin to be now what you will be hereafter.
94.author: William James

95.quote: The will to succeed is important, but what's more important is the will to prepare.
95.author: Bobby Knight

96.quote: Big shots are only little shots who keep shooting.
96.author: Christopher Morley

97.quote: There is always room at the top.
97.author: Daniel Webster

98.quote: Always continue the climb. It is possible for you to do whatever you choose, if you first get to know who you are and are willing to work with a power that is greater than ourselves to do it.
98.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

99.quote: One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.
99.author: Michael Korda

100.quote: A goal is a dream with a deadline.
100.author: Napoleon Hill

101.quote: Motivation will almost always beat mere talent.
101.author: Norman Ralph Augustine

103.quote: Be gentle to all and stern with yourself.
103.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

104.quote: The more we do, the more we can do.
104.author: William Hazlitt

105.quote: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
105.author: Walter Elliot

106.quote: I am not afraid... I was born to do this.
106.author: Joan of Arc

107.quote: Every exit is an entry somewhere else.
107.author: Tom Stoppard

108.quote: Know or listen to those who know.
108.author: Baltasar Gracian

110.quote: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
110.author: John D. Rockefeller

111.quote: Do your work with your whole heart, and you will succeed - there's so little competition.
111.author: Elbert Hubbard

112.quote: If you think you can do it, you can.
112.author: John Burroughs

113.quote: After a storm comes a calm.
113.author: Matthew Henry

115.quote: You can never quit. Winners never quit, and quitters never win.
115.author: Ted Turner

116.quote: You just can't beat the person who never gives up.
116.author: Babe Ruth

117.quote: Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness.
117.author: Allen Ginsberg

118.quote: From my tribe I take nothing, I am the maker of my own fortune.
118.author: Tecumseh

119.quote: Press forward. Do not stop, do not linger in your journey, but strive for the mark set before you.
119.author: George Whitefield

120.quote: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
120.author: Unknown

121.quote: Never retreat. Never explain. Get it done and let them howl.
121.author: Benjamin Jowett

122.quote: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
122.author: Carol Burnett

123.quote: You will never win if you never begin.
123.author: Helen Rowland

124.quote: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
124.author: Jack London

125.quote: Where there is a will, there is a way. If there is a chance in a million that you can do something, anything, to keep what you want from ending, do it. Pry the door open or, if need be, wedge your foot in that door and keep it open.
125.author: Pauline Kael

126.quote: Get action. Seize the moment. Man was never intended to become an oyster.
126.author: Theodore Roosevelt

127.quote: We need to accept that the commandments of God aren't just a long list of good ideas. They aren't 'life hacks' from an Internet blog or motivational quotes from a Pinterest board.
127.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

128.quote: God always strives together with those who strive.
128.author: Aeschylus

129.quote: I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.
129.author: Beverly Sills

130.quote: To be a good loser is to learn how to win.
130.author: Carl Sandburg

131.quote: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
131.author: Confucius

132.quote: If you want to conquer fear, don't sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.
132.author: Dale Carnegie

133.quote: You have to make it happen.
133.author: Denis Diderot

134.quote: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it's always your choice.
134.author: Wayne Dyer

135.quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
135.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

136.quote: Hitch your wagon to a star.
136.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

137.quote: If you ask me what I came into this life to do, I will tell you: I came to live out loud.
137.author: Emile Zola

138.quote: You can't expect to hit the jackpot if you don't put a few nickels in the machine.
138.author: Flip Wilson

139.quote: You need to overcome the tug of people against you as you reach for high goals.
139.author: George S. Patton

140.quote: The dog that trots about finds a bone.
140.author: Golda Meir

141.quote: Decide what you want, decide what you are willing to exchange for it. Establish your priorities and go to work.
141.author: H. L. Hunt

142.quote: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.
142.author: H. G. Wells

144.quote: Never give in and never give up.
144.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

145.quote: A somebody was once a nobody who wanted to and did.
145.author: John Burroughs

146.quote: March on. Do not tarry. To go forward is to move toward perfection. March on, and fear not the thorns, or the sharp stones on life's path.
146.author: Khalil Gibran

147.quote: In motivating people, you've got to engage their minds and their hearts. I motivate people, I hope, by example - and perhaps by excitement, by having productive ideas to make others feel involved.
147.author: Rupert Murdoch

148.quote: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.
148.author: Ken Venturi

149.quote: The more things you do, the more you can do.
149.author: Lucille Ball

150.quote: The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.
150.author: Mark Caine

151.quote: The first question which the priest and the Levite asked was: 'If I stop to help this man, what will happen to me?' But... the good Samaritan reversed the question: 'If I do not stop to help this man, what will happen to him?'
151.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

152.quote: Many are called but few get up.
152.author: Oliver Herford

153.quote: To be wholly devoted to some intellectual exercise is to have succeeded in life.
153.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

154.quote: You create your opportunities by asking for them.
154.author: Shakti Gawain

156.quote: Always desire to learn something useful.
156.author: Sophocles

157.quote: One may miss the mark by aiming too high as too low.
157.author: Thomas Fuller

158.quote: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any. It is wonderful how much may be done if we are always doing.
158.author: Thomas Jefferson

159.quote: They can conquer who believe they can.
159.author: Virgil

160.quote: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
160.author: William Butler Yeats

162.quote: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
162.author: Brian Tracy

163.quote: Learn from the past, set vivid, detailed goals for the future, and live in the only moment of time over which you have any control: now.
163.author: Denis Waitley

165.quote: If you've got a talent, protect it.
165.author: Jim Carrey

166.quote: Go big or go home. Because it's true. What do you have to lose?
166.author: Eliza Dushku

167.quote: There is nothing deep down inside us except what we have put there ourselves.
167.author: Richard Rorty

168.quote: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than You, and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.
168.author: Judy Collins

170.quote: We make the world we live in and shape our own environment.
170.author: Orison Swett Marden

171.quote: I learned that we can do anything, but we can't do everything... at least not at the same time. So think of your priorities not in terms of what activities you do, but when you do them. Timing is everything.
171.author: Dan Millman

172.quote: Step by step and the thing is done.
172.author: Charles Atlas

173.quote: Wherever you are - be all there.
173.author: Jim Elliot

174.quote: The ultimate aim of the ego is not to see something, but to be something.
174.author: Muhammad Iqbal

175.quote: I've worked too hard and too long to let anything stand in the way of my goals. I will not let my teammates down and I will not let myself down.
175.author: Mia Hamm

176.quote: Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.
176.author: Kyle Chandler

177.quote: No matter how many goals you have achieved, you must set your sights on a higher one.
177.author: Jessica Savitch

178.quote: The turning point was when I hit my 30th birthday. I thought, if really want to write, it's time to start. I picked up the book How to Write a Novel in 90 Days. The author said to just write three pages a day, and I figured, I can do this. I never got past Page 3 of that book.
178.author: James Rollins

179.quote: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
179.author: Unknown

180.quote: I like motivational books, because I like the go-getting American spirit - your destiny is in your own hands, life is what you make it, don't accept your limitations, jump before you're pushed, leap before you look.
180.author: Louise Mensch

181.quote: Typically, if you reward something, you get more of it. You punish something, you get less of it. And our businesses have been built for the last 150 years very much on that kind of motivational scheme.
181.author: Daniel H. Pink

182.quote: I believe that any type of education can be great, but an education about ourselves can create something wonderful. I am a comedian, but people have called me a motivational speaker. I don't really consider myself that at all.
182.author: Andy Andrews

183.quote: Success is the only motivational factor that a boy with character needs.
183.author: Woody Hayes

184.quote: As long as I'm not selling out the people that ride or die with me, I'm glad I'm not an MC. I'm a motivational speaker. I'm not that rapper dude.
184.author: Young Jeezy

185.quote: Giving back, doing motivational speeches and stuff like that, that's always made me feel good. If you repeatedly go out there, and you are the change that you want to see, then that's what you are.
185.author: Keke Palmer

186.quote: I want to be motivational and inspirational for everybody: my big aim is more women on bicycles.
186.author: Marianne Vos

187.quote: Give Obama a script he has made his own, and he is the motivational speaker to end all speakers. Tony Robbins cloned with Honest Abe.
187.author: Tina Brown

188.quote: My first book was called, 'Mountain, Get Out of My Way,' where I did an autobiographical sketch, if you will, looking back at myself and looking back at things in my life, and juxtaposing them against things that are happening in other people's lives and trying to be motivational.
188.author: Montel Williams

189.quote: To know oneself, one should assert oneself.
189.author: Albert Camus

190.quote: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.
190.author: Dean Koontz

191.quote: There is progress whether ye are going forward or backward! The thing is to move!
191.author: Edgar Cayce

194.quote: Don't fight the problem, decide it.
194.author: George C. Marshall

195.quote: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
195.author: George Herbert

196.quote: What is called genius is the abundance of life and health.
196.author: Henry David Thoreau

197.quote: How do you know you're going to do something, untill you do it?
197.author: J. D. Salinger

198.quote: Be thine own palace, or the world's thy jail.
198.author: John Donne

199.quote: We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change.
199.author: Katharine Hepburn

200.quote: I am not a has-been. I am a will be.
200.author: Lauren Bacall

202.quote: Your heaviest artillery will be your will to live. Keep that big gun going.
202.author: Norman Cousins

203.quote: It's always too early to quit.
203.author: Norman Vincent Peale

205.quote: Set yourself earnestly to see what you are made to do, and then set yourself earnestly to do it.
205.author: Phillips Brooks

206.quote: I know not age, nor weariness nor defeat.
206.author: Rose Kennedy

207.quote: If you don't ask, you don't get.
207.author: Stevie Wonder

208.quote: Don't give up. Don't lose hope. Don't sell out.
208.author: Christopher Reeve

209.quote: The weeds keep multiplying in our garden, which is our mind ruled by fear. Rip them out and call them by name.
209.author: Sylvia Browne

210.quote: I was motivated to be different in part because I was different.
210.author: Donna Brazile

211.quote: When you fail you learn from the mistakes you made and it motivates you to work even harder.
211.author: Natalie Gulbis

212.quote: You never know what motivates you.
212.author: Cicely Tyson

213.quote: It is very important to know who you are. To make decisions. To show who you are.
213.author: Malala Yousafzai

214.quote: I like to put on hardcore when I have to clean my apartment, which I hate to do, but it's motivational. I like old heavy metal when I'm outside working on my car. Music has definite functions for me.
214.author: Peter Steele

215.quote: People always accuse me of being motivational in a way, like it was a bad thing, but that's just how I was raised. My mom raised me in a positive environment, with lots of love in my heart, and that reflects in my music.
215.author: Lenny Kravitz

216.quote: I've always thought of acting as more of an exercise in empathy, which is not to be confused with sympathy. You're trying to get inside a certain emotional reality or motivational reality and try to figure out what that's about so you can represent it.
216.author: Edward Norton

217.quote: One of the things that I did before I ran for president is I was a professional speaker. Not a motivational speaker - an inspirational speaker. Motivation comes from within. You have to be inspired. That's what I do. I inspire people, I inspire the public, I inspire my staff. I inspired the organizations I took over to want to succeed.
217.author: Herman Cain

218.quote: Oh, I would love to be a motivational speaker. I have pulled myself out of a million potholes, and I can see the potholes ahead of me. That doesn't mean that I could always do that so perfectly for my own life. I totally fall in potholes.
218.author: Drew Barrymore

219.quote: I went to a motivational training course once, a course of self-discovery, and I found out after a week that my fear - it was not a fear of not being accepted - was a very violent fear of failure.
219.author: Emanuel Steward

220.quote: I'm going to write a book, continue acting, continue motivational speaking and just share with people who I am and what I've learned in my second chance of life and pass it on to people in their first chance of life.
220.author: J. R. Martinez

221.quote: I'm thrilled to continue my partnership with U by Kotex for Generation Know while helping to empower girls. I've always been a motivational resource for my younger sisters and hope I can positively impact and inspire other young girls too.
221.author: Khloe Kardashian

222.quote: Religious speech is extreme, emotional, and motivational. It is anti-literal, relying on metaphor, allusion, and other rhetorical devices, and it assumes knowledge within a community of believers.
222.author: Amy Waldman

223.quote: One day, I got so disgusted that I sat down and wrote a list called 'Justin's list of things to do before he kicks the bucket.' I wrote it for myself and shortened it to 'Justin's Bucket List.' It was there on the wall, not as a story idea but as a motivational tool for myself, which actually ended up working pretty well.
223.author: Justin Zackham

224.quote: I realized I love motivating and I love empowering and I love inspiring people. I did that as an athlete for 18 years, and I am able to do that as a motivational speaker now as well as doing work on television.
224.author: Dominique Dawes

225.quote: Marvin's Motivational Moments actually started as something that was actually therapeutic for me. I would sit up late at night after my wife passed trying to adjust to being alone.
225.author: Marvin Sapp

226.quote: I started doing motivational tours. I've seen all kinds of people, from the CEOs to the lowest executive, opening up to their fears. We don't introspect as much as we should.
226.author: Anupam Kher

227.quote: Crave for a thing, you will get it. Renounce the craving, the object will follow you by itself.
227.author: Swami Sivananda

228.quote: Earl Nightingale has inspired more people toward success and fortune than any other motivational speaker on the planet.
228.author: Zig Ziglar

229.quote: Our subliminal mental processes operate outside awareness because they arise in these portions of our mind that are inaccessible to our conscious self; their inaccessibility is due to the architecture of the brain rather than because they have been subject to Freudian motivational forces like repression.
229.author: Leonard Mlodinow

230.quote: The wise does at once what the fool does at last.
230.author: Baltasar Gracian

231.quote: Do not weep; do not wax indignant. Understand.
231.author: Baruch Spinoza

233.quote: I don't know what it's like to have a typical father figure. He's not the dad who's going to take me to the beach and go swimming, but he's such a motivational person.
233.author: Tiffany Trump

234.quote: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
234.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

235.quote: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
235.author: Swami Sivananda

236.quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
236.author: Helen Keller

237.quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
237.author: Steve Jobs

238.quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
238.author: Walt Whitman

239.quote: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
239.author: Audrey Hepburn

240.quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
240.author: John F. Kennedy

241.quote: Today I choose life. Every morning when I wake up I can choose joy, happiness, negativity, pain... To feel the freedom that comes from being able to continue to make mistakes and choices - today I choose to feel life, not to deny my humanity but embrace it.
241.author: Kevyn Aucoin

242.quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
242.author: Theodore Roosevelt

243.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
243.author: Norman Vincent Peale

245.quote: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
245.author: Milton Berle

246.quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
246.author: Jim Rohn

247.quote: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
247.author: Francis of Assisi

248.quote: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
248.author: Jimmy Dean

249.quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
249.author: Aristotle Onassis

250.quote: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
250.author: Buddha

251.quote: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
251.author: Joseph Campbell

252.quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
252.author: Vince Lombardi

253.quote: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
253.author: William Shakespeare

254.quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
254.author: Maya Angelou

255.quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
255.author: Aesop

256.quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
256.author: Rabindranath Tagore

257.quote: Let us sacrifice our today so that our children can have a better tomorrow.
257.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

258.quote: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.
258.author: Maya Angelou

259.quote: The undertaking of a new action brings new strength.
259.author: Richard L. Evans

260.quote: If you believe in yourself and have dedication and pride - and never quit, you'll be a winner. The price of victory is high but so are the rewards.
260.author: Paul Bryant

261.quote: Let us remember: One book, one pen, one child, and one teacher can change the world.
261.author: Malala Yousafzai

262.quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
262.author: Edith Wharton

263.quote: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
263.author: Joseph Campbell

264.quote: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.
264.author: Bruce Lee

265.quote: When the sun is shining I can do anything; no mountain is too high, no trouble too difficult to overcome.
265.author: Wilma Rudolph

266.quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'
266.author: Muhammad Ali

267.quote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
267.author: Buddha

268.quote: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
268.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

269.quote: Shoot for the moon and if you miss you will still be among the stars.
269.author: Les Brown

270.quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
270.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

271.quote: I believe in pink. I believe that laughing is the best calorie burner. I believe in kissing, kissing a lot. I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day and I believe in miracles.
271.author: Audrey Hepburn

272.quote: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
272.author: Ronald Reagan

273.quote: Every story I create, creates me. I write to create myself.
273.author: Octavia E. Butler

274.quote: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
274.author: George Eliot

275.quote: The bird is powered by its own life and by its motivation.
275.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

276.quote: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
276.author: Isaac Newton

277.quote: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.
277.author: Tony Robbins

278.quote: Don't limit yourself. Many people limit themselves to what they think they can do. You can go as far as your mind lets you. What you believe, remember, you can achieve.
278.author: Mary Kay Ash

279.quote: Give light, and the darkness will disappear of itself.
279.author: Desiderius Erasmus

280.quote: In a gentle way, you can shake the world.
280.author: Mahatma Gandhi

281.quote: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
281.author: Vince Lombardi

282.quote: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.
282.author: Robin Williams

283.quote: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
283.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

284.quote: If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.
284.author: Henry David Thoreau

285.quote: When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you, till it seems as though you could not hang on a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
285.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

286.quote: Keep all special thoughts and memories for lifetimes to come. Share these keepsakes with others to inspire hope and build from the past, which can bridge to the future.
286.author: Mattie Stepanek

287.quote: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
287.author: Martin Luther

288.quote: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
288.author: Unknown

289.quote: Live your beliefs and you can turn the world around.
289.author: Henry David Thoreau

290.quote: Two roads diverged in a wood and I - I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.
290.author: Robert Frost

291.quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
291.author: Rabindranath Tagore

292.quote: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors where there were only walls.
292.author: Joseph Campbell

293.quote: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.
293.author: Alexander the Great

294.quote: Happiness is a butterfly, which when pursued, is always just beyond your grasp, but which, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.
294.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

295.quote: Memories of our lives, of our works and our deeds will continue in others.
295.author: Rosa Parks

296.quote: Everyone here has the sense that right now is one of those moments when we are influencing the future.
296.author: Steve Jobs

297.quote: Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment.
297.author: Tony Robbins

298.quote: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
298.author: John Muir

299.quote: What great thing would you attempt if you knew you could not fail?
299.author: Robert H. Schuller

300.quote: God always gives His best to those who leave the choice with him.
300.author: Jim Elliot

301.quote: Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
301.author: Desmond Tutu

302.quote: Once we believe in ourselves, we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight, or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
302.author: e. e. cummings

303.quote: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
303.author: Earl Nightingale

304.quote: Be brave enough to live life creatively. The creative place where no one else has ever been.
304.author: Alan Alda

305.quote: The limits of the possible can only be defined by going beyond them into the impossible.
305.author: Arthur C. Clarke

306.quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
306.author: Plutarch

307.quote: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
307.author: Bertrand Russell

308.quote: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
308.author: Thomas A. Edison

309.quote: Let us dream of tomorrow where we can truly love from the soul, and know love as the ultimate truth at the heart of all creation.
309.author: Michael Jackson

310.quote: Everyone has inside of him a piece of good news. The good news is that you don't know how great you can be! How much you can love! What you can accomplish! And what your potential is!
310.author: Anne Frank

311.quote: From what we get, we can make a living; what we give, however, makes a life.
311.author: Arthur Ashe

312.quote: The only journey is the one within.
312.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

313.quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
313.author: Anne Frank

314.quote: I thank you God for this most amazing day, for the leaping greenly spirits of trees, and for the blue dream of sky and for everything which is natural, which is infinite, which is yes.
314.author: e. e. cummings

315.quote: A place for everything, everything in its place.
315.author: Benjamin Franklin

316.quote: Tomorrow is the most important thing in life. Comes into us at midnight very clean. It's perfect when it arrives and it puts itself in our hands. It hopes we've learned something from yesterday.
316.author: John Wayne

317.quote: What makes the desert beautiful is that somewhere it hides a well.
317.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

318.quote: Love is a fruit in season at all times, and within reach of every hand.
318.author: Mother Teresa

319.quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
319.author: Og Mandino

320.quote: With self-discipline most anything is possible.
320.author: Theodore Roosevelt

321.quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
321.author: Anne Frank

323.quote: The things that we love tell us what we are.
323.author: Thomas Aquinas

324.quote: I try not to put anything political on the forefront of what I'm trying to do creatively. At the same time, I do think it's wonderful when I hear people say that it's inspirational that I'm an Indian woman on camera. My life is very diverse, and my friends are a diverse group of people.
324.author: Mindy Kaling

325.quote: Keep your feet on the ground, but let your heart soar as high as it will. Refuse to be average or to surrender to the chill of your spiritual environment.
325.author: Arthur Helps

326.quote: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.
326.author: Democritus

327.quote: Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge.
327.author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

328.quote: Of all things visible, the highest is the heaven of the fixed stars.
328.author: Nicolaus Copernicus

329.quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
329.author: Anais Nin

331.quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
331.author: Marcus Aurelius

332.quote: If the doors of perception were cleansed everything would appear to man as it is, infinite.
332.author: William Blake

333.quote: From a small seed a mighty trunk may grow.
333.author: Aeschylus

335.quote: Vitality shows in not only the ability to persist but the ability to start over.
335.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

336.quote: It seems to me we can never give up longing and wishing while we are thoroughly alive. There are certain things we feel to be beautiful and good, and we must hunger after them.
336.author: George Eliot

337.quote: Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.
337.author: Hosea Ballou

338.quote: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
338.author: Napoleon Hill

339.quote: Your big opportunity may be right where you are now.
339.author: Napoleon Hill

340.quote: Every moment and every event of every man's life on earth plants something in his soul.
340.author: Thomas Merton

341.quote: I've been absolutely terrified every moment of my life - and I've never let it keep me from doing a single thing I wanted to do.
341.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

342.quote: You don't look out there for God, something in the sky, you look in you.
342.author: Alan Watts

343.quote: Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel.
343.author: Augustus Hare

344.quote: Your ordinary acts of love and hope point to the extraordinary promise that every human life is of inestimable value.
344.author: Desmond Tutu

345.quote: Most of us have far more courage than we ever dreamed we possessed.
345.author: Dale Carnegie

346.quote: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.
346.author: Michael Jordan

347.quote: I believe every human has a finite number of heartbeats. I don't intend to waste any of mine.
347.author: Neil Armstrong

349.quote: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
349.author: Warren Buffett

350.quote: It is always the simple that produces the marvelous.
350.author: Amelia Barr

351.quote: And when I breathed, my breath was lightning.
351.author: Black Elk

352.quote: Courage, my friends; 'tis not too late to build a better world.
352.author: Tommy Douglas

353.quote: If there were no night, we would not appreciate the day, nor could we see the stars and the vastness of the heavens. We must partake of the bitter with the sweet. There is a divine purpose in the adversities we encounter every day. They prepare, they purge, they purify, and thus they bless.
353.author: James E. Faust

354.quote: I am deliberate and afraid of nothing.
354.author: Audre Lorde

355.quote: One today is worth two tomorrows.
355.author: Benjamin Franklin

356.quote: Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit.
356.author: Bernard Williams

357.quote: Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed.
357.author: Blaise Pascal

358.quote: We are here to make another world.
358.author: W. Edwards Deming

360.quote: There is nothing stronger in the world than gentleness.
360.author: Han Suyin

361.quote: I believe in living today. Not in yesterday, nor in tomorrow.
361.author: Loretta Young

362.quote: Silence is the last thing the world will ever hear from me.
362.author: Marlee Matlin

363.quote: Once I knew only darkness and stillness... my life was without past or future... but a little word from the fingers of another fell into my hand that clutched at emptiness, and my heart leaped to the rapture of living.
363.author: Helen Keller

364.quote: In oneself lies the whole world and if you know how to look and learn, the door is there and the key is in your hand. Nobody on earth can give you either the key or the door to open, except yourself.
364.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

365.quote: Let every dawn be to you as the beginning of life, and every setting sun be to you as its close.
365.author: John Ruskin

366.quote: There are glimpses of heaven to us in every act, or thought, or word, that raises us above ourselves.
366.author: Robert Quillen

367.quote: Your heart is full of fertile seeds, waiting to sprout.
367.author: Morihei Ueshiba

368.quote: Our time here is magic! It's the only space you have to realize whatever it is that is beautiful, whatever is true, whatever is great, whatever is potential, whatever is rare, whatever is unique, in. It's the only space.
368.author: Ben Okri

369.quote: This CD became something of a personal journey for me. The tone of the whole CD is uplifting and inspirational. It's an upper. We have enough downers in the world.
369.author: Roma Downey

370.quote: I wanted to do something inspirational for my children.
370.author: Harvey Weinstein

371.quote: I do love to eavesdrop. It's inspirational, not only for subject matter but for actual dialogue, the way people talk.
371.author: Lynda Barry

372.quote: I do a lot of inspirational talks for kids, to motivate them to change their lives and give them hope.
372.author: Adam Beach

373.quote: What they have done in Japan, which I find so inspirational, is they've brought the toilet out from behind the locked door. They've made it conversational. People go out and upgrade their toilet. They talk about it. They've sanitized it.
373.author: Rose George

374.quote: I really think that it's disgusting that Paris is the only place where it is illegal for paps to follow you around. It actually took someone losing their life - Diana, an inspirational woman - and then it changed, but they still won't change it in London! It's horrible!
374.author: Cara Delevingne

375.quote: Men must live and create. Live to the point of tears.
375.author: Albert Camus

376.quote: It is by acts and not by ideas that people live.
376.author: Anatole France

377.quote: Be faithful to that which exists within yourself.
377.author: Andre Gide

378.quote: Try to be like the turtle - at ease in your own shell.
378.author: Bill Copeland

379.quote: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
379.author: Carol Burnett

381.quote: Act like you expect to get into the end zone.
381.author: Christopher Morley

382.quote: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong.
382.author: Ella Fitzgerald

383.quote: Find out who you are and be that person. That's what your soul was put on this Earth to be. Find that truth, live that truth and everything else will come.
383.author: Ellen DeGeneres

384.quote: The truth is on the march and nothing will stop it.
384.author: Emile Zola

385.quote: I believe that if one always looked at the skies, one would end up with wings.
385.author: Gustave Flaubert

386.quote: I believe that one defines oneself by reinvention. To not be like your parents. To not be like your friends. To be yourself. To cut yourself out of stone.
386.author: Henry Rollins

387.quote: There is a loftier ambition than merely to stand high in the world. It is to stoop down and lift mankind a little higher.
387.author: Henry Van Dyke

388.quote: Tears are often the telescope by which men see far into heaven.
388.author: Henry Ward Beecher

389.quote: I have always believed, and I still believe, that whatever good or bad fortune may come our way we can always give it meaning and transform it into something of value.
389.author: Hermann Hesse

390.quote: And above all things, never think that you're not good enough yourself. A man should never think that. My belief is that in life people will take you at your own reckoning.
390.author: Isaac Asimov

391.quote: Joy descends gently upon us like the evening dew, and does not patter down like a hailstorm.
391.author: Jean Paul

392.quote: Nothing is worth more than this day.
392.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

393.quote: I love those who yearn for the impossible.
393.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

394.quote: As people are walking all the time, in the same spot, a path appears.
394.author: John Locke

395.quote: Today is the only day. Yesterday is gone.
395.author: John Wooden

396.quote: Everything you want is out there waiting for you to ask. Everything you want also wants you. But you have to take action to get it.
396.author: Jules Renard

397.quote: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
397.author: Khalil Gibran

398.quote: Health is the greatest possession. Contentment is the greatest treasure. Confidence is the greatest friend. Non-being is the greatest joy.
398.author: Lao Tzu

399.quote: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
399.author: Lao Tzu

400.quote: If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it.
400.author: Lucy Larcom

401.quote: Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.
401.author: Marcus Aurelius

402.quote: Hope is but the dream of those who wake.
402.author: Matthew Prior

403.quote: A human being has so many skins inside, covering the depths of the heart. We know so many things, but we don't know ourselves! Why, thirty or forty skins or hides, as thick and hard as an ox's or bear's, cover the soul. Go into your own ground and learn to know yourself there.
403.author: Meister Eckhart

404.quote: The books that help you most are those which make you think that most. The hardest way of learning is that of easy reading; but a great book that comes from a great thinker is a ship of thought, deep freighted with truth and beauty.
404.author: Pablo Neruda

405.quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
405.author: Phillips Brooks

406.quote: When deeds speak, words are nothing.
406.author: Pierre-Joseph Proudhon

407.quote: Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself.
407.author: Plato

408.quote: Nothing makes one feel so strong as a call for help.
408.author: Pope Paul VI

409.quote: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
409.author: Richard Bach

410.quote: Ah, but a man's reach should exceed his grasp, Or what's a heaven for?
410.author: Robert Browning

411.quote: Every heart that has beat strongly and cheerfully has left a hopeful impulse behind it in the world, and bettered the tradition of mankind.
411.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

412.quote: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.
412.author: Thomas Jefferson

413.quote: We have it in our power to begin the world over again.
413.author: Thomas Paine

414.quote: A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.
414.author: Victor Hugo

415.quote: The most beautiful thing in the world is, of course, the world itself.
415.author: Wallace Stevens

416.quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.
416.author: Walt Whitman

417.quote: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
417.author: William Arthur Ward

418.quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today!
418.author: William Allen White

419.quote: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
419.author: Tony Robbins

420.quote: If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world.
420.author: Emmet Fox

421.quote: Learning how to be still, to really be still and let life happen - that stillness becomes a radiance.
421.author: Morgan Freeman

422.quote: You change your life by changing your heart.
422.author: Max Lucado

423.quote: Reach for it. Push yourself as far as you can.
423.author: Christa McAuliffe

424.quote: I believe there's an inner power that makes winners or losers. And the winners are the ones who really listen to the truth of their hearts.
424.author: Sylvester Stallone

426.quote: We relish news of our heroes, forgetting that we are extraordinary to somebody too.
426.author: Helen Hayes

428.quote: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.
428.author: Friedrich Schiller

429.quote: Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
429.author: Nido Qubein

430.quote: Give light and people will find the way.
430.author: Ella Baker

431.quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
431.author: Ben Okri

432.quote: God sleeps in the minerals, awakens in plants, walks in animals, and thinks in man.
432.author: Arthur Young

433.quote: Just what future the Designer of the universe has provided for the souls of men I do not know, I cannot prove. But I find that the whole order of Nature confirms my confidence that, if it is not like our noblest hopes and dreams, it will transcend them.
433.author: Henry Norris Russell

434.quote: From its brilliancy everything is illuminated.
434.author: Guru Nanak

435.quote: Without craftsmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind.
435.author: Johannes Brahms

436.quote: The handicap of deafness is not in the ear; it is in the mind.
436.author: Marlee Matlin

437.quote: A #2 pencil and a dream can take you anywhere.
437.author: Joyce Meyer

438.quote: I want to make this world perfect.
438.author: Malala Yousafzai

439.quote: When Maurice touched a keyboard, it was like something from a movie, magical. He would always give you something from a movie, and you'd go, what did you just play... immediately inspirational writings, amazing. That's what we're going to miss.
439.author: Robin Gibb

440.quote: I've done a lot of albums and I kinda know when I'm onto something that was inspirational for me to record and create, and this was one of those projects where I really enjoyed making the album.
440.author: Lee Ritenour

441.quote: Books are challenging and inspirational to me.
441.author: Amy Sedaris

442.quote: I hope that at the end of the seven years, people will say that I have been of some inspirational value to them at home in terms of inclusiveness and abroad, I look forward to representing Ireland.
442.author: Michael D. Higgins

443.quote: To me, the Seventies were very inspirational and very influential... With my whole persona as Snoop Dogg, as a person, as a rapper. I just love the Seventies style, the way all the players dressed nice, you know, kept their hair looking good, drove sharp cars and they talked real slick.
443.author: Snoop Dogg

444.quote: I grew up in a bookless house - my parents didn't read poetry, so if I hadn't had the chance to experience it at school I'd never have experienced it. But I loved English, and I was very lucky in that I had inspirational English teachers, Miss Scriven and Mr. Walker, and they liked us to learn poems by heart, which I found I loved doing.
444.author: Carol Ann Duffy

445.quote: Look at a football field. It looks like a big movie screen. This is theatre. Football combines the strategy of chess. It's part ballet. It's part battleground, part playground. We clarify, amplify and glorify the game with our footage, the narration and that music, and in the end create an inspirational piece of footage.
445.author: Steve Sabol

446.quote: I used to make up stuff in my bio all the time, that I used to be a professional ice-skater and stuff like that. I found it so inspirational. Why not make myself cooler than I am?
446.author: Stephen Colbert

447.quote: Roosevelt's declaration that Americans had 'nothing to fear but fear itself' was a glorious piece of inspirational rhetoric and just as gloriously wrong.
447.author: Russell Baker

448.quote: 'Do What You Gotta Do' is a positive, inspirational song that says no matter what it is; whether you're up against challenges or trying to get your dreams and aspirations met, you should do what whatever you have to do shy of killing yourself or someone else.
448.author: Angie Stone

449.quote: I think if there's something one needs to change with oneself, it doesn't have to happen in the New Year. You can do that any time you please - not that it's not a good inspirational tactic for the people that it works for.
449.author: Brittany Murphy

450.quote: Since we launched the original 'Pop Idol' in England, I've remained close with Simon Fuller. Working as executive producer on 'American idol' for its first seven years not only was an inspirational journey into the heart of American pop culture, it opened my eyes to the untapped potential of the incredibly dynamic young people in this world.
450.author: Nigel Lythgoe

451.quote: A concerted effort to preserve our heritage is a vital link to our cultural, educational, aesthetic, inspirational, and economic legacies - all of the things that quite literally make us who we are.
451.author: Steve Berry

452.quote: I love inspirational R&B, like Mary J. Blige and Jennifer Hudson. I want to do that. That kind of music stays with you.
452.author: Ashthon Jones

453.quote: Brand is not a product, that's for sure; it's not one item. It's an idea, it's a theory, it's a meaning, it's how you carry yourself. It's aspirational, it's inspirational.
453.author: Kevin Plank

454.quote: I don't dislike rappers or hip-hop or people who like it. I went to the Def Jam tour in Manchester in the '80s when rap was inspirational. Public Enemy were awesome. But it's all about status and bling now, and it doesn't say anything to me.
454.author: Noel Gallagher

455.quote: We've been surrounded by images of space our whole lives, from the speculative images of science fiction to the inspirational visions of artists to the increasingly beautiful pictures made possible by complex technologies. But whilst we have an overwhelmingly vivid visual understanding of space, we have no sense of what space sounds like.
455.author: Honor Harger

456.quote: All my music is inspirational. You just gotta listen to the words and get what you can get out of it.
456.author: Young Jeezy

457.quote: A lot of America is kind of done. People have been making films about it for 100 years. Everything to me feels used up. But Jo-Burg feels unbelievably inspirational to me.
457.author: Neill Blomkamp

458.quote: Reading was very important to me as a kid. It was very inspirational to me. I went to a school where that wasn't encouraged so much, but my parents encouraged that, and it has made me part of who I am.
458.author: Sasha Grey

459.quote: I had an inspirational teacher at my junior school: Peter Nixon. He was enthusiastic, knowledgeable and slightly scary - a good combination for a teacher.
459.author: Stephen Mangan

460.quote: I think anyone who has a passion for what they love to do, and who pursue it, is inspirational for me.
460.author: Colin Morgan

461.quote: Silent pictures show us how we lived and what our attitudes were. And as an art form, they can be wonderfully entertaining and often inspirational.
461.author: Kevin Brownlow

462.quote: Traveling around the country, meeting fans and hearing their stories in person and on my radio show has reenergized my commitment to creating honest and inspirational content that not only serves my own creative purposes but can help and touch others as well.
462.author: Nikki Sixx

463.quote: I had hoped when my life was chronicled, it would be an inspirational story.
463.author: Om Puri

464.quote: I want to be motivational and inspirational for everybody: my big aim is more women on bicycles.
464.author: Marianne Vos

465.quote: Business gives you a massive high. Doing a great deal, coming up with an inspirational solution... It's very addictive. But it doesn't last long. In isolation, it's a bit sterile. It doesn't reward the soul.
465.author: John Caudwell

466.quote: This is just rap. I'm not trying to make people think I'm some sort of scientific wizard or inspirational poet.
466.author: Action Bronson

467.quote: When I was working at the Sprint store, I got laid off. I was bummed out, but I stayed positive. I used the money I had earned while working there to make my first album. Without that job, maybe 'Corazon Sin Cara' would never had been made. It's a very inspirational story.
467.author: Prince Royce

468.quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
468.author: Confucius

469.quote: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
469.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

470.quote: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
470.author: William James

471.quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
471.author: George Bernard Shaw

472.quote: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
472.author: George Sand

473.quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
473.author: Buddha

474.quote: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
474.author: Charles R. Swindoll

475.quote: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
475.author: Omar Khayyam

476.quote: Education is not preparation for life; education is life itself.
476.author: John Dewey

477.quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
477.author: Steve Jobs

478.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
478.author: Marcus Aurelius

479.quote: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
479.author: Cesare Pavese

480.quote: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.
480.author: Joseph Campbell

481.quote: Today I choose life. Every morning when I wake up I can choose joy, happiness, negativity, pain... To feel the freedom that comes from being able to continue to make mistakes and choices - today I choose to feel life, not to deny my humanity but embrace it.
481.author: Kevyn Aucoin

482.quote: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
482.author: Elbert Hubbard

483.quote: The most important thing is to enjoy your life - to be happy - it's all that matters.
483.author: Audrey Hepburn

484.quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
484.author: Oscar Wilde

485.quote: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
485.author: Abraham Lincoln

486.quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
486.author: Soren Kierkegaard

487.quote: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
487.author: Stephen Hawking

488.quote: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
488.author: Joseph Campbell

489.quote: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
489.author: Audrey Hepburn

490.quote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
490.author: Voltaire

491.quote: Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. It turns denial into acceptance, chaos to order, confusion to clarity. It can turn a meal into a feast, a house into a home, a stranger into a friend.
491.author: Melody Beattie

492.quote: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
492.author: Sholom Aleichem

493.quote: Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick. Don't lose faith.
493.author: Steve Jobs

494.quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
494.author: Confucius

495.quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
495.author: Rabindranath Tagore

496.quote: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
496.author: Dalai Lama

497.quote: The truth is you don't know what is going to happen tomorrow. Life is a crazy ride, and nothing is guaranteed.
497.author: Eminem

498.quote: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.
498.author: Maya Angelou

499.quote: You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.
499.author: Joyce Meyer

500.quote: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
500.author: Charles R. Swindoll

501.quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition.
501.author: Steve Jobs

502.quote: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life.
502.author: Richard Bach

503.quote: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
503.author: Pablo Picasso

504.quote: My whole life is about winning. I don't lose often. I almost never lose.
504.author: Donald Trump

505.quote: Education is the key to success in life, and teachers make a lasting impact in the lives of their students.
505.author: Solomon Ortiz

506.quote: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
506.author: John F. Kennedy

507.quote: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
507.author: Baltasar Gracian

508.quote: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.
508.author: Bradley Whitford

509.quote: Stay true to yourself, yet always be open to learn. Work hard, and never give up on your dreams, even when nobody else believes they can come true but you. These are not cliches but real tools you need no matter what you do in life to stay focused on your path.
509.author: Phillip Sweet

510.quote: Music is a moral law. It gives soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination, and charm and gaiety to life and to everything.
510.author: Plato

511.quote: There are two great days in a person's life - the day we are born and the day we discover why.
511.author: William Barclay

512.quote: Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone's face? Did I say words of healing? Did I let go of my anger and resentment? Did I forgive? Did I love? These are the real questions. I must trust that the little bit of love that I sow now will bear many fruits, here in this world and the life to come.
512.author: Henri Nouwen

513.quote: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
513.author: Bertrand Russell

514.quote: Live life to the fullest, and focus on the positive.
514.author: Matt Cameron

515.quote: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.
515.author: Ashley Smith

516.quote: Over and over I marvel at the blessings of my life: Each year has grown better than the last.
516.author: Lawrence Welk

517.quote: At the end of the day, life is about being happy being who you are, and I feel like we are so blessed to have the support system and the best family to really just support each other no matter what we're going through.
517.author: Kim Kardashian

518.quote: The greatest thing about where my life is right now is it's very relaxed and chill. I'm just hanging out, being myself and doing my work.
518.author: Lucas Grabeel

519.quote: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live.
519.author: Norman Cousins

520.quote: Make it a habit to tell people thank you. To express your appreciation, sincerely and without the expectation of anything in return. Truly appreciate those around you, and you'll soon find many others around you. Truly appreciate life, and you'll find that you have more of it.
520.author: Ralph Marston

521.quote: Life is one big road with lots of signs. So when you riding through the ruts, don't complicate your mind. Flee from hate, mischief and jealousy. Don't bury your thoughts, put your vision to reality. Wake Up and Live!
521.author: Bob Marley

522.quote: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
522.author: Michael Jordan

523.quote: Throughout life people will make you mad, disrespect you and treat you bad. Let God deal with the things they do, cause hate in your heart will consume you too.
523.author: Will Smith

524.quote: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.
524.author: John Wooden

525.quote: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
525.author: Meister Eckhart

526.quote: Bad things do happen; how I respond to them defines my character and the quality of my life. I can choose to sit in perpetual sadness, immobilized by the gravity of my loss, or I can choose to rise from the pain and treasure the most precious gift I have - life itself.
526.author: Walter Anderson

527.quote: I'm most proud of the blessings that God has bestowed upon me, in my life. He's given me the vision to truly see that you can fall down, but you can still get back up. Hopefully I'll learn from my mistakes and have the opportunity to strengthen and improve the next thing I do.
527.author: Martin Lawrence

528.quote: Life is a song - sing it. Life is a game - play it. Life is a challenge - meet it. Life is a dream - realize it. Life is a sacrifice - offer it. Life is love - enjoy it.
528.author: Sai Baba

529.quote: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
529.author: Winston Churchill

530.quote: Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life. Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.
530.author: Golda Meir

531.quote: Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you'll start to see a big difference in your life.
531.author: Yoko Ono

532.quote: No one wants to die. Even people who want to go to heaven don't want to die to get there. And yet death is the destination we all share. No one has ever escaped it. And that is as it should be, because Death is very likely the single best invention of Life. It is Life's change agent. It clears out the old to make way for the new.
532.author: Steve Jobs

533.quote: If you live long enough, you'll make mistakes. But if you learn from them, you'll be a better person. It's how you handle adversity, not how it affects you. The main thing is never quit, never quit, never quit.
533.author: William J. Clinton

534.quote: Successful people maintain a positive focus in life no matter what is going on around them. They stay focused on their past successes rather than their past failures, and on the next action steps they need to take to get them closer to the fulfillment of their goals rather than all the other distractions that life presents to them.
534.author: Jack Canfield

535.quote: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
535.author: Joseph Campbell

536.quote: You may not always have a comfortable life and you will not always be able to solve all of the world's problems at once but don't ever underestimate the importance you can have because history has shown us that courage can be contagious and hope can take on a life of its own.
536.author: Michelle Obama

537.quote: My life motto is 'Do my best, so that I can't blame myself for anything.'
537.author: Magdalena Neuner

538.quote: Always keep your smile. That's how I explain my long life.
538.author: Jeanne Calment

539.quote: For the past 33 years, I have looked in the mirror every morning and asked myself: 'If today were the last day of my life, would I want to do what I am about to do today?' And whenever the answer has been 'No' for too many days in a row, I know I need to change something.
539.author: Steve Jobs

540.quote: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
540.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

541.quote: My theory on life is that life is beautiful. Life doesn't change. You have a day, and a night, and a month, and a year. We people change - we can be miserable or we can be happy. It's what you make of your life.
541.author: Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum

542.quote: You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future. You have to trust in something - your gut, destiny, life, karma, whatever. This approach has never let me down, and it has made all the difference in my life.
542.author: Steve Jobs

543.quote: When I am president, I will work to ensure that all of our kids are treated equally and protected equally. Every action I take, I will ask myself, 'Does this make life better for young Americans in Baltimore, Chicago, Detroit, Ferguson, who have as much of a right to live out their dreams as any other child America?'
543.author: Donald Trump

544.quote: Without music, life would be a mistake.
544.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

545.quote: The true secret of happiness lies in taking a genuine interest in all the details of daily life.
545.author: William Morris

546.quote: Our greatest happiness does not depend on the condition of life in which chance has placed us, but is always the result of a good conscience, good health, occupation, and freedom in all just pursuits.
546.author: Thomas Jefferson

547.quote: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.
547.author: Bruce Lee

548.quote: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.
548.author: Marcus Garvey

549.quote: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
549.author: Muhammad Ali

550.quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
550.author: Robert Frost

551.quote: I believe that if life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade... And try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.
551.author: Ron White

552.quote: Loneliness is my least favorite thing about life. The thing that I'm most worried about is just being alone without anybody to care for or someone who will care for me.
552.author: Anne Hathaway

553.quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'
553.author: Muhammad Ali

554.quote: Our heavenly Father understands our disappointment, suffering, pain, fear, and doubt. He is always there to encourage our hearts and help us understand that He's sufficient for all of our needs. When I accepted this as an absolute truth in my life, I found that my worrying stopped.
554.author: Charles Stanley

555.quote: There is no end to education. It is not that you read a book, pass an examination, and finish with education. The whole of life, from the moment you are born to the moment you die, is a process of learning.
555.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

556.quote: Happiness is a choice. You can choose to be happy. There's going to be stress in life, but it's your choice whether you let it affect you or not.
556.author: Valerie Bertinelli

557.quote: Trust is the glue of life. It's the most essential ingredient in effective communication. It's the foundational principle that holds all relationships.
557.author: Stephen Covey

558.quote: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
558.author: Mark Twain

559.quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
559.author: Plato

560.quote: So long as the memory of certain beloved friends lives in my heart, I shall say that life is good.
560.author: Helen Keller

561.quote: I'm just thankful for everything, all the blessings in my life, trying to stay that way. I think that's the best way to start your day and finish your day. It keeps everything in perspective.
561.author: Tim Tebow

562.quote: If you are not too long, I will wait here for you all my life.
