In other words, if we can learn to think about other people in a more positive and realistic way, it will be far easier to resolve conflicts and develop rewarding personal and professional relationships.
1496.author: David D. Burns

1497.quote: Stay positive and happy. Work hard and don't give up hope. Be open to criticism and keep learning. Surround yourself with happy, warm and genuine people.
1497.author: Tena Desae

1498.quote: The way positive reinforcement is carried out is more important than the amount.
1498.author: B. F. Skinner

1499.quote: And I have to work so hard at talking positively to myself. If I don't, it's just real hard to get through the day, and I'll get really down, and just want to cry. My whole body language changes. I get more slumped over.
1499.author: Delta Burke

1500.quote: A mediocre idea that generates enthusiasm will go further than a great idea that inspires no one.
1500.author: Mary Kay Ash

1501.quote: Every positive value has its price in negative terms... the genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.
1501.author: Pablo Picasso

1502.quote: When someone does something good, applaud! You will make two people happy.
1502.author: Samuel Goldwyn

1503.quote: My dear friend, clear your mind of cant.
1503.author: Samuel Johnson

1504.quote: As long as you as an individual... can convince yourself that in order to move forward as best you can you have to be optimistic, you can be described as 'one of the faithful,' one of those people who can say, 'Well, look, something's going to happen! Let's just keep trying. Let's not give up.
1504.author: Tom Hanks

1505.quote: There are powers inside of you which, if you could discover and use, would make of you everything you ever dreamed or imagined you could become.
1505.author: Orison Swett Marden

1506.quote: I like to encourage people to realize that any action is a good action if it's proactive and there is positive intent behind it.
1506.author: Michael J. Fox

1507.quote: I surround myself with positive, productive people of good will and decency.
1507.author: Ted Nugent

1508.quote: Even when bad things happen you have to try to use those bad things in a positive manner and really just take the positive out of it.
1508.author: Natalie du Toit

1509.quote: The best thing to do when you find yourself in a hurting or vulnerable place is to surround yourself with the strongest, finest, most positive people you know.
1509.author: Kristin Armstrong

1510.quote: Facing the press is not easy, but because you have to go, you have to try to take a lot of positive things for yourself from these face-to-face meetings.
1510.author: Jose Mourinho

1511.quote: I spent two years in the Army. And my older brother, who was also a great positive influence on me, encouraged me to think about law school, and I said - well, I didn't have any money.
1511.author: George J. Mitchell

1512.quote: Well, you know, a lot of people look at the negative things, the things that they did wrong and - which I do. But I like to stress on the things I did right, because there are certain things that I like to look at from a positive standpoint that are just positive reinforcement.
1512.author: Tiger Woods

1513.quote: I always figure from the cradle to the grave, we all have our individual journeys, and maybe my journey was a positive one and I accomplished certain things without stepping on too many toes.
1513.author: Robert Duvall

1514.quote: We must not fail to recognise that television can be a hugely positive influence in children's lives, one of the greatest educators in contemporary society and an increasing influence on all the children followed in 'Child of Our Time.'
1514.author: Robert Winston

1515.quote: I surf more now for other people than myself. I feel a lot of support from people wanting me to do well, and I feed off that. I can send a positive message to people from what I do.
1515.author: Kelly Slater

1516.quote: Positive social emotions like compassion and empathy are generally good for us, and we want to encourage them. But do we know how to most reliably raise children to care about the suffering of other people? I'm not sure we do.
1516.author: Sam Harris

1517.quote: As a tennis player, you have to get used to losing every week. Unless you win the tournament, you always go home as a loser. But you have to take the positive out of a defeat and go back to work. Improve to fail better.
1517.author: Stanislas Wawrinka

1518.quote: It can literally change someone's life; it's very positive for young teenagers to get into cosplay if they do it with their friends or with supervision from their parents - it can really foster their social skills.
1518.author: Yaya Han

1519.quote: I love 'Braxton Family Values!' I love seeing a strong family unit striving for success while dealing with everyday struggles like everyone else. Whatever drama they find themselves in, they find a way to solve it and get back to the importance of family. A positive show for sure.
1519.author: Drew Sidora

1520.quote: I learned to take those experiences that were difficult in my life and in the adversity that I had overcome to use it for a positive change.
1520.author: Dominique Moceanu

1521.quote: Confidence isn't optimism or pessimism, and it's not a character attribute. It's the expectation of a positive outcome.
1521.author: Rosabeth Moss Kanter

1522.quote: I am positive that I would see the end of child labour around the world in my lifetime, as the poorest of the poor have realised that education is a tool that can empower them.
1522.author: Kailash Satyarthi

1523.quote: If we could get your subconscious mind to agree with your conscious mind about being happy, that's when your positive thoughts work.
1523.author: Bruce Lipton

1524.quote: Adopting a really positive attitude can work wonders to adding years to your life, a spring to your step, a sparkle to your eye, and all of that.
1524.author: Christie Brinkley

1525.quote: The most positive men are the most credulous.
1525.author: Alexander Pope

1526.quote: The person who can bring the spirit of laughter into a room is indeed blessed.
1526.author: Bennett Cerf

1527.quote: When I learn something new - and it happens every day - I feel a little more at home in this universe, a little more comfortable in the nest.
1527.author: Bill Moyers

1528.quote: I feel that sin and evil are the negative part of you, and I think it's like a battery: you've got to have the negative and the positive in order to be a complete person.
1528.author: Dolly Parton

1529.quote: Today or any day that phone may ring and bring good news.
1529.author: Ethel Waters

1530.quote: My optimism wears heavy boots and is loud.
1530.author: Henry Rollins

1531.quote: I've always believed that you can think positive just as well as you can think negative.
1531.author: James A. Baldwin

1532.quote: I think anything is possible if you have the mindset and the will and desire to do it and put the time in.
1532.author: Roger Clemens

1533.quote: Wondrous is the strength of cheerfulness, and its power of endurance - the cheerful man will do more in the same time, will do it; better, will preserve it longer, than the sad or sullen.
1533.author: Thomas Carlyle

1534.quote: If you are given a chance to be a role model, I think you should always take it because you can influence a person's life in a positive light, and that's what I want to do. That's what it's all about.
1534.author: Tiger Woods

1535.quote: A good laugh is sunshine in the house.
1535.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

1536.quote: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.
1536.author: Zig Ziglar

1537.quote: Like success, failure is many things to many people. With Positive Mental Attitude, failure is a learning experience, a rung on the ladder, a plateau at which to get your thoughts in order and prepare to try again.
1537.author: W. Clement Stone

1538.quote: People deal too much with the negative, with what is wrong. Why not try and see positive things, to just touch those things and make them bloom?
1538.author: Nhat Hanh

1539.quote: You must not under any pretense allow your mind to dwell on any thought that is not positive, constructive, optimistic, kind.
1539.author: Emmet Fox

1540.quote: A lot of times people look at the negative side of what they feel they can't do. I always look on the positive side of what I can do.
1540.author: Chuck Norris

1541.quote: I am not embarrassed to tell you that I believe in miracles.
1541.author: Corazon Aquino

1542.quote: When you are enthusiastic about what you do, you feel this positive energy. It's very simple.
1542.author: Paulo Coelho

1543.quote: A positive attitude is something everyone can work on, and everyone can learn how to employ it.
1543.author: Joan Lunden

1544.quote: Look at people for an example, but then make sure to do things your way. Surround yourself with positive people.
1544.author: Queen Latifah

1545.quote: Dream small dreams. If you make them too big, you get overwhelmed and you don't do anything. If you make small goals and accomplish them, it gives you the confidence to go on to higher goals.
1545.author: John H. Johnson

1546.quote: I don't want to waste anyone's time or money. I want to give people some truth and positive heart lift.
1546.author: Mos Def

1547.quote: I believe that you should gravitate to people who are doing productive and positive things with their lives.
1547.author: Nadia Comaneci

1548.quote: I'm totally into new age and self-help books. I used to work in a bookstore and that's the section they gave me, and I got way into it. I just loved the power of positive thinking, letting yourself go.
1548.author: Jason Mraz

1549.quote: Instead of hating, I have chosen to forgive and spend all of my positive energy on changing the world.
1549.author: Camryn Manheim

1550.quote: Chaotic people often have chaotic lives, and I think they create that. But if you try and have an inner peace and a positive attitude, I think you attract that.
1550.author: Imelda Staunton

1551.quote: Say and do something positive that will help the situation; it doesn't take any brains to complain.
1551.author: Robert A. Cook

1552.quote: When push comes to shove, it ain't the science that's going to lift you up - it's the belief, the spiritual side of life, that's going to lift you up, no matter what religion you are.
1552.author: Kirstie Alley

1553.quote: I think a lot of times we don't pay enough attention to people with a positive attitude because we assume they are naive or stupid or unschooled.
1553.author: Amy Adams

1554.quote: I believe in karma, and I believe if you put out positive vibes to everybody, that's all you're going to get back.
1554.author: Kesha

1555.quote: I'm taking all the negatives in my life, and turning them into a positive.
1555.author: Pitbull

1556.quote: Talking is always positive. That's why I talk too much.
1556.author: Louis C. K.

1557.quote: Positive thinking is more than just a tagline. It changes the way we behave. And I firmly believe that when I am positive, it not only makes me better, but it also makes those around me better.
1557.author: Harvey Mackay

1558.quote: We succeed in enterprises which demand the positive qualities we possess, but we excel in those which can also make use of our defects.
1558.author: Alexis de Tocqueville

1559.quote: Having a positive mental attitude is asking how something can be done rather than saying it can't be done.
1559.author: Bo Bennett

1560.quote: Frustration, although quite painful at times, is a very positive and essential part of success.
1560.author: Bo Bennett

1561.quote: In our music, in our everyday life, there are so many negative things. Why not have something positive and stamp it with blackness?
1561.author: Jamie Foxx

1562.quote: The British system had requirements, including Latin. I'm not positive you ever had to know Greek, but there are certainly kinds of curricula where you had to know Greek too. I think in Britain there was the most mindless, repetitive sort of learning.
1562.author: William Scott

1563.quote: There is little difference in people, but that little difference makes a big difference. The little difference is attitude. The big difference is whether it is positive or negative.
1563.author: W. Clement Stone

1564.quote: Black Consciousness is an attitude of the mind and a way of life, the most positive call to emanate from the black world for a long time.
1564.author: Steven Biko

1565.quote: I do not expect the white media to create positive black male images.
1565.author: Huey Newton

1566.quote: The large ensemble cast and the fact that it was being shot in New York, combined with a lot of strong positive images as far as African Americans are concerned, really turned me on to The Best Man.
1566.author: Taye Diggs

1567.quote: I was very pleased that the positive things about me and my game outshone the aggressive style of play I use. I would never tone that down, because I believe in that style of play, and I believe that you can play rough on the court and still be a good sport.
1567.author: Sue Wicks

1568.quote: The result is - document destruction - we're really not going to be able to prove beyond a truth the negatives and some of the positive conclusions that we're going to come to. There will be always unresolved ambiguity here.
1568.author: David Kay

1569.quote: I feel blessed to be here representing our country and carrying out th research of scientists around the world... I hope you could feel the positive energy that beamed to the whole planet as we glided over.
1569.author: Laurel Clark

1570.quote: Christians were instructed to serve others, and the thanksgiving was for the grace of God and the fact that God offered a way for man to return to a positive relationship with Him.
1570.author: John Clayton

1571.quote: It was great fun. We had gone on tour in between the sessions and reconnected with the audience and got a lot of energy back from them, a lot of positive energy.
1571.author: Roger Andrew Taylor

1572.quote: The Games are just a nice, positive way to build friendships, camaraderie and, of course, self-esteem. Plus, the Games are a great opportunity for people to participate in sports who normally wouldn't.
1572.author: Greg Louganis

1573.quote: Either positive or negative comments are good because it shows I am still relevant.
1573.author: Justin Guarini

1574.quote: Instead of yelling and spanking, which don't work anyway, I believe in finding creative ways to keep their attention - turning things into a game, for instance. And, when they do something good, positive reinforcement and praise.
1574.author: Patricia Richardson

1575.quote: The object of my relationship with Vietnam has been to heal the wounds that exist, particularly among our veterans, and to move forward with a positive relationship,... Apparently some in the Vietnamese government don't want to do that and that's their decision.
1575.author: Ho Chi Minh

1576.quote: The most important thing is to stay positive.
1576.author: Saku Koivu

1577.quote: More Americans own their home than ever before. Nearly 70 percent of American's are homeowners. So it is a good time for us to asses the positive impacts of homeownership on families, communities and on the nation's economy.
1577.author: Randy Neugebauer

1578.quote: Positive thinking is the key to success in business, education, pro football, anything that you can mention. I go out there thinking that I'm going to complete every pass.
1578.author: Ron Jaworski

1579.quote: For to be poised against fatality, to meet adverse conditions gracefully, is more than simple endurance; it is an act of aggression, a positive triumph.
1579.author: Thomas Mann

1580.quote: Sexy in India is not considered positive. But, with today's crop of fresh faces in the modelling arena, being sexy is an asset.
1580.author: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan

1581.quote: You can't live a positive life with a negative mind and if you have a positive outcome you have a positive income and just to have more positivity and just to kind of laugh it off.
1581.author: Miley Cyrus

1582.quote: I think fitness is important. I think a healthy lifestyle is important. I think putting positive energy out there is important and just staying connected with the people.
1582.author: LL Cool J

1583.quote: I have played on many teams throughout my career, and I know when a team has the tools, and the right positive attitude towards winning.
1583.author: Boomer Esiason

1584.quote: I've realized the extraordinary power of sports to heal, unite and inspire. I believe the Olympics will serve as the ultimate platform to provide positive changes and I hope to inspire all of Japan through my strong showing there.
1584.author: Kohei Uchimura

1585.quote: We should be the pro-legal immigration party. A party that has a positive platform and agenda on how we can create a legal immigration system that works for immigrants and works for America.
1585.author: Marco Rubio

1586.quote: I can't let time move on without fighting tooth and nail and hopefully being a part of a revolution that is positive.
1586.author: Ian Somerhalder

1587.quote: I had to develop the mentality and stay positive about making my comeback.
1587.author: Alonzo Mourning

1588.quote: I am a positive person. I never think of the glass as half empty. I just keep pushing forward.
1588.author: Rosie Perez

1589.quote: I try to make the good days great and take something positive from the days I'm not feeling good - work on technique or something like that.
1589.author: Katie Ledecky

1590.quote: I realize I will always be the poster child for police brutality, but I can try to use that as a positive force for healing and restraint.
1590.author: Rodney King

1591.quote: I hope the millions of people I've touched have the optimism and desire to share their goals and hard work and persevere with a positive attitude.
1591.author: Michael Jordan

1592.quote: You can make positive deposits in your own economy every day by reading and listening to powerful, positive, life-changing content and by associating with encouraging and hope-building people.
1592.author: Zig Ziglar

1593.quote: I'm an algebra liar. I figure two good lies make a positive.
1593.author: Tim Allen

1594.quote: It's a positive thing to talk about terrible things and make people laugh about them.
1594.author: Louis C. K.

1595.quote: I just believe in the goodwill of people, the power of people to do something positive.
1595.author: Eddie Izzard

1596.quote: I realized that if my thoughts immediately affect my body, I should be careful about what I think. Now if I get angry, I ask myself why I feel that way. If I can find the source of my anger, I can turn that negative energy into something positive.
1596.author: Yoko Ono

1597.quote: I like video games, I like tech, I like being positive.
1597.author: Jimmy Fallon

1598.quote: I had many teachers that were great, positive role models and taught me to be a good person and stand up and be a good man. A lot of the principals they taught me still affect how I act sometimes and it's 30 years later.
1598.author: Kevin James

1599.quote: But you see, our society is still trapped in this binary, black/white logic and that has had some very positive implications for our generation. It's had some very negative ones as well and one of the negative ones is that it creates enormous identity problems for people who have one black ancestor and all white ancestors for example.
1599.author: Henry Louis Gates

1600.quote: Optimists are usually wrong. But all the great change in history, positive change, was done by optimists.
1600.author: Thomas Friedman

1601.quote: To have the chance to see your music be elevated and to have almost universally positive response to that music, makes me feel better every day. I feel more confident and inspired, and that's fun.
1601.author: John Legend

1602.quote: 'Do What You Gotta Do' is a positive, inspirational song that says no matter what it is; whether you're up against challenges or trying to get your dreams and aspirations met, you should do what whatever you have to do shy of killing yourself or someone else.
1602.author: Angie Stone

1603.quote: Kids go to school and college and get through, but they don't seem to really care about using their minds. School doesn't have the kind of long term positive impact that it should.
1603.author: Howard Gardner

1604.quote: Perhaps trying to move away from my problems and focus on the positive is the best I can do.
1604.author: Jenni Rivera

1605.quote: When you're a houseguest and you leave, it's nice to straighten something up or send your hosts a useful gift. And when you leave the planet, it's nice to have made a positive contribution.
1605.author: Alexander Payne

1606.quote: To protect people's lives and keep our children safe, we must implement public-works spending and do so proudly. If possible, I'd like to see the Bank of Japan purchase all of the construction bonds that we need to issue to cover the cost. That would also forcefully circulate money in the market. That would be positive for the economy, too.
1606.author: Shinzo Abe

1607.quote: I'm a big cockeyed optimist. I try to accentuate the positive as opposed to the negative.
1607.author: Betty White

1608.quote: I have my team. Like if you see everyone around me - I have my hair and makeup girl, my assistant. They're very calm, they're all about positive energy. There're no drama queens. Everyone wants everyone else to have a positive experience. There are no agendas. I think it creates a healthy environment and there are no boundaries to cross.
1608.author: Fergie

1609.quote: More brands are waking up to their social responsibility and doing good work through cause marketing campaigns. Yet too many still go about it the wrong way. I mean 'wrong' in two senses. Firstly, they are marketing ineffectively, and secondly, as a consequence their positive social impact is not maximized.
1609.author: Simon Mainwaring

1610.quote: You have a lot of ups and downs in coaching, especially, but I can't remember any bad times at this point. I mean, they're all good. A lot of tears when you lose, a lot of down times, but I can't remember any of them. They're all positive now. Even the bad times were good.
1610.author: Don Nelson

1611.quote: Sometimes negative news does come out, but it is often exaggerated and manipulated to spread scandal. Journalists sometimes risk becoming ill from coprophilia and thus fomenting coprophagia: which is a sin that taints all men and women, that is, the tendency to focus on the negative rather than the positive aspects.
1611.author: Pope Francis

1612.quote: I think if you just look at life in a positive way, positive things will happen.
1612.author: Jake Owen

1613.quote: Nearly all inventions are not recognised for their positive side either when they're made. So, for example, scientists didn't go out to design a CD machine: they designed a laser. But we got all sorts of things from a laser which we never remotely imagined, and we're still finding things for a laser to do.
1613.author: Robert Winston

1614.quote: We must not constantly talk about tackling obesity and warning people about the negative consequences of obesity. Instead we must be positive - positive about the fun and benefits to be had from healthy living, trying to get rid of people's excuses for being obese by tackling the issue in a positive way.
1614.author: Andrew Lansley

1615.quote: Love is a positive, symbiotic, reciprocal flow between two or more entities.
1615.author: Inga Muscio

1616.quote: Very gifted people, they win and they win, and they are told that they win because they are a winner. That seems like a positive thing to tell children, but ultimately, what that means is when they lose, it must make them a loser.
1616.author: Joshua Waitzkin

1617.quote: All personality traits have their good side and their bad side. But for a long time, we've seen introversion only through its negative side and extroversion mostly through its positive side.
1617.author: Susan Cain

1618.quote: I am happy to say that everyone that I have met in my life, I have gained something from them; be it negative or positive, it has enforced and reinforced my life in some aspect.
1618.author: Walter Payton

1619.quote: When you think positive, good things happen.
1619.author: Matt Kemp

1620.quote: The greatest gift of all time is that you can make creation infectious because people spend less time being negative... If you log all the time with negativity in the while world, I wonder how much better the world would be if people sat down and did something positive. It spirals.
1620.author: Skrillex

1621.quote: Life is short, youth is finite, and opportunities endless. Have you found the intersection of your passion and the potential for world-shaping positive impact? If you don't have a great idea of your own, there are plenty of great teams that need you - unknown startups and established teams in giant companies alike.
1621.author: Justin Rosenstein

1622.quote: It is a blessing to have pretty people around me. I like people who are sparky, positive. Evil, dark people are repelled by me: 'Oooh no! Too much sunlight.'
1622.author: Geri Halliwell

1623.quote: Decades of research have shown that most happy families communicate effectively. But talking doesn't mean simply 'talking through problems,' as important as that is. Talking also means telling a positive story about yourselves.
1623.author: Bruce Feiler

1624.quote: I love meeting people, and I know it's so difficult for people to come up to me and introduce themselves, so when they do, I'll grab them and hug them. It makes their day, you know? I love that, and I get positive energy from that.
1624.author: Nicola Formichetti

1625.quote: You have to train your brain to be positive just like you work out your body.
1625.author: Shawn Achor

1626.quote: In my work in Haiti, I've seen the hugely positive effects that happen when people come together to build something in the middle of the most desperate situations.
1626.author: Olivia Wilde

1627.quote: I think it takes a strong man to be in a relationship with a strong woman. A lot of people hear the word 'diva' and think of it as a negative. I see it as a positive. I want somebody who knows what they want out of life and isn't afraid to show it.
1627.author: Nick Cannon

1628.quote: If you look at attitudes today and where they are headed, it's clear to me that supporting equal rights, including the rights to civil marriage, is a net positive for winning elections, as well as the right thing to do.
1628.author: Ken Mehlman

1629.quote: I learned one thing - never hate a positive option.
1629.author: Kevin Garnett

1630.quote: Sometimes, reading my own media, the negativity can upset me, but I just deal with things on a positive basis. I mean, I have up to 20,000 people singing my words back to me on a nightly basis - they share my hopes and fears, and they relate to my own life experiences. Life can be pretty isolating, but that connection is always amazing.
1630.author: James Blunt

1631.quote: If you look at the history of technology over a couple hundred years, it's all about time compression and making the globe smaller. It's had positive effects, all the ones that we know. So we're much less likely to have the kind of terrible misunderstandings that led to World War I, for example.
1631.author: Eric Schmidt

1632.quote: Man, I'm 31 years old and a husband with four kids; I hope I'm no thug. I hear all those negative things and don't hear anything positive. I think that's all those people feel... that way that's all they hear about when you hear Allen Iverson did something negative or something.
1632.author: Allen Iverson

1633.quote: Positive health means becoming whole-heartedly engaged with our own health care. It means not outsourcing our health to the health care system. It means getting rid of the fear and paralysis we too often feel, and instead cultivating a sense of agency.
1633.author: Jane McGonigal

1634.quote: I'm a very positive person. My grandmother taught me that happiness is both a skill and a decision, and you are responsible for the outcome.
1634.author: Helen McCrory

1635.quote: I am not a big fan of positive thinking. The term suggests that there is something negative that you have to counteract by being positive. That is an artificial duality.
1635.author: Srikumar Rao

1636.quote: You can have meaning, accomplishment, engagement and good relationships, even if you are dull on the positive affect side.
1636.author: Martin Seligman

1637.quote: Live your days on the positive side of life, in tune with your most treasured values. And in each moment you'll have much to live for.
1637.author: Ralph Marston

1638.quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
1638.author: Euripides

1639.quote: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
1639.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

1640.quote: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
1640.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

1641.quote: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.
1641.author: Ann Landers

1642.quote: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
1642.author: Thomas Aquinas

1643.quote: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
1643.author: Helen Keller

1644.quote: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
1644.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

1645.quote: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.
1645.author: Henry Van Dyke

1646.quote: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
1646.author: Walter Winchell

1647.quote: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.
1647.author: Henry Ford

1648.quote: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
1648.author: Khalil Gibran

1649.quote: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
1649.author: Mencius

1650.quote: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
1650.author: Jim Morrison

1651.quote: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
1651.author: Charles R. Swindoll

1652.quote: Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.
1652.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

1653.quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
1653.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1654.quote: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
1654.author: Baltasar Gracian

1655.quote: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
1655.author: Leo Buscaglia

1656.quote: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
1656.author: Euripides

1657.quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
1657.author: William Butler Yeats

1658.quote: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
1658.author: Muhammad Ali

1659.quote: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
1659.author: Octavia Butler

1660.quote: Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
1660.author: Albert Camus

1661.quote: When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand.
1661.author: Henri Nouwen

1662.quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
1662.author: Marcel Proust

1663.quote: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
1663.author: Orson Welles

1664.quote: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
1664.author: John Wooden

1665.quote: In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.
1665.author: Khalil Gibran

1666.quote: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.
1666.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

1667.quote: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.
1667.author: Thomas Jefferson

1668.quote: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.
1668.author: Jean de La Fontaine

1669.quote: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.
1669.author: Aristotle

1670.quote: In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
1670.author: Albert Schweitzer

1671.quote: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life.
1671.author: Jean de La Fontaine

1672.quote: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.
1672.author: William Blake

1673.quote: Things are never quite as scary when you've got a best friend.
1673.author: Bill Watterson

1674.quote: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
1674.author: Doug Larson

1675.quote: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
1675.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1676.quote: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
1676.author: Saint Basil

1677.quote: Friends and good manners will carry you where money won't go.
1677.author: Margaret Walker

1678.quote: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?
1678.author: Abraham Lincoln

1679.quote: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
1679.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

1680.quote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
1680.author: Walt Whitman

1681.quote: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
1681.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1682.quote: True friends stab you in the front.
1682.author: Oscar Wilde

1683.quote: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
1683.author: Bruce Lee

1684.quote: The two most misused words in the entire English vocabulary are love and friendship. A true friend would die for you, so when you start trying to count them on one hand, you don't need any fingers.
1684.author: Larry Flynt

1685.quote: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.
1685.author: Henry David Thoreau

1686.quote: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
1686.author: Henry David Thoreau

1687.quote: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
1687.author: Charles Caleb Colton

1688.quote: If you have one true friend you have more than your share.
1688.author: Thomas Fuller

1689.quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
1689.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1690.quote: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
1690.author: Thomas Jefferson

1691.quote: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
1691.author: Arnold H. Glasow

1692.quote: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
1692.author: Chanakya

1693.quote: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
1693.author: Mencius

1694.quote: Never make friends with people who are above or below you in status. Such friendships will never give you any happiness.
1694.author: Chanakya

1695.quote: A friend is a gift you give yourself.
1695.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

1696.quote: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them.
1696.author: Francesco Guicciardini

1697.quote: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
1697.author: Elbert Hubbard

1698.quote: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
1698.author: Henry David Thoreau

1699.quote: Yes'm, old friends is always best, 'less you can catch a new one that's fit to make an old one out of.
1699.author: Sarah Orne Jewett

1700.quote: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
1700.author: Len Wein

1701.quote: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
1701.author: Oscar Wilde

1702.quote: I think it's important to have closure in any relationship that ends - from a romantic relationship to a friendship. You should always have a sense of clarity at the end and know why it began and why it ended. You need that in your life to move cleanly into your next phase.
1702.author: Jennifer Aniston

1703.quote: Experts on romance say for a happy marriage there has to be more than a passionate love. For a lasting union, they insist, there must be a genuine liking for each other. Which, in my book, is a good definition for friendship.
1703.author: Marilyn Monroe

1704.quote: Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best.
1704.author: John Webster

1705.quote: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.
1705.author: Benjamin Franklin

1706.quote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
1706.author: C. S. Lewis

1707.quote: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.
1707.author: Charles Darwin

1708.quote: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.
1708.author: Herodotus

1709.quote: Dad needs to show an incredible amount of respect and humor and friendship toward his mate so the kids understand their parents are sexy, they're fun, they do things together, they're best friends. Kids learn by example. If I respect Mom, they're going to respect Mom.
1709.author: Tim Allen

1710.quote: Loyalty and friendship, which is to me the same, created all the wealth that I've ever thought I'd have.
1710.author: Ernie Banks

1711.quote: Be true to yourself. Make each day a masterpiece. Help others. Drink deeply from good books. Make friendship a fine art. Build a shelter against a rainy day.
1711.author: John Wooden

1712.quote: A youth, when at home, should be filial and, abroad, respectful to his elders. He should be earnest and truthful. He should overflow in love to all and cultivate the friendship of the good. When he has time and opportunity, after the performance of these things, he should employ them in polite studies.
1712.author: Confucius

1713.quote: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
1713.author: Elbert Hubbard

1714.quote: Many a friendship, long, loyal, and self-sacrificing, rested at first on no thicker a foundation than a kind word.
1714.author: Frederick William Faber

1715.quote: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
1715.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

1716.quote: What I cannot love, I overlook. Is that real friendship?
1716.author: Anais Nin

1717.quote: Depth of friendship does not depend on length of acquaintance.
1717.author: Rabindranath Tagore

1718.quote: Look, I worked with American Republican presidents and Democratic presidents, all of them, and each of them has shown a deep and profound friendship to Israel, you know? I can't remember anybody who was in that sense negative as far as Israel is concerned.
1718.author: Shimon Peres

1719.quote: Sustaining true friendship is a lot more challenging than we give it credit for.
1719.author: Mariella Frostrup

1720.quote: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
1720.author: Aristotle

1721.quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
1721.author: Socrates

1722.quote: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
1722.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1723.quote: Great is the victory, but the friendship of all is greater.
1723.author: Emil Zatopek

1724.quote: Friendship may, and often does, grow into love, but love never subsides into friendship.
1724.author: Lord Byron

1725.quote: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.
1725.author: Hanya Yanagihara

1726.quote: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
1726.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

1727.quote: Friendship is a word, the very sight of which in print makes the heart warm.
1727.author: Augustine Birrell

1728.quote: Friendship at first sight, like love at first sight, is said to be the only truth.
1728.author: Herman Melville

1729.quote: When friendship disappears then there is a space left open to that awful loneliness of the outside world which is like the cold space between the planets. It is an air in which men perish utterly.
1729.author: Hilaire Belloc

1730.quote: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.
1730.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1731.quote: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
1731.author: Thomas A. Edison

1732.quote: She is a friend of mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order. It's good, you know, when you got a woman who is a friend of your mind.
1732.author: Toni Morrison

1733.quote: Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.
1733.author: Washington Irving

1734.quote: It seems to me that trying to live without friends is like milking a bear to get cream for your morning coffee. It is a whole lot of trouble, and then not worth much after you get it.
1734.author: Zora Neale Hurston

1735.quote: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
1735.author: St. Jerome

1736.quote: Love is friendship set on fire.
1736.author: Jeremy Taylor

1737.quote: Friendship with ones self is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
1737.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

1738.quote: Only solitary men know the full joys of friendship. Others have their family; but to a solitary and an exile his friends are everything.
1738.author: Warren G. Harding

1739.quote: Time makes friendship stronger, but love weaker.
1739.author: Jean de la Bruyere

1740.quote: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
1740.author: Jane Austen

1741.quote: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
1741.author: Michel de Montaigne

1742.quote: Few things tend more to alienate friendship than a want of punctuality in our engagements. I have known the breach of a promise to dine or sup to break up more than one intimacy.
1742.author: William Hazlitt

1743.quote: Friendship always benefits; love sometimes injures.
1743.author: Seneca

1744.quote: The fact is, with every friendship you make, and every bond of trust you establish, you are shaping the image of America projected to the rest of the world. That is so important. So when you study abroad, you're actually helping to make America stronger.
1744.author: Michelle Obama

1745.quote: India-Seychelles relations have been characterized by close friendship, understanding and cooperation.
1745.author: Pratibha Patil

1746.quote: On one side, citizens have great respect for the United States; they have a great feeling of friendship. That is solid. But in the opposition and in the political arena I often find criticism of the closeness of relations with the United States. That is a reality.
1746.author: Vicente Fox

1747.quote: One look at an email can rob you of 15 minutes of focus. One call on your cell phone, one tweet, one instant message can destroy your schedule, forcing you to move meetings, or blow off really important things, like love, and friendship.
1747.author: Jacqueline Leo

1748.quote: Men and women can absolutely be friends, and that's what we need to be. Part of the problem is that we aren't friends enough. Our relationships are negotiations, and that is not friendship.
1748.author: Hill Harper

1749.quote: Most people are enduring a marginalized isolation. One of the great obstacles to modern friendships is the 'religion of rush.' People are rushing all the time through time. Friendship takes time.
1749.author: John O'Donohue

1750.quote: I have enjoyed most particularly reading the correspondence between Gustav Mahler and Richard Strauss. The genuine friendship, competitiveness and support that thread through their communications are life lessons for us all.
1750.author: Jessye Norman

1751.quote: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
1751.author: Alice Walker

1752.quote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
1752.author: Anais Nin

1753.quote: Men kick friendship around like a football, but it doesn't seem to crack. Women treat it like glass and it goes to pieces.
1753.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

1754.quote: A friend to all is a friend to none.
1754.author: Aristotle

1755.quote: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
1755.author: Baltasar Gracian

1756.quote: It is only the great hearted who can be true friends. The mean and cowardly, Can never know what true friendship means.
1756.author: Charles Kingsley

1757.quote: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.
1757.author: Confucius

1758.quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
1758.author: Elie Wiesel

1760.quote: The best time to make friends is before you need them.
1760.author: Ethel Barrymore

1761.quote: The real test of friendship is: can you literally do nothing with the other person? Can you enjoy those moments of life that are utterly simple?
1761.author: Eugene Kennedy

1762.quote: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.
1762.author: Euripides

1763.quote: Rejoicing in our joy, not suffering over our suffering, makes someone a friend.
1763.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1764.quote: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
1764.author: George Santayana

1765.quote: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
1765.author: George Washington

1766.quote: Remember that a gesture of friendship, no matter how small, is always appreciated.
1766.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

1767.quote: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
1767.author: Henri Nouwen

1768.quote: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
1768.author: Henry David Thoreau

1769.quote: Two persons cannot long be friends if they cannot forgive each other's little failings.
1769.author: Jean de la Bruyere

1770.quote: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.
1770.author: John D. Rockefeller

1771.quote: We call that person who has lost his father, an orphan; and a widower that man who has lost his wife. But that man who has known the immense unhappiness of losing a friend, by what name do we call him? Here every language is silent and holds its peace in impotence.
1771.author: Joseph Roux

1772.quote: Your friend is your needs answered.
1772.author: Khalil Gibran

1773.quote: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.
1773.author: Khalil Gibran

1774.quote: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
1774.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1775.quote: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
1775.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1776.quote: It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter.
1776.author: Marlene Dietrich

1777.quote: Without wearing any mask we are conscious of, we have a special face for each friend.
1777.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1778.quote: But friendship is the breathing rose, with sweets in every fold.
1778.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1779.quote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
1779.author: Oprah Winfrey

1780.quote: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
1780.author: Oscar Wilde

1781.quote: An excellent man; he has no enemies; and none of his friends like him.
1781.author: Oscar Wilde

1782.quote: A friendship can weather most things and thrive in thin soil; but it needs a little mulch of letters and phone calls and small, silly presents every so often - just to save it from drying out completely.
1782.author: Pam Brown

1783.quote: The world is round so that friendship may encircle it.
1783.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

1784.quote: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.
1784.author: Plautus

1785.quote: False friendship, like the ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports.
1785.author: Richard Burton

1786.quote: Never do a wrong thing to make a friend or to keep one.
1786.author: Robert E. Lee

1787.quote: A quarrel between friends, when made up, adds a new tie to friendship.
1787.author: Saint Francis de Sales

1788.quote: You win the victory when you yield to friends.
1788.author: Sophocles

1789.quote: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
1789.author: William Penn

1790.quote: Where would you be without friends? The people to pick you up when you need lifting? We come from homes far from perfect, so you end up almost parent and sibling to your friends - your own chosen family. There's nothing like a really loyal, dependable, good friend. Nothing.
1790.author: Jennifer Aniston

1791.quote: Friendship and money: oil and water.
1791.author: Mario Puzo

1792.quote: My definition of a friend is somebody who adores you even though they know the things you're most ashamed of.
1792.author: Jodie Foster

1793.quote: That friendship will not continue to the end which is begun for an end.
1793.author: Francis Quarles

1794.quote: Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better.
1794.author: E. W. Howe

1795.quote: A friend in power is a friend lost.
1795.author: Henry Adams

1796.quote: A friend should be one in whose understanding and virtue we can equally confide, and whose opinion we can value at once for its justness and its sincerity.
1796.author: Robert Hall

1797.quote: As iron sharpens iron, so a friend sharpens a friend.
1797.author: King Solomon

1798.quote: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.
1798.author: Giotto di Bondone

1799.quote: Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.
1799.author: Robert Staughton Lynd

1800.quote: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
1800.author: Thomas Aquinas

1801.quote: Friends are the best to turn to when you're having a rough day.
1801.author: Justin Bieber

1802.quote: A woman may very well form a friendship with a man, but for this to endure, it must be assisted by a little physical antipathy.
1802.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1803.quote: I have lost my seven best friends, which is to say God has had mercy on me seven times without realizing it. He lent a friendship, took it from me, sent me another.
1803.author: Jean Cocteau

1804.quote: It may happen sometimes that a long debate becomes the cause of a longer friendship. Commonly, those who dispute with one another at last agree.
1804.author: Elbert Hubbard

1805.quote: Peace and friendship with all mankind is our wisest policy, and I wish we may be permitted to pursue it.
1805.author: Thomas Jefferson

1806.quote: If we listened to our intellect, we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go into business, because we'd be cynical. Well, that's nonsense. You've got to jump off cliffs all the time and build your wings on the way down.
1806.author: Ray Bradbury

1807.quote: All lasting business is built on friendship.
1807.author: Alfred A. Montapert

1808.quote: How can sincerity be a condition of friendship? A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
1808.author: Albert Camus

1809.quote: A friendship that like love is warm; A love like friendship, steady.
1809.author: Thomas Moore

1810.quote: Friendship's the wine of life: but friendship new... is neither strong nor pure.
1810.author: Edward Young

1811.quote: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
1811.author: Simone de Beauvoir

1813.quote: Accountability in friendship is the equivalent of love without strategy.
1813.author: Anita Brookner

1814.quote: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.
1814.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1816.quote: Friendship is but another name for an alliance with the follies and the misfortunes of others. Our own share of miseries is sufficient: why enter then as volunteers into those of another?
1816.author: Thomas Jefferson

1817.quote: She discovered with great delight that one does not love one's children just because they are one's children but because of the friendship formed while raising them.
1817.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

1818.quote: There is something in the unselfish and self-sacrificing love of a brute, which goes directly to the heart of him who has had frequent occasion to test the paltry friendship and gossamer fidelity of mere Man.
1818.author: Edgar Allan Poe

1819.quote: Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship - never.
1819.author: Charles Caleb Colton

1820.quote: One of the surest evidences of friendship that one individual can display to another is telling him gently of a fault. If any other can excel it, it is listening to such a disclosure with gratitude, and amending the error.
1820.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

1821.quote: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.
1821.author: David Storey

1822.quote: To like and dislike the same things, this is what makes a solid friendship.
1822.author: Sallust

1823.quote: In my public service, I treasure my friendship with law enforcement officers. I admire what they do and support them in every aspect of their job. I have always looked upon law enforcement officers as my friends.
1823.author: Dirk Kempthorne

1824.quote: Moral science is better occupied when treating of friendship than of justice.
1824.author: Thomas Aquinas

1825.quote: Music is the social act of communication among people, a gesture of friendship, the strongest there is.
1825.author: Malcolm Arnold

1826.quote: Our scientific age demands that we provide definitions, measurements, and statistics in order to be taken seriously. Yet most of the important things in life cannot be precisely defined or measured. Can we define or measure love, beauty, friendship, or decency, for example?
1826.author: Dennis Prager

1827.quote: Friendship is one of the most tangible things in a world which offers fewer and fewer supports.
1827.author: Kenneth Branagh

1828.quote: It is difficult to obtain the friendship of a cat. It is a philosophical animal... one that does not place its affections thoughtlessly.
1828.author: Theophile Gautier

1829.quote: Although the troops have struck us, we throw it all behind and are glad to meet you in peace and friendship.
1829.author: Black Kettle

1830.quote: For prayer is nothing else than being on terms of friendship with God.
1830.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

1831.quote: For me my friendship with Omar Rodriguez from Mars Volta that friendship really means a lot to me because he's another creative person who works as hard as I do.
1831.author: John Frusciante

1832.quote: I would have told him that I appreciated his friendship through the years and that I had learned a lot from him. I really loved Frank like you do a brother.
1832.author: Jimmy Carl Black

1833.quote: Friendship is something that creates equality and mutuality, not a reward for finding equality or a way of intensifying existing mutuality.
1833.author: Rowan Williams

1834.quote: Friendship is a strong and habitual inclination in two persons to promote the good and happiness of one another.
1834.author: Eustace Budgell

1835.quote: I would be willing to do almost anything to make Art happy. I care about our friendship. The only thing I won't do is change the essence of my work.
1835.author: Paul Simon

1836.quote: The second one, the joint Truth and Friendship Commission, which we started now with Indonesia, that is the one that has been criticized; its terms of reference call for providing amnesty for those who cooperate in telling the truth. It does not lead to prosecution.
1836.author: Jose Ramos-Horta

1837.quote: Love and friendship exclude each other.
1837.author: Jean de la Bruyere

1838.quote: Love is a friendship set to music.
1838.author: Joseph Campbell

1839.quote: The differences between friends cannot but reinforce their friendship.
1839.author: Mao Zedong

1840.quote: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.
1840.author: Robert Southey

1841.quote: Love and esteem are the first principles of friendship; it is always imperfect if either of these two are wanting.
1841.author: Eustace Budgell

1842.quote: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.
1842.author: James F. Byrnes

1843.quote: The feeling of friendship is like that of being comfortably filled with roast beef; love, like being enlivened with champagne.
1843.author: Samuel Johnson

1844.quote: Neatness begets order; but from order to taste there is the same difference as from taste to genius, or from love to friendship.
1844.author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

1845.quote: I had three chairs in my house; one for solitude, two for friendship, three for society.
1845.author: Henry David Thoreau

1846.quote: Never be afraid to meet to the hilt the demand of either work, or friendship - two of life's major assets.
1846.author: Eleanor Robson Belmont

1847.quote: All those who offer an opinion on any doubtful point should first clear their minds of every sentiment of dislike, friendship, anger or pity.
1847.author: Sallust

1848.quote: Perfect friendship is the friendship of men who are good, and alike in excellence; for these wish well alike to each other qua good, and they are good in themselves.
1848.author: Aristotle

1849.quote: I noticed that no matter where I went in the country, there was this group of questions that got asked. I would track them and keep them in categories. Like body image, school, family, friendship, you name it, the emotional life of a teenage girl.
1849.author: Elizabeth Berkley

1850.quote: Friendship is two-sided. It isn't a friend just because someone's doing something nice for you. That's a nice person. There's friendship when you do for each other. It's like marriage - it's two-sided.
1850.author: John Wooden

1851.quote: The beginning of a friendship, the fact that two people out of the thousands around them can meet and connect and become friends, seems like a kind of magic to me. But maintaining a friendship requires work. I don't mean that as a bad thing. Good art requires work as well.
1851.author: Charles de Lint

1852.quote: Friendship is also about liking a person for their failings, their weakness. It's also about mutual help, not about exploitation.
1852.author: Paul Theroux

1853.quote: I force people to have coffee with me, just because I don't trust that a friendship can be maintained without any other senses besides a computer or cellphone screen.
1853.author: John Cusack

1854.quote: I've got some great guy friends. They can start out as crushes. But when you realize something isn't going to happen, you make a choice whether or not the friendship is worth it. And it usually is. Then you can laugh about the fact that you used to have a crush on him or he had one on you.
1854.author: Courteney Cox

1855.quote: If the chemistry is right between star and photographer and the geometry of the pictures pleases the star, often the two people end up with a long-term professional friendship during which they continue to work together and to produce highly personal images.
1855.author: Eve Arnold

1856.quote: Some people are willing to betray years of friendship just to get a little bit of the spotlight.
1856.author: Lauren Conrad

1857.quote: I loved my 17 years with R.E.M., but I'm ready to reflect, assess and move on to a different phase of my life. The four of us will continue our close friendship, and I look forward to hearing their future efforts as the world's biggest R.E.M. fan.
1857.author: Bill Berry

1858.quote: I came to Venice for the first time in 1968 and was lucky enough to make the acquaintanceship, and then the friendship, of two Venetians, Roberta and Franco, who remain my best friends here after almost 50 years.
1858.author: Donna Leon

1859.quote: One hopes, of course, that a relationship grows and becomes a deep and wonderful marriage and friendship that lasts forever. But that's not always the case.
1859.author: Alana Stewart

1860.quote: When I was working on my first novel, 'The Quilter's Apprentice,' I knew I wanted to write about friendship, especially women's friendship and how women use friendship to sustain themselves and nurture each other.
1860.author: Jennifer Chiaverini

1861.quote: A friend is a beloved mystery; dearest always because he is not ourself, and has something in him which it is impossible for us to fathom. If it were not so, friendship would lose its chief zest.
1861.author: Lucy Larcom

1862.quote: I don't know if I've ever been in a clique. The older I've gotten, the more I've realized what a true friend really is. So my friendship circle has changed a bit.
1862.author: Aimee Teegarden

1863.quote: A traitor is a betrayer - one who practices injury, while professing friendship. Benedict Arnold was a traitor, solely because, while professing friendship for the American cause, he attempted to injure it. An open enemy, however criminal in other respects, is no traitor.
1863.author: Lysander Spooner

1864.quote: As is natural with contiguous states having like institutions and like aims of advancement and development, the friendship of the United States and Mexico has been constantly maintained.
1864.author: Chester A. Arthur

1865.quote: I have a couple of best friends, and I don't think I would live with them. It definitely... certain people can't live together, and I think that it could potentially put a lot of strain on the relationship or friendship.
1865.author: Alexandra Chando

1866.quote: The strong bond of friendship is not always a balanced equation; friendship is not always about giving and taking in equal shares. Instead, friendship is grounded in a feeling that you know exactly who will be there for you when you need something, no matter what or when.
1866.author: Simon Sinek

1867.quote: I really wasn't even aware that Batman and Superman had this kind of grudging friendship.
1867.author: Mark Valley

1868.quote: I sacrificed a lot, in terms of friendship and family, from working so much at such a young age, but I wouldn't be where I am if I hadn't.
1868.author: Sasha Grey

1869.quote: We come into relationships often very much identified with our needs. I need this, I need security, I need refuge, I need friendship. And all of relationships are symbiotic in that sense. We come together because we fulfill each others' needs at some level or other.
1869.author: Ram Dass

1870.quote: Friendship is the complete explanation of what a Cheetah Girl is - if you have that true friendship, you can conquer anything you want.
1870.author: Sabrina Bryan

1871.quote: Forgiveness is that subtle thread that binds both love and friendship. Without forgiveness, you may not even have a child one day.
1871.author: George Foreman

1872.quote: Christmas is the perfect time to celebrate the love of God and family and to create memories that will last forever. Jesus is God's perfect, indescribable gift. The amazing thing is that not only are we able to receive this gift, but we are able to share it with others on Christmas and every other day of the year.
1872.author: Joel Osteen

1873.quote: Christmas is the spirit of giving without a thought of getting. It is happiness because we see joy in people. It is forgetting self and finding time for others. It is discarding the meaningless and stressing the true values.
1873.author: Thomas S. Monson

1874.quote: Christmas isn't a season. It's a feeling.
1874.author: Edna Ferber

1875.quote: He who has not Christmas in his heart will never find it under a tree.
1875.author: Roy L. Smith

1876.quote: Christmas waves a magic wand over this world, and behold, everything is softer and more beautiful.
1876.author: Norman Vincent Peale

1877.quote: Christmas is not a time nor a season, but a state of mind. To cherish peace and goodwill, to be plenteous in mercy, is to have the real spirit of Christmas.
1877.author: Calvin Coolidge

1878.quote: And know that I am with you always; yes, to the end of time.
1878.author: Jesus Christ

1879.quote: Maybe Christmas, the Grinch thought, doesn't come from a store.
1879.author: Dr. Seuss

1880.quote: I will honor Christmas in my heart, and try to keep it all the year.
1880.author: Charles Dickens

1881.quote: Even though we're a week and a half away from Thanksgiving, it's beginning to look a lot like Christmas.
1881.author: Richard Roeper

1882.quote: The spirit of Christmas is the spirit of love and of generosity and of goodness. It illuminates the picture window of the soul, and we look out upon the world's busy life and become more interested in people than in things.
1882.author: Thomas S. Monson

1883.quote: Christmas is the day that holds all time together.
1883.author: Alexander Smith

1884.quote: Christmas is a season not only of rejoicing but of reflection.
1884.author: Winston Churchill

1885.quote: November is auspicious in so many parts of the country: the rice harvest is already in, the weather starts to cool, and the festive glow which precedes Christmas has began to brighten the landscape.
1885.author: F. Sionil Jose

1886.quote: At Christmas play and make good cheer, for Christmas comes but once a year.
1886.author: Thomas Tusser

1887.quote: Christmas... is not an external event at all, but a piece of one's home that one carries in one's heart.
1887.author: Freya Stark

1888.quote: Happy, happy Christmas, that can win us back to the delusions of our childhood days, recall to the old man the pleasures of his youth, and transport the traveler back to his own fireside and quiet home!
1888.author: Charles Dickens

1889.quote: I love Halloween, trick or treating and decorating the house. And I love Thanksgiving, because of the football and the fall weather. And of course, I love Christmas - that's my favorite of all!
1889.author: Joe Nichols

1890.quote: The two most joyous times of the year are Christmas morning and the end of school.
1890.author: Alice Cooper

1891.quote: Christmas gives us the opportunity to pause and reflect on the important things around us - a time when we can look back on the year that has passed and prepare for the year ahead.
1891.author: David Cameron

1892.quote: God never gives someone a gift they are not capable of receiving. If he gives us the gift of Christmas, it is because we all have the ability to understand and receive it.
1892.author: Pope Francis

1893.quote: Once again, we come to the Holiday Season, a deeply religious time that each of us observes, in his own way, by going to the mall of his choice.
1893.author: Dave Barry

1894.quote: Nothing says holidays, like a cheese log.
1894.author: Ellen DeGeneres

1895.quote: Don't let the past steal your present. This is the message of Christmas: We are never alone.
1895.author: Taylor Caldwell

1896.quote: I've been giving back since I was a teen, handing out turkeys at Thanksgiving and handing out toys at toys drives for Christmas. It's very important to give back as a youth. It's as simple as helping an old lady across the street or giving up your seat on the bus for someone who is pregnant.
1896.author: Queen Latifah

1897.quote: One of the most glorious messes in the world is the mess created in the living room on Christmas day. Don't clean it up too quickly.
1897.author: Andy Rooney

1898.quote: A lovely thing about Christmas is that it's compulsory, like a thunderstorm, and we all go through it together.
1898.author: Garrison Keillor

1899.quote: Christmas, my child, is love in action. Every time we love, every time we give, it's Christmas.
1899.author: Dale Evans

1900.quote: Christmas is joy, religious joy, an inner joy of light and peace.
1900.author: Pope Francis

1901.quote: It's true, Christmas can feel like a lot of work, particularly for mothers. But when you look back on all the Christmases in your life, you'll find you've created family traditions and lasting memories. Those memories, good and bad, are really what help to keep a family together over the long haul.
1901.author: Caroline Kennedy

1902.quote: For many, Christmas is also a time for coming together. But for others, service will come first.
1902.author: Queen Elizabeth II

1903.quote: I'm not going to tell you to meditate on what Christmas really means and be thankful.
1903.author: Monica Johnson

1904.quote: Christmas is a tonic for our souls. It moves us to think of others rather than of ourselves. It directs our thoughts to giving.
1904.author: B. C. Forbes

1905.quote: Unless we make Christmas an occasion to share our blessings, all the snow in Alaska won't make it 'white'.
1905.author: Bing Crosby

1906.quote: The Supreme Court has ruled that they cannot have a nativity scene in Washington, D.C. This wasn't for any religious reasons. They couldn't find three wise men and a virgin.
1906.author: Jay Leno

1907.quote: Christmas in Bethlehem. The ancient dream: a cold, clear night made brilliant by a glorious star, the smell of incense, shepherds and wise men falling to their knees in adoration of the sweet baby, the incarnation of perfect love.
1907.author: Lucinda Franks

1908.quote: Santa is our culture's only mythic figure truly believed in by a large percentage of the population. It's a fact that most of the true believers are under eight years old, and that's a pity.
1908.author: Chris Van Allsburg

1909.quote: My brothers and sisters, true love is a reflection of the Savior's love. In December of each year we call it the Christmas spirit. You can hear it. You can see it. You can feel it.
1909.author: Thomas S. Monson

1910.quote: Every year we celebrate the holy season of Advent, O God. Every year we pray those beautiful prayers of longing and waiting, and sing those lovely songs of hope and promise.
1910.author: Karl Rahner

1911.quote: The excellence of a gift lies in its appropriateness rather than in its value.
1911.author: Charles Dudley Warner

1912.quote: Always be prepared if someone asks you what you want for Christmas. Give brand names, the store that sells the merchandise, and, if possible, exact model numbers so they can't go wrong. Be the type who's impossible to buy for, so they have to get what you want.
1912.author: John Waters

1913.quote: Our children await Christmas presents like politicians getting in election returns: there's the Uncle Fred precinct and the Aunt Ruth district still to come in.
1913.author: Marcelene Cox

1914.quote: Every gift which is given, even though is be small, is in reality great, if it is given with affection.
1914.author: Pindar

1915.quote: What will you and I give for Christmas this year? Let us in our lives give to our Lord and Savior the gift of gratitude by living His teachings and following in His footsteps.
1915.author: Thomas S. Monson

1916.quote: Christmas is a stocking stuffed with sugary goodness.
1916.author: Mo Rocca

1917.quote: I beg to present you as a Christmas gift the city of Savannah.
1917.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

1918.quote: Christmas to a child is the first terrible proof that to travel hopefully is better than to arrive.
1918.author: Stephen Fry

1919.quote: There's been a concerted effort to steal Christmas.
1919.author: Jerry Falwell

1920.quote: I wanted an electric train for Christmas but I got the saxophone instead.
1920.author: Clarence Clemons

1921.quote: There's never really been a real hood Christmas movie.
1921.author: Ice Cube

1922.quote: When I was eight years old, I got a dummy for Christmas and started teaching myself. I got books and records and sat in front of the bathroom mirror, practising. I did my first show in the third grade and just kept going; there was no reason to quit.
1922.author: Jeff Dunham

1923.quote: It's surprising to me how many of my friends send Christmas cards, or holiday cards, including my atheist and secular friends.
1923.author: Christopher Hitchens

1924.quote: I loved raising my kids. I loved the process, the dirt of it, the tears of it, the frustration of it, Christmas, Easter, birthdays, growth charts, pediatrician appointments. I loved all of it.
1924.author: Jane Elliot

1925.quote: Christmas is a huge thing in my family. We usually start decorating the day after Thanksgiving. We spend Christmas Eve with one set of grandparents, and Christmas Day with the other grandparents and our family.
1925.author: Samantha Isler

1926.quote: I don't think Christmas is necessarily about things. It's about being good to one another, it's about the Christian ethic, it's about kindness.
1926.author: Carrie Fisher

1927.quote: The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.
1927.author: George Carlin

1928.quote: Being a traditionalist, I'm a rabid sucker for Christmas. In July, I'm already worried that there are only 146 shopping days left.
1928.author: John Waters

1929.quote: Mail your packages early so the post office can lose them in time for Christmas.
1929.author: Johnny Carson

1930.quote: Christmas, children, is not a date. It is a state of mind.
1930.author: Mary Ellen Chase

1931.quote: It is a fine seasoning for joy to think of those we love.
1931.author: Moliere

1932.quote: The earth has grown old with its burden of care, but at Christmas it always is young, the heart of the jewel burns lustrous and fair, and its soul full of music breaks the air, when the song of angels is sung.
1932.author: Phillips Brooks

1933.quote: What I don't like about office Christmas parties is looking for a job the next day.
1933.author: Phyllis Diller

1934.quote: Please to put a nickel, please to put a dime. How petitions trickle in at Christmas time!
1934.author: Phyllis McGinley

1935.quote: Now, the essence, the very spirit of Christmas is that we first make believe a thing is so, and lo, it presently turns out to be so.
1935.author: Stephen Leacock

1936.quote: Moving between the legs of tables and of chairs, rising or falling, grasping at kisses and toys, advancing boldly, sudden to take alarm, retreating to the corner of arm and knee, eager to be reassured, taking pleasure in the fragrant brilliance of the Christmas tree.
1936.author: T. S. Eliot

1937.quote: Santa Claus has the right idea - visit people only once a year.
1937.author: Victor Borge

1938.quote: Christmas is a season for kindling the fire for hospitality in the hall, the genial flame of charity in the heart.
1938.author: Washington Irving

1939.quote: The thing about Christmas is that it almost doesn't matter what mood you're in or what kind of a year you've had - it's a fresh start.
1939.author: Kelly Clarkson

1940.quote: Christmas makes me happy no matter what time of year it comes around.
1940.author: Bryan White

1941.quote: Expectancy is the atmosphere for miracles.
1941.author: Edwin Louis Cole

1942.quote: I love giving gifts and I love receiving them. I really like giving little kids extravagant gifts. You see their little faces light up and they get excited. If it's a really good gift, I love receiving it, like jewels, small islands.
1942.author: Gina Gershon

1943.quote: Faith is salted and peppered through everything at Christmas. And I love at least one night by the Christmas tree to sing and feel the quiet holiness of that time that's set apart to celebrate love, friendship, and God's gift of the Christ child.
1943.author: Amy Grant

1944.quote: In our open society, we are inclined to give to the less fortunate for the pure goodness of giving. We open our home to those who are alone on this holiday to spread some warmth into the life of another.
1944.author: Jeff Miller

1945.quote: My brothers and sisters, may the spirit of love which comes at Christmastime fill our homes and our lives and linger there long after the tree is down and the lights are put away for another year.
1945.author: Thomas S. Monson

1946.quote: Let's be naughty and save Santa the trip.
1946.author: Gary Allan

1947.quote: T'was the night before Christmas, when all through the house, not a creature was stirring, not even a mouse.
1947.author: Clement Clarke Moore
