1948.quote: Christmas is, of course, the time to be home - in heart as well as body.
1948.author: Garry Moore

1949.quote: There are some people who want to throw their arms round you simply because it is Christmas; there are other people who want to strangle you simply because it is Christmas.
1949.author: Robert Staughton Lynd

1950.quote: I love the excitement, the childlike spirit of innocence and just about everything that goes along with Christmas.
1950.author: Hillary Scott

1951.quote: The best Christmas present I got from my husband was a week to do whatever I wanted.
1951.author: Olivia Williams

1952.quote: Christmas is a time of year that's so romantic.
1952.author: Katharine McPhee

1953.quote: Before we took down the tree each year, Dad would always say a prayer that we would be together the next Christmas. I cling to that prayer, which serves as a reminder that it's important to be grateful in the present for the people you love because, well, you never know.
1953.author: Catherine Hicks

1954.quote: Now I'm an old Christmas tree, the roots of which have died. They just come along and while the little needles fall off me replace them with medallions.
1954.author: Orson Welles

1955.quote: There's nothing sadder in this world than to awake Christmas morning and not be a child.
1955.author: Erma Bombeck

1956.quote: Christmas is a holiday that persecutes the lonely, the frayed, and the rejected.
1956.author: Jimmy Cannon

1957.quote: No sane local official who has hung up an empty stocking over the municipal fireplace, is going to shoot Santa Claus just before a hard Christmas.
1957.author: Al Smith

1958.quote: In our racist, sexist society, Christmas is the 8 hours when we stop killing each other and gratutious over eating is encouraged so that the starving and other people in the world can die!
1958.author: Lloyd Kaufman

1959.quote: I went to Sunday School and liked the stories about Christ and the Christmas star. They were beautiful. They made you warm and happy to think about. But I didn't believe them.
1959.author: Frances Farmer

1960.quote: I was at the vice president's Christmas party. I thought that his speech was spectacular, and I knew that it was a very emotional and difficult thing for him to do, but I admonished him for not waiting just one more stinking day.
1960.author: Bradley Whitford

1961.quote: When I was five my parents bought me a ukulele for Christmas. I quickly learned how to play it with my father's guidance. Thereafter, my father regularly taught me all the good old fashioned songs.
1961.author: Tony Visconti

1962.quote: Time always seems long to the child who is waiting - for Christmas, for next summer, for becoming a grownup: long also when he surrenders his whole soul to each moment of a happy day.
1962.author: Dag Hammarskjold

1963.quote: The truth is the Super Bowl long ago became more than just a football game. It's part of our culture like turkey at Thanksgiving and lights at Christmas, and like those holidays beyond their meaning, a factor in our economy.
1963.author: Bob Schieffer

1964.quote: My mother, she had a very good attitude toward money. I'm very grateful for the fact that we had to learn to save. I used to get like 50 pence a week, and I'd save it for like five months. And then I'd spend it on Christmas presents. I'd save up like eight pounds. It's nothing, but we did that.
1964.author: Gemma Arterton

1965.quote: What I'm not saying is that all government spending is bad. It's not - far, far from it, but there is no free lunch, as a former colleague of mine used to say. There is no public tooth fairy. Father Christmas does not work on the Treasury staff this year. You can never bail someone out of trouble without putting someone else into trouble.
1965.author: Arthur Laffer

1966.quote: I had eight brothers and sisters. Every Christmas my younger brother Bobby would wake up extra early and open everybody's presents - everybody's - so by the time the rest of us got up, all the gifts were shredded, ribbons off, torn open and thrown aside.
1966.author: Tommy Hilfiger

1967.quote: I've always loved Christmas and that's not really gone away from me from being a child to now. It's always a magical time and I'm unashamed in my love for Christmas.
1967.author: Martin Freeman

1968.quote: Christmas can have a real melancholy aspect, 'cause it packages itself as this idea of perfect family cohesion and love, and you're always going to come up short when you measure your personal life against the idealized personal lives that are constantly thrust in our faces, primarily by TV commercials.
1968.author: Dan Savage

1969.quote: My fondest memories are generally the day after Thanksgiving. I get the total decorating Christmas itch.
1969.author: Katharine McPhee

1970.quote: When you have kids, you instantly feel that you do not want to do them wrong. Those dads that go off to Florida and start a new life, I couldn't imagine that: seeing my kid once every Christmas, every three years. If I'm gone for six days it feels like too much.
1970.author: Adam Carolla

1971.quote: Brits and Americans have hundreds of different phrases for the same thing. Luckily, it's usually a source of amusement rather than frustration. A flashlight by any other name is still a torch. My personal favourite is 'fairy lights,' which we boringly refer to as 'Christmas lights.'
1971.author: Sloane Crosley

1972.quote: My mother-in-law has come round to our house at Christmas seven years running. This year we're having a change. We're going to let her in.
1972.author: Les Dawson

1973.quote: One thing I love about Christmas music is that it has a tradition of warmth.
1973.author: Zooey Deschanel

1974.quote: I love the atmosphere at the mall - everything about Christmas. I don't think anything specific gets me in the holiday spirit except for the holidays themselves.
1974.author: Drake Bell

1975.quote: Christmas and the holidays are the season of giving. It's a time when people are more kind and open-hearted.
1975.author: Gisele Bundchen

1976.quote: We try to make the name longer and longer every year. First, it was 'Larry the Cable Guy's Christmas Spectacular.' Then it was 'It's a Very Larry Christmas.' Now it's 'Larry the Cable Guy's Hula-palooza Christmas Luau.' I'll tell you what it is: It's funny. That's what it is. Who cares what the name of it is? It is a funny special.
1976.author: Larry the Cable Guy

1977.quote: Christmas is far and away my favorite holiday. I love everything about it, from the event that inspired it, hoping for a white one, to wrapping presents. But mostly I love having family and friends gathered, and sharing traditions.
1977.author: Ellen Hopkins

1978.quote: When you give up yourself, that's when you will feel the true spirit of Christmas. And that's giving that's serving others and that's when you feel fulfilled.
1978.author: Joel Osteen

1979.quote: We are each one on a road going toward home, but we're not trying to get there for Christmas. We're trying to get there for eternity. We want to arrive home safely to our loving Father in Heaven. He wants us to make it safely there, so He has sent a guiding light for us to follow: a Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ, the perfect example.
1979.author: Margaret D. Nadauld

1980.quote: As I lay so sick on my bed, from Christmas till March, I was always praying for poor ole master. 'Pears like I didn't do nothing but pray for ole master. 'Oh, Lord, convert ole master;' 'Oh, dear Lord, change dat man's heart, and make him a Christian.'
1980.author: Harriet Tubman

1981.quote: Back in 1960 at Christmas time, I did work loading and unloading boxcars for Railway Express. That was a kind of weight training that helped me. I weighed about 160 when I started. I began to gain weight and kept right on gaining until I reached 195 pounds.
1981.author: Pete Rose

1982.quote: There would be no Christmas if there was no Easter.
1982.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

1983.quote: Halloween starts earlier and earlier, just like Christmas.
1983.author: Robert Englund

1984.quote: Christmas always rustled. It rustled every time, mysteriously, with silver and gold paper, tissue paper and a rich abundance of shiny paper, decorating and hiding everything and giving a feeling of reckless extravagance.
1984.author: Tove Jansson

1985.quote: I love snow; I love building snowman. The only thing I don't like is the cold - so if we could have a hot Christmas, that would be amazing.
1985.author: Ella Henderson

1986.quote: My Barbies were usually naked. Once, I took their heads off, cut their hair, drew on their short, spiky hair with some markers, then stuck the heads on Christmas lights. Every year, we'd string our tree with those Barbie heads. It looked demonic. My parents were so cool - they saw it as a form of self-expression.
1986.author: Jessica Biel

1987.quote: We don't consider the Wizard of Oz or Father Christmas to be too old. They're still magical characters, and the fact they've been around the block only adds to their magic.
1987.author: Peter Capaldi

1988.quote: A good conscience is a continual Christmas.
1988.author: Benjamin Franklin

1989.quote: If you haven't got any charity in your heart, you have the worst kind of heart trouble.
1989.author: Bob Hope

1991.quote: The sharpest memory of our old-fashioned Christmas eve is my mother's hand making sure I was settled in bed.
1991.author: Paul Engle

1992.quote: We consider Christmas as the encounter, the great encounter, the historical encounter, the decisive encounter, between God and mankind. He who has faith knows this truly; let him rejoice.
1992.author: Pope Paul VI

1993.quote: I stopped believing in Santa Claus when I was six. Mother took me to see him in a department store and he asked for my autograph.
1993.author: Shirley Temple

1994.quote: I once bought my kids a set of batteries for Christmas with a note on it saying, toys not included.
1994.author: Bernard Manning

1995.quote: I once wanted to become an atheist, but I gave up - they have no holidays.
1995.author: Henny Youngman

1996.quote: The Christian faith can never be separated from the soil of sacred events, from the choice made by God, who wanted to speak to us, to become man, to die and rise again, in a particular place and at a particular time.
1996.author: Pope Benedict XVI

1997.quote: Coming from Chicago, I like a white Christmas.
1997.author: Dennis Franz

1998.quote: There is no better time than now, this very Christmas season, for all of us to rededicate ourselves to the principles taught by Jesus the Christ. It is the time to love the Lord, our God, with all our heart - and our neighbors as ourselves.
1998.author: Thomas S. Monson

1999.quote: As dry leaves that before the wild hurricane fly, when they meet with an obstacle, mount to the sky. So up to the house-top the coursers they flew, with the sleigh full of toys, and St. Nicholas too.
1999.author: Clement Clarke Moore

2000.quote: The real evidence for Jesus and Christianity is in how Jesus and the Christianity based on him manifest themselves in the lives of practicing Christians.
2000.author: Lionel Blue

2001.quote: Christmas is taken very seriously in this household. I believe in Father Christmas, and there's no way I'd do anything to undermine that belief.
2001.author: Carol Ann Duffy

2002.quote: I wrapped my Christmas presents early this year, but I used the wrong paper. See, the paper I used said 'Happy Birthday' on it. I didn't want to waste it so I just wrote 'Jesus' on it.
2002.author: Demetri Martin

2003.quote: I love Christmas, not just because of the presents but because of all the decorations and lights and the warmth of the season.
2003.author: Ashley Tisdale

2004.quote: My Christmases have always just been very simple and about family.
2004.author: Julie Roberts

2005.quote: People say I don't write books, I make Christmas presents.
2005.author: Bryce Courtenay

2006.quote: It's silly talking about how many years we will have to spend in the jungles of Vietnam when we could pave the whole country and put parking stripes on it and still be home by Christmas.
2006.author: Ronald Reagan

2007.quote: There's a little vanity chair that Charlie gave me the first Christmas we knew each other. I'll not be parting with that, nor our bed - the four-poster - I'll be needing that to die in.
2007.author: Helen Hayes

2008.quote: I got up one Christmas morning and we didn't have nothing to eat. We didn't have an apple, we didn't have an orange, we didn't have a cake, we didn't have nothing.
2008.author: Muddy Waters

2009.quote: Christmas carols always brought tears to my eyes. I also cry at weddings. I should have cried at a couple of my own.
2009.author: Ethel Merman

2010.quote: We should declare war on North Vietnam. We could pave the whole country and put parking strips on it, and still be home by Christmas.
2010.author: Ronald Reagan

2011.quote: When I was 12, all I wanted for Christmas was a trampoline or a four-wheeler. I ended up getting both presents for Christmas.
2011.author: Chris Brown

2012.quote: I remember a great America where we made everything. There was a time when the only thing you got from Japan was a really bad cheap transistor radio that some aunt gave you for Christmas.
2012.author: Cher

2013.quote: Why not share with the world the way it is and tell them my feelings about my cat, and how I played with my kids, and how addicted to Christmas time I am, and the smell of pine needles and hearing my kids laugh.
2013.author: Steven Tyler

2014.quote: It is never too late to get into tennis! While I started playing at the age of 8 when my parents gave me a tennis racquet for Christmas, tennis is a lifelong sport that can be enjoyed by people of almost any age. It's also something you never forget once you learn.
2014.author: Samantha Stosur

2015.quote: I'm bad on Valentine's Day, but even worse on Christmas. I go shopping at nine o'clock on December 24th every year. Nobody else is there. I'm in Toys'R'Us all by myself. I get there five minutes before closing.
2015.author: Jamie Foxx

2017.quote: I've got some incredible fans actually - so loyal and they make me birthday cards and Christmas cards. I got this package of poems and artwork based around the songs. They've got this thing called 'Floetry' where they all have to put in artwork. They've set up their own competitions and stuff which is kind of amazing.
2017.author: Florence Welch

2018.quote: We no longer sing and dance. We don't know how to. Instead, we watch other people sing and dance on the television screen. Christmas, which was once a festival of active enjoyment, has turned into a binge of purely passive pleasures.
2018.author: Tom Hodgkinson

2019.quote: A barn with cattle and horses is the place to begin Christmas; after all, that's where the original event happened, and that same smell was the first air that the Christ Child breathed.
2019.author: Paul Engle

2020.quote: At the heart of every really good Christmas movie is the threat, I suppose, to Christmas. Something is wrong with Christmas, in all of these movies. In 'The Polar Express,' there's a kid that doesn't really believe, and that's the threat to Christmas. In 'Santa Claus: The Movie,' jealousy and greed are threatening to overrun his Christmas.
2020.author: James McAvoy

2021.quote: I am one of those people who is not very patient in the makeup chair. I have been offered movies like 'Planet of the Apes' and stuff like 'The Grinch Who Stole Christmas' and I turned them down.
2021.author: John C. Reilly

2022.quote: Christmas morning, I'm going to open presents with my kids. I'm going to take pictures of them opening the presents. Then I'm going to come to the Staples Center and get ready to work.
2022.author: Kobe Bryant

2023.quote: The real reason Jews don't have more Hanukkah music is that, historically, American Jewish singer-songwriters were too busy making Christmas music. 'White Christmas,' 'Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer,' 'Silver Bells' and 'The Christmas Song (Chestnuts Roasting)' were all written by Jews.
2023.author: Matisyahu

2024.quote: Christmas cookies can't help but be retro - they are memory first, sugar-flour-egg-redhot-gumdrop-sparkle reality second.
2024.author: Dana Goodyear

2025.quote: Don't send funny greeting cards on birthdays or at Christmas. Save them for funerals, when their cheery effect is needed.
2025.author: P. J. O'Rourke

2026.quote: Several years ago, I was creating a Christmas present for the family, a self-published cookbook featuring recipes my grandmother had collected and created over decades. While interviewing her for the biographical section, she began to talk about her courtship with my late grandfather.
2026.author: Kristina McMorris

2027.quote: As a child, I was bonkers for Christmas. The entire month of December, I couldn't sleep at night from anticipation.
2027.author: Rosecrans Baldwin

2028.quote: I detest 'Jingle Bells,' 'White Christmas,' 'Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer,' and the obscene spending bonanza that nowadays seems to occupy not just December, but November and much of October, too.
2028.author: Richard Dawkins

2029.quote: Like my best friend, I asked for drums for Christmas, and got them. But when he moved on to guitar, I realized two things: (1) guitar is a much more expressive instrument, (2) way more girls pay attention to guitar players than to drummers.
2029.author: Greg Iles

2030.quote: I was born with an extremely negative attitude. I was the kid who wouldn't smile in Christmas photos, was a poor sport, and hated a lot of things. I eventually grew out of my negativity when I matured.
2030.author: Colton Haynes

2031.quote: Every year, like a good Catholic, I wait for Christmas. Putting up the lights, decorating the tree, making sweets and then unwrapping gifts on Christmas morning... it's a tradition my family has followed since I was very little.
2031.author: Malaika Arora Khan

2032.quote: When I cook for my family on Christmas, I make feijoada, a South American dish of roasted and smoked meats like ham, pork, beef, lamb, and bacon - all served with black beans and rice. It's festive but different.
2032.author: Maya Angelou

2033.quote: As we give presents at Christmas, we need to recognize that sharing our time and ourselves is such an important part of giving.
2033.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

2034.quote: 'Joker' was a violent, dark, and brutal book, so I wanted to do something a little less heavy. I played around with the idea of a children's book, and that eventually became 'Noel.' And I just kept finding these parallels between things I could do with Batman and Charles Dickens' 'A Christmas Carol.'
2034.author: Lee Bermejo

2035.quote: One thing I hear a lot is, 'Dude, my mom loves your record,' or 'I got it for my dad for Christmas.' I'm essentially doing dad rock. Which is great, because I love Steely Dan, you know? Nothing wrong with dad rock!
2035.author: Mac DeMarco

2036.quote: In my adolescence, I think I felt very outcast; I felt lonely. I felt great loneliness, and sometimes I wouldn't partake in Christmas, and I would go off and wander in the streets of Melbourne.
2036.author: Michael Leunig

2037.quote: I've got more than 600 pairs of Ray-Ban sunglasses, from 1950s originals to newer models. I have them on the wall like opticians do so I can pick out a pair that goes with my outfit. I had around 30 pairs, then my husband Rainer started getting them for me as birthday and Christmas gifts.
2037.author: Suzi Quatro

2038.quote: I read everything. I'll read a John Grisham novel, I'll sit and read a whole book of poems by Maya Angelou, or I'll just read some Mary Oliver - this is a book that was given to me for Christmas. No particular genre. And I read in French, and I read in German, and I read in English. I love to see how other people use language.
2038.author: Jessye Norman

2039.quote: Christmas for me is all about spending time with my family. I cherish any chance we have to spend all day together making gingerbread houses, baking cookies, or sitting around and watching movies.
2039.author: Blake Lively

2040.quote: The smell of pine needles, spruce and the smell of a Christmas tree - those to me, are the scents of the holidays.
2040.author: Blake Lively

2041.quote: Christmas time! That man must be a misanthrope indeed, in whose breast something like a jovial feeling is not roused - in whose mind some pleasant associations are not awakened - by the recurrence of Christmas.
2041.author: Charles Dickens

2042.quote: I don't know if that's a year's bad luck, or if that's how it works. But stealing a Christmas tree - that can't be a good thing, karma-wise.
2042.author: Adrian McKinty

2043.quote: I cut 'Diamond in My Crown' in my home in Georgia, because I wanted to use an old 1848 pump organ that my mother-in-law had gotten for Emory for Christmas one year. His mother would be proud to know that pump organ was made use of.
2043.author: Patty Loveless

2044.quote: Some people are born for Halloween, and some are just counting the days until Christmas.
2044.author: Stephen Graham Jones

2045.quote: Christmas is doing a little something extra for someone.
2045.author: Charles M. Schulz

2046.quote: To perceive Christmas through its wrappings becomes more difficult with every year.
2046.author: E. B. White

2047.quote: Finding the real joy of Christmas comes not in the hurrying and the scurrying to get more done, nor is it found in the purchasing of gifts. We find real joy when we make the Savior the focus of the season.
2047.author: Thomas S. Monson

2048.quote: There are a lot of Grinches out there that would like nothing better than to take any references to religion out of the holiday season.
2048.author: Ernest Istook

2049.quote: I think Christmas is about celebration and come on, on the inside everyone wants to dance.
2049.author: TobyMac

2050.quote: I'm sure most of us remember being a kid and you have all of this endless time where two weeks before Christmas feels like ten years. I used to go to bed to try and go to sleep to try and make it go faster.
2050.author: Andrea Arnold

2051.quote: 'A Christmas Story' has always meant a lot to me personally.
2051.author: Peter Billingsley

2052.quote: My Christmas present to myself each year is to see how much air travel can open up the world and take me to places as far from sheltered California and Japan as possible.
2052.author: Pico Iyer

2053.quote: I suppose if you look back to your early childhood you accept everything people tell you, and that includes a heavy dose of irrationality - you're told about tooth fairies and Father Christmas and things.
2053.author: Richard Dawkins

2054.quote: My parents were kind of over protective people. Me and my sister had to play in the backyard all the time. They bought us bikes for Christmas but wouldn't let us ride in the street, we had to ride in the backyard. Another Christmas, my dad got me a basketball hoop and put it in the middle of the lawn! You can't dribble on grass.
2054.author: Jimmy Fallon

2055.quote: Music is my thing. It's my thing; it's what I love. It's what I do. It's football to me; it's Christmas to me; religion to me; poetry to me.
2055.author: Ryan Adams

2056.quote: Then, when I got in the military, I used to host - even in high school - I hosted the talent shows, and when I was in the military I would host all of our base Christmas parties and stuff.
2056.author: Gary Owens

2057.quote: I just think that it's strong and it's important that we recognize what the Christmas season is about; it's about the birth of our Savior, and there's a lot of pressure today to be politically correct, but people are realizing, too, that you have to be open to express your faith what you want believe.
2057.author: Joel Osteen

2058.quote: I think that 'Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance' was mentally taxing, if only because I had to go to a Christmas party shortly after I had wrapped photography in Romania at two in the morning as the Ghost Rider. The invitation had a Christmas ornament on it with Ghost Rider's face on it as a tree.
2058.author: Nicolas Cage

2059.quote: At Christmas, I am always struck by how the spirit of togetherness lies also at the heart of the Christmas story. A young mother and a dutiful father with their baby were joined by poor shepherds and visitors from afar. They came with their gifts to worship the Christ child.
2059.author: Queen Elizabeth II

2060.quote: Easter may seem boring to children, and it is blessedly unencumbered by the silly fun that plagues Christmas. Yet it contains the one thing needful for every human life: the good news of Resurrection.
2060.author: Frederica Mathewes-Green

2061.quote: I love spending time with my family and friends during the holidays, and my favorite holiday tradition would be the pozole that my mom makes almost every Christmas. It's the best!
2061.author: Becky G

2062.quote: I was nine or 10 years old and my father was sacked on Christmas Day. He was a manager, the results had not been good, he lost a game on December 22 or 23. On Christmas Day, the telephone rang and he was sacked in the middle of our lunch.
2062.author: Jose Mourinho

2063.quote: My mother was a professional sick person; she took a lot of pain pills. There are many people like that. It's just how they are used to getting attention. I always remember she's the daughter of alcoholics who'd leave her alone at Christmas time.
2063.author: Jim Carrey

2064.quote: Black Friday is not another bad hair day in Wall Street. It's the term used by American retailers to describe the day after the Thanksgiving Holiday, seen as the semi-official start of Christmas shopping season.
2064.author: Evan Davis

2065.quote: It always depresses me when people moan about how commercial Christmas is. I love everything about it. The tradition of having this great big feast, slap bang in the middle of winter, is an essential thing to look forward to at the end of the year.
2065.author: Richard E. Grant

2066.quote: We're raising our girls to understand the real meaning of Christmas, and to know that it's most important to have Christmas in your heart. We go to our local mall and donate toys, and we say prayers for all the people in the world who might not be as lucky as we are.
2066.author: Faith Hill

2067.quote: I stopped going to Kingdom Hall, the church, when I was 11 years old, so I was very young. They don't celebrate birthdays, you get no Christmas, so it's a very difficult religion for children to get into. And they do a lot of finger-pointing among the Jehovah's Witnesses.
2067.author: Ja Rule

2068.quote: The way my family always did Christmas was on Christmas Eve, it wasn't really centered around a dinner on Christmas Eve. It was more about keeping the kids calm. Sometime after dark is when we were going to open all the presents underneath the tree from Mom, Dad and the kids and everything - just the family presents was every Christmas Eve.
2068.author: Blake Shelton

2069.quote: Actually, my mother and Alfie came for three weeks' Christmas vacation and stayed for 21 years. I guess my mother never went back because she was lonely.
2069.author: Frank McCourt

2070.quote: Besides the two Christmas things, we've got a about a dozen new tracks we're working on.
2070.author: Chris Frantz

2071.quote: I grew up with the classics. My mom and I would sit and watch 'Singin' in the Rain' and 'White Christmas' - those kind of movies.
2071.author: Lucas Grabeel

2072.quote: I wouldn't recommend young kids see 'Speedway Junkie.' It's definitely an age-appropriate movie - dark and realistic and edgy. If young kids want to see me, go see the Christmas movie.
2072.author: Jonathan Taylor Thomas

2073.quote: For a long time all I wanted for Christmas were books about outdoor survival. I was convinced that the woods were calling me. I camped a lot, I took classes. At 18, I told myself if I don't live in the woods by myself by the time I'm 25, I have failed.
2073.author: Chris Evans

2074.quote: A friend gave me a CD of the 'Pathetique' Symphony as a Christmas present. I went home, and I put on the CD expecting to listen to Tchaikovsky. But it started 'ta ta ta taaa.' It was too long for me. I didn't understand it at first, but then I fell in love, in love, in love.
2074.author: Gustavo Dudamel

2075.quote: You can't allow the forces of political correction to shut you up. I mean, why are people afraid to say, 'Merry Christmas?' Give me a break. If people don't like it, yeah, they can go do something else.
2075.author: Ben Carson

2076.quote: My mom is a really good cook. I didn't get the cooking gene, but she cooks this really amazing dinner every Christmas, and that's always really fun.
2076.author: Miranda Cosgrove

2077.quote: At school, there was an annual school disco and I'd be standing in my bedroom wondering what to wear for hours on end. Eventually I'd arrive at a decision that was just the most ridiculous costume you could have ever devised - I think it was probably knitted Christmas jumpers on top of buttoned-up white shirts.
2077.author: Guy Berryman

2078.quote: One of my favorite movies of all time is 'It's A Wonderful Life,' which is a pretty interesting choice for a seasonal Christmas favorite, because it's about a guy who wants to commit suicide and is presented with reasons not to.
2078.author: Frank Darabont

2079.quote: Like the Earth, the Web is a less appealing place than it used to be. If I want attitude and arguing and meanness and profanity and wrong information screamed at me as gospel, I'll get in a time machine and spend Christmas with my family in 1977.
2079.author: J. R. Moehringer

2080.quote: Every Christmas, all around Ghana, there are tons of these parties and they are full of everything that exists in human life in Ghana and worldwide.
2080.author: Taiye Selasi

2081.quote: I grew up as a photo nut. Every Christmas I would get a new camera. It's a huge part of my life.
2081.author: Kevin Systrom

2082.quote: I think I'm a lot like other moms out there who feel like if we don't have the pecan pie we have every year, then it just won't be Christmas.
2082.author: Faith Hill

2083.quote: I've always been shy, but I see that as a good thing because it kept me focused on music. When I was in seventh grade, I asked my parents for a mobile recording system for Christmas, and I got it. I didn't come out of my room for years after that. I'd get invited to the movies and I'd say, 'I'm gonna finish a couple of demos.'
2083.author: Hunter Hayes

2084.quote: Comic-Con is nerd Christmas. People go wanting to have fun.
2084.author: Chris Hardwick

2085.quote: I know that a Christmas tree farm in Pennsylvania is about the most random place for a country singer to come from, but I had an awesome childhood.
2085.author: Taylor Swift

2086.quote: I love Christmas tree bulbs, and I started putting them in my paintings. You've got to plug this painting in, and it's got a rig in the back, so that each one can be replaced if it burns out.
2086.author: David Lynch

2087.quote: I read the Scriptures at the American Cathedral on Christmas and Easter; that's it. It's a task I love.
2087.author: Olivia De Havilland

2088.quote: I wanted to have more songs with religious backgrounds. The Christmas record has strong, traditional hymns, but it also has a song called 'Christmas in Heaven' about missing someone that you love that's passed on, and wondering what's going on up there on Christmas.
2088.author: Scotty McCreery

2089.quote: For more than a decade, I led an organization that put on an elaborate Christmas program each December. It was a big production, with over 250 people participating in more than 20 performances. By the end of the season, everyone who participated was exhausted.
2089.author: John C. Maxwell

2090.quote: Christmas was the one time of year when my brothers surfaced at home, when my parents and grandparents congregated to eat my mother's roast turkey.
2090.author: Amanda Lindhout

2091.quote: The word of God is very important to Christmas. For unto us a child was born, and we should be reminded of how Christ's amazing journey came to be.
2091.author: Monica Johnson

2092.quote: I think 'Elf' is funny, with Will Ferrell. That's a great Christmas movie.
2092.author: Robert Osborne

2093.quote: Felixstowe, the United Kingdom's largest port, stops work only for Christmas Day and for crane-toppling Force 9 gales.
2093.author: Rose George

2094.quote: I remember being banned from other houses as a younger child during the winter holiday season; I was the only one who didn't believe in Santa Claus, and I was ruining everyone's Christmas.
2094.author: Jami Attenberg

2095.quote: Every day is like Halloween or Christmas eve for me. I go to bed, and I'm so excited to get back to work. I'm very lucky that I have a career like that 'cause not many people do.
2095.author: Adam Green

2096.quote: I hate to say it, but Christmas as a kid was always a moneymaking venture for me. I played trumpet, and a friend of mine who played trombone and a guy who played tuba, every Christmas we'd go out for three or four days beforehand and play Christmas carols on our horns.
2096.author: John Tesh

2097.quote: The most classic French dessert around the holidays is the Christmas log, with butter cream. Two flavors. Chocolate and coconut. My first job in the kitchen when I was a boy was to make these Christmas logs.
2097.author: Alain Ducasse

2098.quote: Pets, like their owners, tend to expand a little over the Christmas period.
2098.author: Frances Wright

2099.quote: There's something about a Christmas sweater that will always make me laugh.
2099.author: Kristen Wiig

2100.quote: Christmas is the time when kids tell Santa what they want and adults pay for it. Deficits are when adults tell government what they want and their kids pay for it.
2100.author: Richard Lamm

2101.quote: The truth is that our way of celebrating the Christmas season does spring from myriad cultures and sources, from St. Nicholas to Coca-Cola advertising campaigns.
2101.author: Richard Roeper

2102.quote: Orphans, dead parents, lonely children at Christmas, morose spoken word recordings, everything you love about the holidays. Move the turkey over so you can fit your head in the oven.
2102.author: April Winchell

2103.quote: In the spring of 1994 I decided not to seek reelection to the Senate. I had made the decision 12 years earlier, Christmas Day of 1982, just after I had been first elected to a full term, that I would do the best I could for a limited time.
2103.author: George J. Mitchell

2104.quote: Christmas is more stressful with present buying and making sure everyone gets included, but Thanksgiving is really not that. I don't ever really get stressed out about the food.
2104.author: Sandra Lee

2105.quote: I was a postman one Christmas and I developed a morbid fear of dogs.
2105.author: Diane Abbott

2106.quote: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
2106.author: Swami Sivananda

2107.quote: Don't aim for success if you want it; just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally.
2107.author: David Frost

2108.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
2108.author: Winston Churchill

2109.quote: Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.
2109.author: Henry Ford

2110.quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
2110.author: Albert Schweitzer

2111.quote: Success is the result of perfection, hard work, learning from failure, loyalty, and persistence.
2111.author: Colin Powell

2112.quote: A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.
2112.author: Joyce Brothers

2113.quote: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
2113.author: Stephen Hawking

2114.quote: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.
2114.author: Pele

2115.quote: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
2115.author: Vince Lombardi

2116.quote: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
2116.author: Albert Einstein

2117.quote: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines, practiced every day.
2117.author: Jim Rohn

2118.quote: Ultimately, leadership is not about glorious crowning acts. It's about keeping your team focused on a goal and motivated to do their best to achieve it, especially when the stakes are high and the consequences really matter. It is about laying the groundwork for others' success, and then standing back and letting them shine.
2118.author: Chris Hadfield

2119.quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
2119.author: Colin Powell

2120.quote: The starting point of all achievement is desire.
2120.author: Napoleon Hill

2121.quote: Success is simple. Do what's right, the right way, at the right time.
2121.author: Arnold H. Glasow

2122.quote: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.
2122.author: Bruce Lee

2123.quote: Education is the key to success in life, and teachers make a lasting impact in the lives of their students.
2123.author: Solomon Ortiz

2124.quote: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
2124.author: Winston Churchill

2125.quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
2125.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

2126.quote: The road to success is not easy to navigate, but with hard work, drive and passion, it's possible to achieve the American dream.
2126.author: Tommy Hilfiger

2127.quote: The supreme quality for leadership is unquestionably integrity. Without it, no real success is possible, no matter whether it is on a section gang, a football field, in an army, or in an office.
2127.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

2128.quote: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.
2128.author: Henry Ford

2129.quote: When love and skill work together, expect a masterpiece.
2129.author: John Ruskin

2130.quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
2130.author: Helen Keller

2131.quote: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
2131.author: Albert Einstein

2132.quote: Success is simply a matter of luck. Ask any failure.
2132.author: Earl Wilson

2133.quote: Desire is the key to motivation, but it's determination and commitment to an unrelenting pursuit of your goal - a commitment to excellence - that will enable you to attain the success you seek.
2133.author: Mario Andretti

2134.quote: Money won't create success, the freedom to make it will.
2134.author: Nelson Mandela

2135.quote: Success is not a destination, but the road that you're on. Being successful means that you're working hard and walking your walk every day. You can only live your dream by working hard towards it. That's living your dream.
2135.author: Marlon Wayans

2136.quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.
2136.author: Bill Gates

2137.quote: We learned about honesty and integrity - that the truth matters... that you don't take shortcuts or play by your own set of rules... and success doesn't count unless you earn it fair and square.
2137.author: Michelle Obama

2138.quote: Action is the foundational key to all success.
2138.author: Pablo Picasso

2139.quote: Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning.
2139.author: Benjamin Franklin

2140.quote: I'm not going to get somewhere and say, 'OK, I'm done.' Success is never final; I'll just keep on going. The same way as failure never being fatal. Just keep going. I'm going to the stars and then past them.
2140.author: Conor McGregor

2141.quote: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then success is sure.
2141.author: Mark Twain

2142.quote: It's fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.
2142.author: Bill Gates

2143.quote: Failure is success if we learn from it.
2143.author: Malcolm Forbes

2144.quote: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.
2144.author: Walter Scott

2145.quote: Humility is the true key to success. Successful people lose their way at times. They often embrace and overindulge from the fruits of success. Humility halts this arrogance and self-indulging trap. Humble people share the credit and wealth, remaining focused and hungry to continue the journey of success.
2145.author: Rick Pitino

2146.quote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
2146.author: Swami Vivekananda

2147.quote: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
2147.author: Doug Larson

2148.quote: Every day is a new opportunity. You can build on yesterday's success or put its failures behind and start over again. That's the way life is, with a new game every day, and that's the way baseball is.
2148.author: Bob Feller

2149.quote: Communication - the human connection - is the key to personal and career success.
2149.author: Paul J. Meyer

2150.quote: Focused, hard work is the real key to success. Keep your eyes on the goal, and just keep taking the next step towards completing it. If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.
2150.author: John Carmack

2151.quote: Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.
2151.author: Marilyn Monroe

2152.quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
2152.author: Vince Lombardi

2153.quote: Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
2153.author: Bill Bradley

2154.quote: Think twice before you speak, because your words and influence will plant the seed of either success or failure in the mind of another.
2154.author: Napoleon Hill

2155.quote: Success is almost totally dependent upon drive and persistence. The extra energy required to make another effort or try another approach is the secret of winning.
2155.author: Denis Waitley

2156.quote: Failure is the key to success; each mistake teaches us something.
2156.author: Morihei Ueshiba

2157.quote: Part of the secret of a success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside.
2157.author: Mark Twain

2158.quote: My success isn't a result of arrogance - it's a result of belief.
2158.author: Conor McGregor

2159.quote: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom.
2159.author: George S. Patton

2160.quote: We learned about gratitude and humility - that so many people had a hand in our success, from the teachers who inspired us to the janitors who kept our school clean... and we were taught to value everyone's contribution and treat everyone with respect.
2160.author: Michelle Obama

2161.quote: Success is where preparation and opportunity meet.
2161.author: Bobby Unser

2162.quote: Learning and innovation go hand in hand. The arrogance of success is to think that what you did yesterday will be sufficient for tomorrow.
2162.author: William Pollard

2163.quote: The best revenge is massive success.
2163.author: Frank Sinatra

2164.quote: It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
2164.author: Winston Churchill

2165.quote: Success is nothing if you don't have the right people to share it with; you're just gonna end up lonely.
2165.author: Selena Gomez

2166.quote: Success is peace of mind which is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing you did your best to become the best you are capable of becoming.
2166.author: John Wooden

2167.quote: The secret of our success is that we never, never give up.
2167.author: Wilma Mankiller

2168.quote: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.
2168.author: Orison Swett Marden

2169.quote: I know of no single formula for success. But over the years I have observed that some attributes of leadership are universal and are often about finding ways of encouraging people to combine their efforts, their talents, their insights, their enthusiasm and their inspiration to work together.
2169.author: Queen Elizabeth II

2170.quote: Failures, repeated failures, are finger posts on the road to achievement. One fails forward toward success.
2170.author: C. S. Lewis

2171.quote: Success is not built on success. It's built on failure. It's built on frustration. Sometimes its built on catastrophe.
2171.author: Sumner Redstone

2172.quote: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
2172.author: John F. Kennedy

2173.quote: No man succeeds without a good woman behind him. Wife or mother, if it is both, he is twice blessed indeed.
2173.author: Godfrey Winn

2174.quote: The key to success is to focus our conscious mind on things we desire not things we fear.
2174.author: Brian Tracy

2175.quote: No one succeeds without effort... Those who succeed owe their success to perseverance.
2175.author: Ramana Maharshi

2176.quote: The way a team plays as a whole determines its success. You may have the greatest bunch of individual stars in the world, but if they don't play together, the club won't be worth a dime.
2176.author: Babe Ruth

2177.quote: At the end of the day, the most overwhelming key to a child's success is the positive involvement of parents.
2177.author: Jane D. Hull

2178.quote: Honesty and loyalty are key. If two people can be honest with each other about everything, that's probably the biggest key to success.
2178.author: Taylor Lautner

2179.quote: The road to success is always under construction.
2179.author: Arnold Palmer

2180.quote: There is never just one thing that leads to success for anyone. I feel it always a combination of passion, dedication, hard work, and being in the right place at the right time.
2180.author: Lauren Conrad

2181.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
2181.author: Henry David Thoreau

2182.quote: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.
2182.author: Helen Keller

2183.quote: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
2183.author: Booker T. Washington

2184.quote: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
2184.author: Alexander Graham Bell

2185.quote: If a man has been his mother's undisputed darling he retains throughout life the triumphant feeling, the confidence in success, which not seldom brings actual success along with it.
2185.author: Sigmund Freud

2186.quote: Creativity is the key to success in the future, and primary education is where teachers can bring creativity in children at that level.
2186.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

2187.quote: The secret of your success is determined by your daily agenda.
2187.author: John C. Maxwell

2188.quote: The definition of success to me is not necessarily a price tag, not fame, but having a good life, and being able to say I did the right thing at the end of the day.
2188.author: Jeremy Luke

2189.quote: The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty.
2189.author: Zig Ziglar

2190.quote: Success is a journey, not a destination.
2190.author: Ben Sweetland

2191.quote: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
2191.author: David Brinkley

2192.quote: Do you wish to rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.
2192.author: Saint Augustine

2193.quote: One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation.
2193.author: Arthur Ashe

2194.quote: Every soldier must know, before he goes into battle, how the little battle he is to fight fits into the larger picture, and how the success of his fighting will influence the battle as a whole.
2194.author: Bernard Law Montgomery

2195.quote: The art of effective listening is essential to clear communication, and clear communication is necessary to management success.
2195.author: James Cash Penney

2196.quote: I attribute my success to this - I never gave or took any excuse.
2196.author: Florence Nightingale

2197.quote: Growing up in a group home, and with an undiagnosed learning disability to boot, the odds of success were not on my side. But when I joined the high school football team, I learned the value of discipline, focus, persistence, and teamwork - all skills that have proven vital to my career as a C.E.O. and social entrepreneur.
2197.author: Darell Hammond

2198.quote: If there is any one secret of success, it lies in the ability to get the other person's point of view and see things from that person's angle as well as from your own.
2198.author: Henry Ford

2199.quote: To this day, just always treat people the way you want to be treated. Whether it's family or friends or co-workers, I think it's the most important thing. Whether you have success or don't have it, whether you're a good person is all that matters.
2199.author: Brenda Song

2200.quote: My success was due to good luck, hard work, and support and advice from friends and mentors. But most importantly, it depended on me to keep trying after I had failed.
2200.author: Mark Warner

2201.quote: Winning isn't everything, it's the only thing.
2201.author: Vince Lombardi

2202.quote: Man needs his difficulties because they are necessary to enjoy success.
2202.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

2203.quote: I wish I could just go tell all the young women I work with, all these fabulous women, 'Believe in yourself and negotiate for yourself. Own your own success.' I wish I could tell that to my daughter. But it's not that simple.
2203.author: Sheryl Sandberg

2204.quote: Victory has a thousand fathers, but defeat is an orphan.
2204.author: John F. Kennedy

2205.quote: Invincibility lies in the defence; the possibility of victory in the attack.
2205.author: Sun Tzu

2206.quote: A graduation ceremony is an event where the commencement speaker tells thousands of students dressed in identical caps and gowns that 'individuality' is the key to success.
2206.author: Robert Orben

2207.quote: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.
2207.author: John Wooden

2208.quote: I never expected any sort of success with 'Mockingbird'... I sort of hoped someone would like it enough to give me encouragement.
2208.author: Harper Lee

2209.quote: Just remember, you can't climb the ladder of success with your hands in your pockets.
2209.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

2210.quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
2210.author: Abraham Lincoln

2211.quote: The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.
2211.author: Ayn Rand

2212.quote: Success depends upon previous preparation, and without such preparation there is sure to be failure.
2212.author: Confucius

2213.quote: To be prepared is half the victory.
2213.author: Miguel de Cervantes

2214.quote: Our purpose in Vietnam is to prevent the success of aggression. It is not conquest, it is not empire, it is not foreign bases, it is not domination. It is, simply put, just to prevent the forceful conquest of South Vietnam by North Vietnam.
2214.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

2215.quote: No student ever attains very eminent success by simply doing what is required of him: it is the amount and excellence of what is over and above the required, that determines the greatness of ultimate distinction.
2215.author: Charles Kendall Adams

2216.quote: Success doesn't necessarily come from breakthrough innovation but from flawless execution. A great strategy alone won't win a game or a battle; the win comes from basic blocking and tackling.
2216.author: Naveen Jain

2217.quote: Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.
2217.author: W. Clement Stone

2218.quote: It's how you deal with failure that determines how you achieve success.
2218.author: Charlotte Whitton

2219.quote: A great social success is a pretty girl who plays her cards as carefully as if she were plain.
2219.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

2220.quote: I'm not really easy to live with! There needs to be unlimited patience and unconditional love. Men I've known before loved my independent spirit and were proud of my success, to the point that they'd become jealous of the time I devote to my career.
2220.author: Milla Jovovich

2221.quote: Sometimes we may ask God for success, and He gives us physical and mental stamina. We might plead for prosperity, and we receive enlarged perspective and increased patience, or we petition for growth and are blessed with the gift of grace. He may bestow upon us conviction and confidence as we strive to achieve worthy goals.
2221.author: David A. Bednar

2222.quote: The new midlife is where you realize that even your failures make you more beautiful and are turned spiritually into success if you became a better person because of them. You became a more humble person. You became a more merciful and compassionate person.
2222.author: Marianne Williamson

2223.quote: The grass is always greener on the other side - until you get there and see it's AstroTurf. Symbols are never reality. Someone might have amassed material success and fame, but that doesn't mean they're happy. So, don't go judging a person's life by the cover.
2223.author: Karen Salmansohn

2224.quote: Formula for success: rise early, work hard, strike oil.
2224.author: J. Paul Getty

2225.quote: Discipline is the soul of an army. It makes small numbers formidable; procures success to the weak, and esteem to all.
2225.author: George Washington

2226.quote: There is little success where there is little laughter.
2226.author: Andrew Carnegie

2227.quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
2227.author: Christopher Morley

2228.quote: I've failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.
2228.author: Michael Jordan

2229.quote: Success isn't measured by money or power or social rank. Success is measured by your discipline and inner peace.
2229.author: Mike Ditka

2230.quote: There are people who make things happen, there are people who watch things happen, and there are people who wonder what happened. To be successful, you need to be a person who makes things happen.
2230.author: Jim Lovell

2231.quote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
2231.author: Thomas A. Edison

2232.quote: There is nothing more difficult to take in hand, more perilous to conduct, or more uncertain in its success, than to take the lead in the introduction of a new order of things.
2232.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

2233.quote: In most things success depends on knowing how long it takes to succeed.
2233.author: Charles de Montesquieu

2234.quote: Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.
2234.author: Napoleon Hill

2235.quote: No matter how much success you're having, you can't continue working together if you can't communicate.
2235.author: Matt Cameron

2236.quote: Success is the progressive realization of a worthy goal or ideal.
2236.author: Earl Nightingale

2237.quote: That some achieve great success, is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.
2237.author: Abraham Lincoln

2238.quote: Desire is the key to motivation, but it's the determination and commitment to unrelenting pursuit of your goal - a commitment to excellence - that will enable you to attain the success you seek.
2238.author: Mario Andretti

2239.quote: People think that at the top there isn't much room. They tend to think of it as an Everest. My message is that there is tons of room at the top.
2239.author: Margaret Thatcher

2241.quote: I can't imagine a person becoming a success who doesn't give this game of life everything he's got.
2241.author: Walter Cronkite

2242.quote: What's money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.
2242.author: Bob Dylan

2243.quote: The secret of success is to be in harmony with existence, to be always calm to let each wave of life wash us a little farther up the shore.
2243.author: Cyril Connolly

2244.quote: The five essential entrepreneurial skills for success: Concentration, Discrimination, Organization, Innovation and Communication.
2244.author: Harold S. Geneen

2245.quote: If you find it in your heart to care for somebody else, you will have succeeded.
2245.author: Maya Angelou

2246.quote: In order to attain the impossible, one must attempt the absurd.
2246.author: Miguel de Cervantes

2247.quote: We should measure welfare's success by how many people leave welfare, not by how many are added.
2247.author: Ronald Reagan

2248.quote: Success has a simple formula: do your best, and people may like it.
2248.author: Sam Ewing

2249.quote: The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.
2249.author: Theodore Roosevelt

2250.quote: Success or failure depends more upon attitude than upon capacity successful men act as though they have accomplished or are enjoying something. Soon it becomes a reality. Act, look, feel successful, conduct yourself accordingly, and you will be amazed at the positive results.
2250.author: William James

2251.quote: The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.
2251.author: Robert Kiyosaki

2252.quote: Before everything else, getting ready is the secret of success.
2252.author: Henry Ford

2253.quote: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
2253.author: John D. Rockefeller

2254.quote: The secret of success is learning how to use pain and pleasure instead of having pain and pleasure use you. If you do that, you're in control of your life. If you don't, life controls you.
2254.author: Tony Robbins

2255.quote: The battle of life is, in most cases, fought uphill; and to win it without a struggle were perhaps to win it without honor. If there were no difficulties there would be no success; if there were nothing to struggle for, there would be nothing to be achieved.
2255.author: Samuel Smiles

2256.quote: I think that my biggest attribute to any success that I have had is hard work. There really is no substitute for working hard.
2256.author: Maria Bartiromo

2257.quote: The delusions of self-love cannot be prevented, but intellectual misconceptions as to the means of achieving success may be corrected.
2257.author: George Henry Lewes

2258.quote: Ambition is the path to success, persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
2258.author: William Eardley IV

2259.quote: The Nationals tried hard to recover the lost ground. The final result, however, was the success of the Forest Citys by a score of 29 to 23 in a nine innings game, twice interrupted by rain.
2259.author: Henry Chadwick

2260.quote: I have an idea of who I want to be, I have a vision of my own success.
2260.author: Wiz Khalifa

2261.quote: You wanna know what scares people? Success. When you don't make moves and when you don't climb up the ladder, everybody loves you because you're not competition.
2261.author: Nicki Minaj

2262.quote: I think it's way harder when you have success, 'cause people tend to not treat you the same or look at you the same because they see the success or the money you make.
2262.author: Meek Mill

2263.quote: Make treating yourself a priority and always remember your life is happening now. Don't put off all your dreams and pleasures to another day. In any balanced personal definition of success there has to be a powerful element of living life in the present.
2263.author: Mireille Guiliano

2264.quote: Problems or successes, they all are the results of our own actions. Karma. The philosophy of action is that no one else is the giver of peace or happiness. One's own karma, one's own actions are responsible to come to bring either happiness or success or whatever.
2264.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

2265.quote: Being kind is the most important thing I've ever been taught. That's what my parents always told me - more important than ambition or success is being kind to people. The cornerstone of my life. What I aspire to is to be kind.
2265.author: Rafe Spall

2266.quote: Your positive action combined with positive thinking results in success.
2266.author: Shiv Khera

2267.quote: If you set your goals ridiculously high and it's a failure, you will fail above everyone else's success.
2267.author: James Cameron

2268.quote: A manager is a guide. He takes a group of people and says, 'With you I can make us a success; I can show you the way.'
2268.author: Arsene Wenger

2269.quote: You are loved just for being who you are, just for existing. You don't have to do anything to earn it. Your shortcomings, your lack of self-esteem, physical perfection, or social and economic success - none of that matters. No one can take this love away from you, and it will always be here.
2269.author: Ram Dass

2270.quote: I'm always asked, 'What's the secret to success?' But there are no secrets. Be humble. Be hungry. And always be the hardest worker in the room.
2270.author: Dwayne Johnson

2271.quote: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
2271.author: Dale Carnegie

2272.quote: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success.
2272.author: Irving Berlin

2273.quote: It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things.
2273.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2274.quote: Sometimes I worry about being a success in a mediocre world.
2274.author: Lily Tomlin

2275.quote: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. There's no point in being a damn fool about it.
2275.author: W. C. Fields

2276.quote: True success is overcoming the fear of being unsuccessful.
2276.author: Paul Sweeney

2277.quote: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
2277.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

2278.quote: If you wish to be a success in the world, promise everything, deliver nothing.
2278.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

2279.quote: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
2279.author: Henry David Thoreau

2280.quote: I do not think that there is any other quality so essential to success of any kind as the quality of perseverance. It overcomes almost everything, even nature.
2280.author: John D. Rockefeller

2281.quote: Always remember that striving and struggle precede success, even in the dictionary.
2281.author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

2282.quote: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
2282.author: Elbert Hubbard

2283.quote: Success is only meaningful and enjoyable if it feels like your own.
2283.author: Michelle Obama

2284.quote: Education is a fundamental principle of what made America a success. We can't afford to throw any young people away.
2284.author: Ben Carson

2285.quote: My biggest success is getting over the things that have tried to destroy and take me out of this life. Those are my biggest successes. It has nothing to do with work.
2285.author: Tyler Perry

2286.quote: At the end of the day, you are solely responsible for your success and your failure. And the sooner you realize that, you accept that, and integrate that into your work ethic, you will start being successful. As long as you blame others for the reason you aren't where you want to be, you will always be a failure.
2286.author: Erin Cummings

2287.quote: Believe it or not, I have about the same success rate as anyone else. Sometimes you hit, sometimes you miss.
2287.author: Seth MacFarlane

2288.quote: Just remember: to be grateful and thank the people who are there and support you along the way is a great start to success.
2288.author: Meryl Davis

2289.quote: Basically, when you get to my age, you'll really measure your success in life by how many of the people you want to have love you actually do love you.
2289.author: Warren Buffett

2290.quote: A champion is afraid of losing. Everyone else is afraid of winning.
2290.author: Billie Jean King

2291.quote: The successful man will profit from his mistakes and try again in a different way.
2291.author: Dale Carnegie

2292.quote: Success is counted sweetest by those who never succeed.
2292.author: Emily Dickinson

2294.quote: Success consists of getting up just one more time than you fall.
2294.author: Oliver Goldsmith

2295.quote: There is no success without hardship.
2295.author: Sophocles

2296.quote: The secret of my success is a two word answer: Know people.
2296.author: Harvey S. Firestone

2297.quote: Our worldly successes cannot be guaranteed, but our ability to achieve spiritual success is entirely up to us, thanks to the grace of God. The best advice I know is to give is to give those worldly things your best but never your all - reserve the ultimate hope for the only one who can grant it.
2297.author: Mitt Romney

2298.quote: The real secret of success is enthusiasm.
2298.author: Walter Chrysler

2299.quote: I couldn't wait for success, so I went ahead without it.
2299.author: Jonathan Winters

2300.quote: I believe in luck: how else can you explain the success of those you dislike?
2300.author: Jean Cocteau

2301.quote: Any fact facing us is not as important as our attitude toward it, for that determines our success or failure. The way you think about a fact may defeat you before you ever do anything about it. You are overcome by the fact because you think you are.
2301.author: Norman Vincent Peale

2302.quote: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.
2302.author: Dale Turner

2303.quote: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
2303.author: George Bernard Shaw

2304.quote: I do not think there is any thrill that can go through the human heart like that felt by the inventor as he sees some creation of the brain unfolding to success... such emotions make a man forget food, sleep, friends, love, everything.
2304.author: Nikola Tesla

2305.quote: Success is not to be pursued; it is to be attracted by the person you become.
2305.author: Jim Rohn

2306.quote: The decadent international but individualistic capitalism in the hands of which we found ourselves after the war is not a success. It is not intelligent. It is not beautiful. It is not just. It is not virtuous. And it doesn't deliver the goods.
2306.author: John Maynard Keynes

2307.quote: Most great people have attained their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
2307.author: Napoleon Hill

2308.quote: What material success does is provide you with the ability to concentrate on other things that really matter. And that is being able to make a difference, not only in your own life, but in other people's lives.
2308.author: Oprah Winfrey

2309.quote: For marriage to be a success, every woman and every man should have her and his own bathroom. The end.
2309.author: Catherine Zeta-Jones

2310.quote: I am an enthusiast, but not a crank in the sense that I have some pet theories as to the proper construction of a flying machine. I wish to avail myself of all that is already known and then, if possible, add my mite to help on the future worker who will attain final success.
2310.author: Wilbur Wright

2311.quote: Success cannot come from standstill men. Methods change and men must change with them.
2311.author: James Cash Penney

2312.quote: To these ideals which were instilled in me when I was a youth, I attribute in a large degree the success that was mine on the bicycle tracks of the world.
2312.author: Major Taylor

2313.quote: Happy people are ignoramuses and glory is nothing else but success, and to achieve it one only has to be cunning.
2313.author: Mikhail Lermontov

2314.quote: The winner's edge is not in a gifted birth, a high IQ, or in talent. The winner's edge is all in the attitude, not aptitude. Attitude is the criterion for success.
2314.author: Denis Waitley

2315.quote: Success is a journey, not a destination. The doing is often more important than the outcome.
2315.author: Arthur Ashe

2316.quote: My parents shared not only an improbable love, they shared an abiding faith in the possibilities of this nation. They would give me an African name, Barack, or blessed, believing that in a tolerant America your name is no barrier to success.
2316.author: Barack Obama

2318.quote: You might well remember that nothing can bring you success but yourself.
2318.author: Napoleon Hill

2319.quote: Never continue in a job you don't enjoy. If you're happy in what you're doing, you'll like yourself, you'll have inner peace. And if you have that, along with physical health, you will have had more success than you could possibly have imagined.
2319.author: Johnny Carson

2320.quote: When humor can be made to alternate with melancholy, one has a success, but when the same things are funny and melancholic at the same time, it's just wonderful.
2320.author: Francois Truffaut

2321.quote: I think the biggest challenge is to continue on the same path. I think it's easy to become complacent from the success you've had.
2321.author: Jason Derulo

2322.quote: Success is peace of mind, which is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing you made the effort to become the best of which you are capable.
2322.author: John Wooden

2323.quote: My success has been something I've worked a long time at and it's been a gradual process. I compare it to the idea of someone losing a lot of weight over a period of a few years. You don't really notice the weight loss overall but if you compare photos from then and now there's a big difference.
2323.author: Ray William Johnson

2324.quote: I used to be really cute. I could send you earlier photos where I'm stunning. But I've gained about twenty pounds over the past two years, and the more weight I've put on, the more success I've had. If you drew a diagram of weight gain and me getting more work, a mathematician would draw some conclusions from that.
2324.author: Zach Galifianakis

2326.quote: We dissect failure a lot more than we dissect success.
2326.author: Matthew McConaughey

2327.quote: The moment we believe that success is determined by an ingrained level of ability as opposed to resilience and hard work, we will be brittle in the face of adversity.
2327.author: Joshua Waitzkin

2328.quote: A friend at school was always being laughed at because his father emptied dustbins for a living. But those who laughed worshipped famous footballers. This is an example of our topsy-turvy view of 'success.' Who would we miss most if they did not work for a month, the footballer or the garbage collector?
2328.author: David Icke

2329.quote: Fame and success and titles stay with you, but they wear out eventually. In the end, all that you are left with is your character.
2329.author: Ana Ivanovic

2330.quote: Over the years, I've become barraged by comments from people, such as, 'Beam me up, Scotty!' and I became defensive. I felt they were derisive and engendered an attitude. I am grateful for the success, but didn't want to be mocked.
2330.author: William Shatner

2331.quote: I love 'Braxton Family Values!' I love seeing a strong family unit striving for success while dealing with everyday struggles like everyone else. Whatever drama they find themselves in, they find a way to solve it and get back to the importance of family. A positive show for sure.
2331.author: Drew Sidora

2332.quote: The thing I always say to people is this: 'If you avoid failure, you also avoid success.'
2332.author: Robert Kiyosaki

2333.quote: Earn your success based on service to others, not at the expense of others.
2333.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

2334.quote: Socialism has no moral justification whatsoever; poor people are not morally superior to rich people, nor are they owed anything by rich people simply because of their lack of success. Charity is not a socialist concept - it is a religious one, an acknowledgment of God's sovereignty over property, a sovereignty the Left utterly rejects.
2334.author: Ben Shapiro

2335.quote: Ask any successful person to look back over the events of his or her life, and chances are there'll be a turning point of one kind or another. It doesn't matter if that success has come on a ball field or in a boardroom, in a research laboratory or on a campaign trail - it can usually be traced to some pivotal moment.
2335.author: Bill Rancic

2336.quote: Let every man feel that he is the architect and builder of his own life, and that he proposes to make a success of it by working.
2336.author: Heber J. Grant

2337.quote: From exam grading to health education to professional training to democratic participation, paths towards self-realization and success in the world are often daunting and obscure: journeys only the privileged feel confident setting off along.
2337.author: Tom Chatfield

2338.quote: I think success is the biggest challenge you have to handle in the National Football League; that's something we talk about a lot.
2338.author: Mike McCarthy

2339.quote: To put it bluntly, there isn't one economic theory that can single-handedly explain Singapore's success; its economy combines extreme features of capitalism and socialism. All theories are partial; reality is complex.
2339.author: Ha-Joon Chang

2340.quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
2340.author: Euripides

2341.quote: Love is when the other person's happiness is more important than your own.
2341.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

2342.quote: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
2342.author: George Sand

2343.quote: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
2343.author: Omar Khayyam

2344.quote: Today I choose life. Every morning when I wake up I can choose joy, happiness, negativity, pain... To feel the freedom that comes from being able to continue to make mistakes and choices - today I choose to feel life, not to deny my humanity but embrace it.
2344.author: Kevyn Aucoin

2345.quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
2345.author: Albert Schweitzer

2346.quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
2346.author: Jim Rohn

2347.quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
2347.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2348.quote: A smile is happiness you'll find right under your nose.
2348.author: Tom Wilson

2349.quote: It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.
2349.author: Charles Spurgeon

2350.quote: Some days are just bad days, that's all. You have to experience sadness to know happiness, and I remind myself that not every day is going to be a good day, that's just the way it is!
2350.author: Dita Von Teese

2351.quote: Let us never know what old age is. Let us know the happiness time brings, not count the years.
2351.author: Ausonius

2352.quote: I am determined to be cheerful and happy in whatever situation I may find myself. For I have learned that the greater part of our misery or unhappiness is determined not by our circumstance but by our disposition.
2352.author: Martha Washington

2353.quote: The best way to pay for a lovely moment is to enjoy it.
2353.author: Richard Bach

2354.quote: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
2354.author: Buddha

2355.quote: Christmas is the spirit of giving without a thought of getting. It is happiness because we see joy in people. It is forgetting self and finding time for others. It is discarding the meaningless and stressing the true values.
2355.author: Thomas S. Monson

2356.quote: Every day we have plenty of opportunities to get angry, stressed or offended. But what you're doing when you indulge these negative emotions is giving something outside yourself power over your happiness. You can choose to not let little things upset you.
2356.author: Joel Osteen

2357.quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
2357.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

2358.quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
2358.author: Dalai Lama

2359.quote: If you want to be happy, be.
2359.author: Leo Tolstoy

2360.quote: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude.
2360.author: Denis Waitley

2361.quote: Red is such an interesting color to correlate with emotion, because it's on both ends of the spectrum. On one end you have happiness, falling in love, infatuation with someone, passion, all that. On the other end, you've got obsession, jealousy, danger, fear, anger and frustration.
2361.author: Taylor Swift

2362.quote: Our greatest happiness does not depend on the condition of life in which chance has placed us, but is always the result of a good conscience, good health, occupation, and freedom in all just pursuits.
2362.author: Thomas Jefferson

2363.quote: The true secret of happiness lies in taking a genuine interest in all the details of daily life.
2363.author: William Morris

2364.quote: Happiness is a choice. You can choose to be happy. There's going to be stress in life, but it's your choice whether you let it affect you or not.
2364.author: Valerie Bertinelli

2365.quote: True happiness is... to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
2365.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

2366.quote: You take away all the other luxuries in life, and if you can make someone smile and laugh, you have given the most special gift: happiness.
2366.author: Brad Garrett
