3272.quote: Nothing goes by luck in composition. It allows of no tricks. The best you can write will be the best you are.
3272.author: Henry David Thoreau

3273.quote: A visitor from Mars could easily pick out the civilized nations. They have the best implements of war.
3273.author: Herbert V. Prochnow

3274.quote: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
3274.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

3275.quote: Infinite striving to be the best is man's duty; it is its own reward. Everything else is in God's hands.
3275.author: Mahatma Gandhi

3276.quote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
3276.author: Voltaire

3277.quote: Today you are you! That is truer than true! There is no one alive who is you-er than you!
3277.author: Dr. Seuss

3278.quote: Let us never know what old age is. Let us know the happiness time brings, not count the years.
3278.author: Ausonius

3279.quote: There are two great days in a person's life - the day we are born and the day we discover why.
3279.author: William Barclay

3280.quote: A birthday is just another day where you go to work and people give you love. Age is just a state of mind, and you are as old as you think you are. You have to count your blessings and be happy.
3280.author: Abhishek Bachchan

3281.quote: Don't just count your years, make your years count.
3281.author: George Meredith

3282.quote: Age is a case of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it don't matter.
3282.author: Satchel Paige

3283.quote: Cakes are special. Every birthday, every celebration ends with something sweet, a cake, and people remember. It's all about the memories.
3283.author: Buddy Valastro

3284.quote: The greatest gifts you can give your children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence.
3284.author: Denis Waitley

3285.quote: It takes a long time to become young.
3285.author: Pablo Picasso

3286.quote: The greatest gift that you can give to others is the gift of unconditional love and acceptance.
3286.author: Brian Tracy

3287.quote: You take away all the other luxuries in life, and if you can make someone smile and laugh, you have given the most special gift: happiness.
3287.author: Brad Garrett

3288.quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
3288.author: Oprah Winfrey

3290.quote: You know you're getting old when the candles cost more than the cake.
3290.author: Bob Hope

3291.quote: If you look over the years, the styles have changed - the clothes, the hair, the production, the approach to the songs. The icing to the cake has changed flavors. But if you really look at the cake itself, it's really the same.
3291.author: John Oates

3292.quote: Any time women come together with a collective intention, it's a powerful thing. Whether it's sitting down making a quilt, in a kitchen preparing a meal, in a club reading the same book, or around the table playing cards, or planning a birthday party, when women come together with a collective intention, magic happens.
3292.author: Phylicia Rashad

3293.quote: Let us celebrate the occasion with wine and sweet words.
3293.author: Plautus

3294.quote: You don't get older, you get better.
3294.author: Shirley Bassey

3295.quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are?
3295.author: Satchel Paige

3296.quote: The way I see it, you should live everyday like its your birthday.
3296.author: Paris Hilton

3297.quote: Presents don't really mean much to me. I don't want to sound mawkish, but - it was the realization that I have a great many people in my life who really love me, and who I really love.
3297.author: Gabriel Byrne

3298.quote: The great thing about getting older is that you don't lose all the other ages you've been.
3298.author: Madeleine L'Engle

3299.quote: All the world is birthday cake, so take a piece, but not too much.
3299.author: George Harrison

3300.quote: Our birthdays are feathers in the broad wing of time.
3300.author: Jean Paul

3301.quote: I intend to live forever. So far, so good.
3301.author: Steven Wright

3302.quote: I quit high school on my birthday. It was my senior year and I didn't see the point. This was 1962, and I was ready to make music.
3302.author: Barry White

3303.quote: About astrology and palmistry: they are good because they make people vivid and full of possibilities. They are communism at its best. Everybody has a birthday and almost everybody has a palm.
3303.author: Kurt Vonnegut

3304.quote: To me - old age is always ten years older than I am.
3304.author: Bernard Baruch

3305.quote: I think, at a child's birth, if a mother could ask a fairy godmother to endow it with the most useful gift, that gift should be curiosity.
3305.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

3306.quote: It is lovely, when I forget all birthdays, including my own, to find that somebody remembers me.
3306.author: Ellen Glasgow

3307.quote: Your children need your presence more than your presents.
3307.author: Jesse Jackson

3308.quote: There is still no cure for the common birthday.
3308.author: John Glenn

3309.quote: I kept a diary right after I was born. Day 1: Tired from the move. Day 2: Everyone thinks I'm an idiot.
3309.author: Steven Wright

3311.quote: I had a birthday one night on a farm we were shooting on. I walked into the tent, and there were 150 people waiting for me, all wearing masks of my face.
3311.author: Stephen Hopkins

3312.quote: I want to say that probably 24 hours after I told CBS that I was stepping down at my 65th birthday, I was already regretting it. And I regretted it every day since.
3312.author: Walter Cronkite

3313.quote: I'm most comfortable in my birthday suit.
3313.author: Amanda Seyfried

3314.quote: Mum loves me being famous! She is so excited and proud, as she had me so young and couldn't support me, so I am living her dream, it's sweeter for both of us. It's her 40th birthday soon and I'm going to buy her 40 presents.
3314.author: Adele

3315.quote: When I was a kid, for my birthday every year, my mother made me pasta bechamel, which is rigatoni with a white cream sauce.
3315.author: Giada De Laurentiis

3316.quote: I had Hallowe'en parties every year, as it was my birthday five days before. My parents would actually put prosthetic noses on, and my dad would wear a top-hat and tails, put on a fake curly moustache, and hold a pipe.
3316.author: Bat for Lashes

3317.quote: The more Mommy blogs going nuclear over playground etiquette I read and birthday parties of glazed adults munching cupcakes like demoralized zombies I attend, I realize this is what my friends who conceived before me meant by, 'You just won't care.'
3317.author: Emma McLaughlin

3318.quote: I was honoured when they asked me to appear at the president's birthday rally in Madison Square Garden. There was like a hush over the whole place when I came on to sing 'Happy Birthday,' like if I had been wearing a slip, I would have thought it was showing or something. I thought, 'Oh, my gosh, what if no sound comes out!'
3318.author: Marilyn Monroe

3319.quote: The worst part about celebrating another birthday is the shock that you're only as well as you are.
3319.author: Anne Lamott

3320.quote: Love the giver more than the gift.
3320.author: Brigham Young

3321.quote: If you can give your child only one gift, let it be enthusiasm.
3321.author: Bruce Barton

3322.quote: The best way to remember your wife's birthday is to forget it once.
3322.author: E. Joseph Cossman

3323.quote: The only thing better than singing is more singing.
3323.author: Ella Fitzgerald

3324.quote: I don't pay attention to the number of birthdays. It's weird when I say I'm 53. It just is crazy that I'm 53. I think I'm very immature. I feel like a kid. That's why my back goes out all the time, because I completely forget I can't do certain things anymore - like doing the plank for 10 minutes.
3324.author: Ellen DeGeneres

3325.quote: A gift consists not in what is done or given, but in the intention of the giver or doer.
3325.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

3326.quote: People give one another things that can't be gift wrapped.
3326.author: Nadine Gordimer

3327.quote: It was on my fifth birthday that Papa put his hand on my shoulder and said, 'Remember, my son, if you ever need a helping hand, you'll find one at the end of your arm.'
3327.author: Sam Levenson

3328.quote: Every year on your birthday, you get a chance to start new.
3328.author: Sammy Hagar

3329.quote: The return of my birthday, if I remember it, fills me with thoughts which it seems to be the general care of humanity to escape.
3329.author: Samuel Johnson

3330.quote: For my birthday I got a humidifier and a de-humidifier... I put them in the same room and let them fight it out.
3330.author: Steven Wright

3331.quote: I remember when the candle shop burned down. Everyone stood around singing 'Happy Birthday.'
3331.author: Steven Wright

3332.quote: When someone asks if you'd like cake or pie, why not say you want cake and pie?
3332.author: Lisa Loeb

3333.quote: To give somebody your time is the biggest gift you can give.
3333.author: Franka Potente

3334.quote: It's odd the things that people remember. Parents will arrange a birthday party, certain it will stick in your mind forever. You'll have a nice time, then two years later you'll be like, 'There was a pony there? Really? And a clown with one leg?'
3334.author: David Sedaris

3335.quote: My policy on cake is pro having it and pro eating it.
3335.author: Boris Johnson

3336.quote: Most of us can remember a time when a birthday - especially if it was one's own - brightened the world as if a second sun has risen.
3336.author: Robert Staughton Lynd

3337.quote: My life is better with every year of living it.
3337.author: Rachel Maddow

3338.quote: For my birthday this year, my girlfriends - who knew I'd just inherited my dad's turntable - gave me a carton of albums like 'Blue Kentucky Girl,' by Emmylou Harris, and 'Off the Wall,' by Michael Jackson. It's all stuff we grew up with. I mean, you can't have a music collection without Prince's 'Purple Rain' - it just can't be done!
3338.author: Connie Britton

3339.quote: My ace in the hole as a human being used to be my capacity for remembering birthdays. I worked at it. Whenever I made a new friend, I made a point of finding out his or her birthday early on, and I would record it in my Filofax calendar.
3339.author: Susan Orlean

3340.quote: For my birthday my husband learned to cook and is cooking one day a week for me. But he only likes to do fancy dishes. So we end up with weird, obscure things in the refrigerator.
3340.author: Cheryl Hines

3341.quote: As a child, I always chose a false nose and some face paint and a wig for my birthday.
3341.author: Ashley Jensen

3342.quote: I think there's something about the homemade birthday cake, because my wife, on my daughter's first birthday, started the tradition where she takes a full cake and cuts the number birthday out of it.
3342.author: Willie Geist

3343.quote: The day which we fear as our last is but the birthday of eternity.
3343.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

3344.quote: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.
3344.author: Robert Frost

3345.quote: Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you're exactly the same.
3345.author: Audrey Hepburn

3346.quote: You always get a special kick on opening day, no matter how many you go through. You look forward to it like a birthday party when you're a kid. You think something wonderful is going to happen.
3346.author: Joe DiMaggio

3347.quote: The American flag is an enduring symbol of liberty, democracy, and justice. It is fitting that the House act to protect it as we approach our nation's birthday, and as our men and women in uniform rally behind it in Iraq's battlefields.
3347.author: Joe Barton

3348.quote: John Candy knew he was going to die. He told me on his 40th birthday. He said, well, Maureen, I'm on borrowed time.
3348.author: Maureen O'Hara

3349.quote: New Year's Day is every man's birthday.
3349.author: Charles Lamb

3350.quote: The turning point was when I hit my 30th birthday. I thought, if really want to write, it's time to start. I picked up the book How to Write a Novel in 90 Days. The author said to just write three pages a day, and I figured, I can do this. I never got past Page 3 of that book.
3350.author: James Rollins

3351.quote: I just had my 30th birthday and we went turkey shooting. It's what I wanted to do, so we went.
3351.author: Kelly Clarkson

3352.quote: Anybody can have a birthday. It requires nothing. Murderers have birthdays. It's the opposite of anything that I believe in. And I don't like at work where you stop everything to sing 'Happy Birthday' to someone. I feel like that's for children.
3352.author: Mindy Kaling

3353.quote: Some people won't go the extra mile, and then on their birthday, when no one makes a fuss, they feel neglected and bitter.
3353.author: Anne Lamott

3354.quote: I saw Richard Linklater's film 'Slacker' for my twenty-first birthday. That was the moment when it all seemed possible. This guy gave me hope.
3354.author: Kevin Smith

3355.quote: The Queen of Crafts herself, Martha Stewart, and I have the same birthday. I prefer to think it's the glue-gun wielding, perfect-tart-producing Martha and not the copper pan-throwing, jail-going Martha. But I suppose if I am going to share a calendar square with some of Martha, I have to share it with all of Martha.
3355.author: Sloane Crosley

3356.quote: I joined the army on my seventeenth birthday, full of the romance of war after having read a lot of World War I British poetry and having seen a lot of post-World War II films. I thought the romantic presentations of war influenced my joining and my presentation of war to my younger siblings.
3356.author: Walter Dean Myers

3357.quote: I got my first camera when I was 21 - my boyfriend gave it to me for my birthday - but at that point politics was my life, and I viewed the camera as a tool for expressing my political beliefs rather than as an art medium.
3357.author: Carrie Mae Weems

3358.quote: In the Mexican culture, we never miss a baptism, a birthday, a baby shower, a wedding shower, a wedding. You must show up. Otherwise, you'll be in big trouble.
3358.author: Eva Longoria

3359.quote: I believe that at least 70 percent of parenting goes to the mother. In our house, I'm the one who knows about all the school stuff, helps with the homework, organizes the play dates, and remembers the birthday parties.
3359.author: Cindy Crawford

3360.quote: I threw my 20th birthday party at Brown, and I didn't even have to say to anyone not to put pictures on Facebook. Not a single picture went up. That was when I knew I'd found a solid group of friends, and I felt like I belonged.
3360.author: Emma Watson

3361.quote: I'm not a big birthday guy; I never have been.
3361.author: Lewis Black

3362.quote: I wanted Cathy and Irving to actually say 'I do' and be pronounced husband and wife on Feb. 5, which is my mom's birthday.
3362.author: Cathy Guisewite

3363.quote: I was standing right behind Marilyn, completely invisible, when she sang 'Happy birthday, Mr. President.' And indeed, the corny thing happened: Her dress split for my benefit, and there was Marilyn, and yes, indeed, she didn't wear any underwear.
3363.author: Mike Nichols

3364.quote: I promised myself: Before your 18th birthday, you're going to be at Jean Paul Gaultier. And it worked. I was hired.
3364.author: Nicolas Ghesquiere

3365.quote: I turned 40 on the set of the reunion show for 'Sheer Genius,' so it wasn't a hideous birthday because I had everyone on the cast and crew sing 'Happy Birthday' to me, and I won $10,000 for being the fan favorite. It was really liberating to turn 40 and realize that I felt very comfortable with myself and knew who I was.
3365.author: Tabatha Coffey

3366.quote: My happiest memory of childhood was my first birthday in reform school. This teacher took an interest in me. In fact, he gave me the first birthday presents I ever got: a box of Cracker Jacks and a can of ABC shoe polish.
3366.author: Flip Wilson

3367.quote: At my age flowers scare me.
3367.author: George Burns

3368.quote: You know you're getting old when you get that one candle on the cake. It's like, 'See if you can blow this out.'
3368.author: Jerry Seinfeld

3369.quote: There are three hundred and sixty-four days when you might get un-birthday presents, and only one for birthday presents, you know.
3369.author: Lewis Carroll

3370.quote: I was forced to live far beyond my years when just a child, now I have reversed the order and I intend to remain young indefinitely.
3370.author: Mary Pickford

3371.quote: A gift, with a kind countenance, is a double present.
3371.author: Thomas Fuller

3372.quote: I cried on my 18th birthday. I thought 17 was such a nice age. You're young enough to get away with things, but you're old enough, too.
3372.author: Liv Tyler

3373.quote: I'm not materialistic. I believe in presents from the heart, like a drawing that a child does.
3373.author: Victoria Beckham

3374.quote: I like to go to anybody else's birthday, and if I'm invited I'm a good guest. But I never celebrate my birthdays. I really don't care.
3374.author: Mikhail Baryshnikov

3375.quote: My biggest hero, Gregory Peck, was my birthday present on April 14, 1973. I just sat and stared at him.
3375.author: Loretta Lynn

3376.quote: The main prank that we play with props is for people's birthdays. The special effects people will put a little explosive in the cake so it blows up in their face - that's always fun to play on a guest star, or one of the trainees or someone who's new.
3376.author: Catherine Bell

3377.quote: At her birthday, my seven-year-old daughter will say that she wants these big cakes and certain expensive toys as presents, and I can't say no to her. It would just break my heart. But when I was little, for birthdays we just played outside and we were happy if we got any cake.
3377.author: Goran Ivanisevic

3378.quote: My mom FedExes a red velvet cake she makes from scratch to me every birthday.
3378.author: Molly Sims

3379.quote: I do like to shock and surprise people. When it's all in good fun, of course.
3379.author: Ruth Warrick

3380.quote: We'll take the cake with the red cherry on top.
3380.author: Navjot Singh Sidhu

3381.quote: When I was in elementary school, I used to write letters to myself. I'd write letters and go 'Dear Kristen-at-16-years-old, happy birthday. I hope you're doing something.'
3381.author: Kristin Kreuk

3382.quote: My mother asked me what I wanted for my birthday, so I said I wanted to read poetry with her.
3382.author: Guy Johnson

3383.quote: I binge when I'm happy. When everything is going really well, every day is like I'm at a birthday party.
3383.author: Kirstie Alley

3384.quote: Handmade presents are scary because they reveal that you have too much free time.
3384.author: Douglas Coupland

3385.quote: I love a card. You know, cards? At birthdays? I collect them.
3385.author: Adele

3386.quote: I get uncomfortable when people give me presents and watch me open them. I don't have birthday parties, because the idea of a group of people singing and looking at me while I'm blowing out candles gives me hives.
3386.author: Brit Marling

3387.quote: Every day, every birthday candle I blow out, every penny I throw over my shoulder in a wishing well, every time my daughter says, 'Let's make a wish on a star,' there's one thing I wish for: wisdom.
3387.author: Rene Russo

3388.quote: I'm a summer baby, so I usually have my birthday as a good summer memory.
3388.author: Sloane Crosley

3389.quote: I have an extensive library - every birthday when I was a kid my parents would ask what movie or book I wanted, so I have built up a big collection over the years.
3389.author: Mark Bridges

3390.quote: When I was young and it was someone's birthday, I didn't have the money to buy nice presents so I would take my mom's camera and make a movie parody for whoever's birthday it was. When I'd show it them, they'd die laughing. That reaction was a high for me, and I loved that feeling.
3390.author: David Henrie

3391.quote: I have 'Happy Birthday' in multiple languages on my iPod - I like to play it at company birthday parties.
3391.author: Yigal Azrouel

3392.quote: If I have the power to post 'Happy Birthday' on someone's Facebook page and make them feel really good, it feels really good to make other people feel really good. I love it. I'm a huge Facebook and Twitter person. And I love talking to my fans. It's fun.
3392.author: Rebecca Mader

3393.quote: I jumped out of an airplane on my 34th birthday because I promised myself I would. I have an interest in confronting my fears.
3393.author: Michael Trucco

3394.quote: I like birthday cake. It's so symbolic. It's a tempting symbol to load with something more complicated than just 'Happy birthday!' because it's this emblem of childhood and a happy day.
3394.author: Aimee Bender

3395.quote: With my wife I don't get no respect. I made a toast on her birthday to 'the best woman a man ever had.' The waiter joined me.
3395.author: Rodney Dangerfield

3396.quote: It was my 16th birthday - my mom and dad gave me my Goya classical guitar that day. I sat down, wrote this song, and I just knew that that was the only thing I could ever really do - write songs and sing them to people.
3396.author: Stevie Nicks

3397.quote: And currently, there are four to five new works in the pipeline for upcoming celebrations such as the Sydney 2000 Olympics, Australian Federation, my 50th Birthday, and Sydney Dance Company's 25th Anniversary.
3397.author: Graeme Murphy

3398.quote: I went to a rare live Van Dyke show and met him there. And then he came to a show of mine and we spoke back stage. The third time was at Brian Wilson's birthday party.
3398.author: Matthew Sweet

3399.quote: I'm trying to get the record that I made at my birthday party last year, trying to get that out, and the lawyers are diddling around with it and it probably won't be out until next year. I don't know.
3399.author: Marian McPartland

3400.quote: I wrapped my Christmas presents early this year, but I used the wrong paper. See, the paper I used said 'Happy Birthday' on it. I didn't want to waste it so I just wrote 'Jesus' on it.
3400.author: Demetri Martin

3401.quote: For the youth, the indignation of most things will just surge as each birthday passes.
3401.author: Chris Evans

3402.quote: I tried to bake a cake for my mother's birthday - it took me four hours. It was terrible, and I cried for three days.
3402.author: Rachael Ray

3403.quote: I've looked after my money. As I started working around my third birthday, my first check went straight to the bank.
3403.author: Samantha Barks

3404.quote: I started running around my 30th birthday. I wanted to lose weight; I didn't anticipate the serenity. Being in motion, suddenly my body was busy and so my head could work out some issues I had swept under a carpet of wine and cheese. Good therapy, that's a good run.
3404.author: Michael Weatherly

3405.quote: I've got some incredible fans actually - so loyal and they make me birthday cards and Christmas cards. I got this package of poems and artwork based around the songs. They've got this thing called 'Floetry' where they all have to put in artwork. They've set up their own competitions and stuff which is kind of amazing.
3405.author: Florence Welch

3406.quote: I was born full grown in the middle of a hurricane and an earthquake on 10 September 1954, 12.52 P.M. When I found out that I had missed lunch, I gave such a shout that the Earth stopped and spun backwards two days. That's why I celebrate my birthday on 8 September.
3406.author: Jon Scieszka

3407.quote: Most of us have fond memories of food from our childhood. Whether it was our mom's homemade lasagna or a memorable chocolate birthday cake, food has a way of transporting us back to the past.
3407.author: Homaro Cantu

3408.quote: I've always wanted to buy a sports car. After the England series, I went up to my dad and said that I wanted to buy a sports car and got his consent. On his birthday, I surprised him by bringing it home. It's a Porsche Boxter Limited Edition, and my family was thrilled to see it.
3408.author: Suresh Raina

3409.quote: I played rugby for years, and I had a rugby jacket that I lost when I was 14. Somehow, my brother found it in storage 15 years later, and he gave it back to me for my 30th birthday. That was amazing and probably one of the best gifts I've ever received.
3409.author: Ryan Reynolds

3410.quote: When I was six, my best friend's parents bought him a piano. My mother noticed that every time I would go to his house, the first thing I would say to him was 'Levester' - His name was Levester - I said, 'Levester, can I go play your piano?' So, on my 7th birthday, my parents bought me a piano.
3410.author: Herbie Hancock

3411.quote: I wanted to be the next Dana Carvey. This was my ultimate goal. If I ever cut into a birthday cake and made a wish, I would wish to be on 'Saturday Night Live.' If I threw a coin into a fountain, I would wish to be on 'Saturday Night Live.' If I saw a shooting star, I would wish to be on 'Saturday Night Live.'
3411.author: Jimmy Fallon

3412.quote: I had the worst birthday party ever when I was a child because my parents hired a pony to give rides. And these ponies are never in good health. But this one dropped dead. It just wasn't much fun after that. One kid would sit on him and the rest of us would drag him around.
3412.author: Rita Rudner

3413.quote: Friends and family do not believe you write fiction. They truly believe that every word you write is either autobiographical or based on them. I once had a character say that she never wanted to be invited to another children's birthday party, and I never received another children's birthday party invitation ever again.
3413.author: Liane Moriarty

3414.quote: I can sing 'Happy Birthday' to you in twelve different places, but one of them is going to make you feel a certain thing, maybe it's a vulnerability, maybe an innocence, maybe another way is sexy and soulful or bluesy whatever it is, but with singers, exploring keys, I think, is important.
3414.author: Idina Menzel

3415.quote: I have an ambivalent relationship with Margaret Thatcher. She came to power in May 1979 - a month before my 11th birthday. I was far too young to have developed a great deal of political awareness. I remember it, though - my mother excited at the dinner table because Britain had its first female prime minister.
3415.author: Sara Sheridan

3416.quote: Funny story: I was hanging out with Adam Shankman for Samantha Ronson's birthday, and Lance Bass was there. I don't really know Lance, but he comes over to me and goes, 'Hey, I just wanted to let you know I'm a fan of 'Pretty Little Liars' and I'm rooting for your character.' It was surreal! That's how 'PLL' has changed my life.
3416.author: Ryan Guzman

3417.quote: As I approached my 95th birthday, I was burdened to write a book that addressed the epidemic of 'easy believism.' There is a mindset today that if people believe in God and do good works, they are going to Heaven.
3417.author: Billy Graham

3418.quote: I have been a frequent air traveler since I was a few months shy of my sixth birthday, when my parents packed me off to boarding school two plane rides away from home. Those days of being willingly handed from air hostess to air hostess as an 'unaccompanied minor' made me blase about the rigors of air travel.
3418.author: Shashi Tharoor

3419.quote: Washington's birthday is worthy of celebration - he is one of the greatest men in history. But Washington himself would likely have seen celebration of the office of the presidency itself as monarchic in nature.
3419.author: Ben Shapiro

3420.quote: Motorcycle riding has been a passion of mine since my 20th birthday, and as a proud member of the American Motorcyclist Association and the Harley Owners Group, I can attest that responsible riding has many unique recreational benefits for millions of Americans.
3420.author: Tim Walberg

3421.quote: I often imagine what it would be like if my father were still here to mark his 100th birthday, if Alzheimer's hadn't clawed away years, possibilities, hopes. What would he think of all the commemorations and celebrations?
3421.author: Patti Davis

3422.quote: I've got more than 600 pairs of Ray-Ban sunglasses, from 1950s originals to newer models. I have them on the wall like opticians do so I can pick out a pair that goes with my outfit. I had around 30 pairs, then my husband Rainer started getting them for me as birthday and Christmas gifts.
3422.author: Suzi Quatro

3423.quote: For my 50th birthday, I got ahold of a new print of 'Saturday Night Fever.' I see it much more as a tough coming-of-age movie than as a disco story.
3423.author: Gene Siskel

3424.quote: I'd be happy to live till 80 as long as I was comfortable and in good health. Mind you, ask me again on the eve of my 80th birthday. Even so, I hope we don't all start living to be 120. I'm not sure I'd cope with another 60 years.
3424.author: Bonnie Tyler

3425.quote: The first memory I have in the world is of death and tears. That is how I would mark the beginning of my life: the way people mark the end of one. My family had gathered at Papa Joe's house because Mam' Grace was slipping away, only I didn't register it that way. For some reason I thought that it was her birthday.
3425.author: Charles M. Blow

3426.quote: I can still remember the afternoon, on my 15th birthday, when I opened up 'The Virgin and the Gypsy,' D.H. Lawrence's novella, in my tiny cell in boarding school, and whole worlds of possibility opened out that I had never guessed existed. The language was on fire and sang of liberation.
3426.author: Pico Iyer

3427.quote: I wanted to buy a candle holder, but the store didn't have one. So I got a cake.
3427.author: Mitch Hedberg

3428.quote: We all have special numbers in our lives, and 4 is that for me. It's the day I was born. My mother's birthday, and a lot of my friends' birthdays, are on the fourth; April 4 is my wedding date.
3428.author: Beyonce Knowles

3429.quote: If I could be doing anything, I'd be laying on the floor in my birthday suit eating junk food and watching something dumb on TV.
3429.author: Anita Baker

3430.quote: When I was little I thought, isn't it nice that everybody celebrates on my birthday? Because it's July 4th.
3430.author: Gloria Stuart

3431.quote: If every year is a marble, how many marbles do you have left? How many sunrises, how many opportunities to rise to the full stature of your being?
3431.author: Joy Page

3432.quote: On every birthday, I ask my wife, 'What would you like this year?' and her instant reply is, 'Diamonds! Diamonds! Diamonds!' I'm always living in hope that one day she'll say she just wants me!
3432.author: Akshay Kumar

3433.quote: We have to be able to grow up. Our wrinkles are our medals of the passage of life. They are what we have been through and who we want to be.
3433.author: Lauren Hutton

3434.quote: I like to give people novels I think they would like, on no particular occasion - just when we're in a bookstore together. I like to receive reference books on my birthday.
3434.author: Daniel Handler

3435.quote: Every year on my birthday, I start a new playlist titled after my current age so I can keep track of my favorite songs of the year as a sort of musical diary because I am a teenage girl.
3435.author: Chris Hardwick

3436.quote: I love the big fresh starts, the clean slates like birthdays and new years, but I also really like the idea that we can get up every morning and start over.
3436.author: Kristin Armstrong

3437.quote: For me, the end of childhood came when the number of candles on my birthday cake no longer reflected my age, around 19 or 20. From then on, each candle came to represent an entire decade.
3437.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

3438.quote: You know, maybe I was just born in the wrong time, but I love all things romantic. Puffy understands that. For my last birthday, he covered my hotel room floor with rose petals and had flowers and candles all over the room.
3438.author: Jennifer Lopez

3439.quote: If we celebrate Martin Luther King Jr.'s birthday at a time of presidential inaugurals, this is thanks to Ronald Reagan who created the holiday, and not to the Democratic Congress of the Carter years, which rejected it.
3439.author: David Horowitz

3440.quote: I gave a funny speech at my wife's birthday party, and I'm thinking, 'Hey, I've still got it.'
3440.author: Larry David

3441.quote: Since graduation, I have measured time in 4-by-5-inch pieces of paper, four days on the left and three on the right. Every social engagement, interview, reading, flight, doctor's appointment, birthday and dry-cleaning reminder has been handwritten between metal loops.
3441.author: Sloane Crosley

3442.quote: The thrill of performing - that's something that hasn't changed for me. That simultaneous joy of creating something and sharing it with an audience - it's the same now as it was then, when it was just my cousins' birthday party.
3442.author: Steve Buscemi

3443.quote: Fourth of July. My birthday is July first, and my best friend's birthday is July fifth, so it's always been a favorite holiday. It's all about having a cooler full of sodas, hot dogs, and just hanging out and shooting off firecrackers, being low-key, watching the fireworks.
3443.author: Hilarie Burton

3444.quote: We invest less in our friendships and expect more of friends than any other relationship. We spend days working out where to book for a romantic dinner, weeks wondering how to celebrate a partner or parent's birthday, and seconds forgetting a friend's important anniversary.
3444.author: Mariella Frostrup

3445.quote: As a kid, I always went to therapists; the first time was when my parents were separated on my sixth birthday, then on and off since then.
3445.author: Pete Wentz

3446.quote: I'm really not the party type. I more like to have friends over at the house and chill. I've never been the super party type. But for the 18th birthday, you got to party. And then 21 is going to be even bigger.
3446.author: Jacob Latimore

3447.quote: With a recent birthday, I've been acting now for twenty years.
3447.author: Thayer David

3448.quote: I had been offered a Hollywood contract before my 18th birthday. It gave me the spark I needed.
3448.author: Gene Tierney

3449.quote: I want a chainsaw very badly, because I think cutting down a tree would be unbelievably satisfying. I have asked for a chainsaw for my birthday, but I think I'll probably be given jewelry instead.
3449.author: Susan Orlean

3450.quote: Every five years, I like to do a big birthday party. I had my 45th birthday with 75 friends in Marrakesh, Morocco.
3450.author: Chip Conley

3451.quote: My first paying job might have been doing a play, actually. My mom paid me to dress up as a flounder at my sister's 'Little Mermaid' - themed birthday party when I was little.
3451.author: Paul Dano

3452.quote: The only show my mother could afford to take me to when I was growing up was 'Cats', for my birthday.
3452.author: Tammy Blanchard

3453.quote: I am a big popcorn fanatic. I love popcorn. In fact one year for my birthday, my husband bought me one of those big popcorn machines like they have in movie theaters.
3453.author: Debbie Macomber

3454.quote: I grew up doing all that stuff because I was obsessed with the '50s. I had sock hops for birthday parties. So I've always done The Twist and stuff. It was pretty natural and, with my parents doing it all the time, I'd just copy them. Not very pretty.
3454.author: Brittany Snow

3455.quote: I had arranged a birthday party for him and my children, who are all Aquarians. Instead, we got married. I ran out of excuses. It was just us and my children.
3455.author: Diane von Furstenberg

3456.quote: If there's one thing I really want for my birthday, that is for the mining company not to mine my daddy's reserve.
3456.author: Bindi Irwin

3457.quote: All my favorite stars, my family and my friends are here. I'm having the happiest birthday that an 18-year-old girl could ever have.
3457.author: Brandy Norwood

3458.quote: All I watch is the Food Network. I took a cheesemaking class a few weeks ago, and I told my family and friends to only get me kitchen stuff on my birthday. I'm into every kind of cookbook and anything by Anthony Bourdain. I'd love to own a restaurant if I could find the right chef.
3458.author: Jesse McCartney

3459.quote: I worked at an ice cream parlor called Chadwicks. We wore old-timey outfits and had to bang a drum, play a kazoo, and sing 'Happy Birthday' to people while giving them free birthday sundaes. Lots of ice cream scooping and $1 tips.
3459.author: Amy Poehler

3460.quote: My parents were dishonest people. If it was my birthday, I knew my mother took me to the K-Mart and she stole my toy. She'd put it in the shopping cart and we'd walk out. I was raised with that.
3460.author: Vincent Gallo

3461.quote: And I was very shy as a kid; if you sang me 'Happy Birthday,' I would cry. Quite shy. So the idea of being an actor, much less a model, was just out of this world.
3461.author: Cody Horn

3462.quote: Why, on my mother's birthday, am I thinking about 'Father Knows Best?' At our house, mother knew best at least as often as father did, but then the title of the old sitcom, a homogenized portrait of American family life, was meant to be slightly sardonic.
3462.author: Tom Shales

3463.quote: When Oscar Niemeyer died on December 5, 2012, ten days before his 105th birthday, he was universally regarded as the very last of the twentieth century's major architectural masters, an astonishing survivor whose most famous accomplishment, Brasilia, was the climactic episode of utopian High Modern urbanism.
3463.author: Martin Filler

3464.quote: Robert Duvall saw me playing at a restaurant in Louisiana and invited me to be an extra in his movie 'The Apostle.' He gave me a guitar for my sixth birthday, and I thought that was the coolest thing in the world.
3464.author: Hunter Hayes

3465.quote: Birthday Alarm was a very simple site based on being reminded of your friends' birthdays.
3465.author: Michael Birch

3466.quote: One of the shocks of a 50th birthday is realizing the fundamental fact that your youth is irrevocably over.
3466.author: Marianne Williamson

3467.quote: Ask any teenage girl to describe her perfect bedroom, and you'll get answers like 'a room with a private phone line, a place to hang out with friends, and for it to be way-cool and funky.' Ask parents the same question, and 'a locked door that opens on their 21st birthday' might top the list!
3467.author: Candice Olson

3468.quote: If you've been running a business for 38 years, you're approaching your 66th birthday, you've never owed a man a penny or done anyone any grievance in your life, and you feel hard done-by and try to protect yourself and your family, but go to prison, well if that's the society we're living in, I'm happy to accept that.
3468.author: Sean Quinn

3469.quote: As I approached my 18th birthday and prepared to enter military service in World War II, I was recommended to receive the Melchizedek Priesthood.
3469.author: Thomas S. Monson

3470.quote: In 1993 my birthday present was a star on Hollywood's Walk of Fame.
3470.author: Annette Funicello

3471.quote: A friend never defends a husband who gets his wife an electric skillet for her birthday.
3471.author: Erma Bombeck

3472.quote: Like many women my age, I am 28 years old.
3472.author: Mary Schmich

3473.quote: The reason I met my husband was because I remembered a friend's birthday. The moral of the story is: Remember people's birthdays.
3473.author: Julianna Margulies

3474.quote: I'm not going to be caught around here for any fool celebration. To hell with birthdays!
3474.author: Norman Rockwell

3475.quote: I'm amazed. When I was 40, I thought I'd never make 50. And at 50 I thought the frosting on the cake would be 60. At 60, I was still going strong and enjoying everything.
3475.author: Gloria Stuart

3476.quote: To my surprise, my 70s are nicer than my 60s and my 60s than my 50s, and I wouldn't wish my teens and 20s on my enemies.
3476.author: Lionel Blue

3477.quote: Only then, approaching my fortieth birthday, I made philosophy my life's work.
3477.author: Karl Jaspers

3478.quote: As I approach my 88th birthday, it's become apparent to me that my eyes and ears, among other appurtenances, aren't quite what they used to be. The prospect of long flights to wherever in search of whatever are not quite as appealing.
3478.author: Mike Wallace

3479.quote: I lost twins at 14 weeks, and I had to have an D and C on my birthday.
3479.author: Amy Weber

3480.quote: The first guitar I ever got was for my 13th birthday.
3480.author: Rick Springfield

3481.quote: Interventions are really emotionally exhausting and I would never ever want to have one. In the same way, I would never want to have a surprise birthday party. That would be horrible.
3481.author: Margaret Cho

3482.quote: I hate birthdays. I thought that I only hated my own birthday, and then I realized that I hate my children's birthdays too.
3482.author: Samantha Bee

3483.quote: I've died so many times. I'm 65. On my 40th birthday, my girlfriend gave me a reel with ways I had died, whether it was by knife, or electrocution or drowning or being thrown off a building or whatever it might have been. I've died a lot of times!
3483.author: Jonathan Banks

3484.quote: I filed a brief as a friend of the court in the U. of Michigan to keep affirmative action at the U. of Michigan, which I attended the law school. And I was one of the original sponsors of making the Martin Luther King birthday a federal holiday.
3484.author: Dick Gephardt

3485.quote: I saw Farrah Fawcett originally when she and her boyfriend, Lee Majors, came over to my house for a birthday party that I was having for my ex-wife, Leigh Taylor-Young.
3485.author: Ryan O'Neal

3486.quote: My parents screened 'Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory' for my 6th birthday, and I became fascinated by the idea of living in a candy land with chocolate rivers and lollipop trees.
3486.author: Dylan Lauren

3487.quote: I'm a Virgo and I'm more - I don't want to say 'negative' - but I'm the girl who thinks no one's coming to my birthday party, no one's buying my clothes, no one's reading my book, no one's watching my show - that's just how I think.
3487.author: Rachel Zoe

3488.quote: I think the best thing about my job is that I have my life documented, which not many people get to have. They have a photo here and there and maybe some video footage from a birthday. My kids will be able to see me growing up.
3488.author: Kirsten Dunst

3489.quote: I guess I could say I'm an actor, which I am, but that sounds like I'm putting down being a movie star, which, let's face it, is what I've become to many people. For myself, I'm a guy who was very insecure from about age 14 until the day I hit my 30th birthday.
3489.author: Dennis Quaid

3490.quote: Growing up, my birthday was always Confederate Memorial Day. It helped to create this profound sense of awareness about the Civil War and the 100 years between the Civil War and the civil rights movement and my parents' then-illegal and interracial marriage.
3490.author: Natasha Trethewey

3491.quote: I get letters constantly from all over the world, telephone calls from America, Brazil, Australia, all over, especially on my birthday. A family? I have a huge international family. That's all I need.
3491.author: Renata Tebaldi

3492.quote: I like working on my birthday, so I always do.
3492.author: Abhishek Bachchan

3493.quote: A true nature is a gloomy monolith, sort of like that old black rotary phone that I had to sing 'Happy Birthday' to Grandpa on. But novelists, damn us, still need true natures - so we can give them to our protagonists. And so readers can vaguely predict how they'll behave when we trap them in 'situations' that they can't IM their way out of.
3493.author: Walter Kirn

3494.quote: I love mayonnaise. Every birthday when I was a kid I'd go to Black Angus and just dip my burger in mayo.
3494.author: Blake Anderson

3495.quote: I was very aware of Jeff Buckley. My brother actually bought me The Mamas And The Papas and Jeff Buckley for my birthday when I was in my early teens.
3495.author: Imogen Poots

3496.quote: I saw a man killed in front of my eyes just before my eighth birthday.
3496.author: Peter O'Toole

3497.quote: I'm one of those people who had Christmas and my birthday always combined, and generally, my birthday was pretty much ignored. But my parents are always good about making some kind of special effort to make me feel like I also have a birthday that exists.
3497.author: Noel Wells

3498.quote: I've never really made a big deal out of my birthday.
3498.author: Nikki Reed

3499.quote: I remember when I was working at Sprint, I'd work on my birthday, New Year's Day, and even Christmas Eve. I'm just used to working on my birthday, so I'll be celebrating it afterward.
3499.author: Prince Royce

3500.quote: For my 11th birthday, I asked to be adopted.
3500.author: Kaui Hart Hemmings

3501.quote: My father was one of the fortunate wartime servicemen: he made a full recovery from his injuries, was promoted to captain, survived the war, had a satisfying career as a colonial officer and, eventually, died in February 2002, a month before his 85th birthday.
3501.author: Michael Ashcroft

3502.quote: I have a strong memory of the day I was told that my father had a weak heart and that he had to go to the hospital. He died when I was nine years old on the same day that Franklin Roosevelt died; it was his 45th birthday.
3502.author: Alan J. Heeger

3503.quote: I was in my mid-teens when someone gave me a copy of 'Pears Encyclopaedia of Myth and Legends' as a birthday present. It sat on my shelves for many months before I looked at it. When I did, I couldn't stop reading it.
3503.author: Tariq Ali

3504.quote: This is a wonderful way to celebrate an 80th birthday... I wanted to be 65 again, but they wouldn't let me - Homeland Security.
3504.author: Art Buchwald

3505.quote: My mother still sends a cake to the office for my birthday.
3505.author: David Ulevitch

3506.quote: I have had fans make me the big picture collages of the photo books; I have had fans send me birthday cakes... sing to me on my voicemail. I have had fans flash me. I have had older fans give me their bras and underwear onstage.
3506.author: Sean Combs

3507.quote: There weren't any astronauts until I was about 10. Yuri Gagarin went into space right around my 10th birthday.
3507.author: John L. Phillips

3508.quote: I suddenly realized how much I loved her when we attended Alfred Hitchcock's 75th birthday party last August. There was something magical about that night, and it made me see how much she really meant to me.
3508.author: Rod Taylor

3509.quote: My second play, The Birthday Party, I wrote in 1958 - or 1957. It was totally destroyed by the critics of the day, who called it an absolute load of rubbish.
3509.author: Harold Pinter

3510.quote: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
3510.author: John C. Maxwell

3511.quote: Ultimately, leadership is not about glorious crowning acts. It's about keeping your team focused on a goal and motivated to do their best to achieve it, especially when the stakes are high and the consequences really matter. It is about laying the groundwork for others' success, and then standing back and letting them shine.
3511.author: Chris Hadfield

3512.quote: If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader.
3512.author: John Quincy Adams

3513.quote: You have to think anyway, so why not think big?
3513.author: Donald Trump

3514.quote: The supreme quality for leadership is unquestionably integrity. Without it, no real success is possible, no matter whether it is on a section gang, a football field, in an army, or in an office.
3514.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

3515.quote: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
3515.author: Peter Drucker

3516.quote: I am not afraid of an army of lions led by a sheep; I am afraid of an army of sheep led by a lion.
3516.author: Alexander the Great

3517.quote: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
3517.author: Steve Jobs

3518.quote: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.
3518.author: John F. Kennedy

3519.quote: Be a yardstick of quality. Some people aren't used to an environment where excellence is expected.
3519.author: Steve Jobs

3520.quote: When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.
3520.author: Ronald Reagan

3521.quote: A good leader takes a little more than his share of the blame, a little less than his share of the credit.
3521.author: Arnold H. Glasow

3522.quote: If the highest aim of a captain were to preserve his ship, he would keep it in port forever.
3522.author: Thomas Aquinas

3523.quote: The quality of a leader is reflected in the standards they set for themselves.
3523.author: Ray Kroc

3524.quote: Leadership is not about a title or a designation. It's about impact, influence and inspiration. Impact involves getting results, influence is about spreading the passion you have for your work, and you have to inspire team-mates and customers.
3524.author: Robin S. Sharma

3525.quote: Only the guy who isn't rowing has time to rock the boat.
3525.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

3526.quote: Where there is no vision, there is no hope.
3526.author: George Washington Carver

3527.quote: A genuine leader is not a searcher for consensus but a molder of consensus.
3527.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

3528.quote: A leader is a dealer in hope.
3528.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

3529.quote: It is better to lead from behind and to put others in front, especially when you celebrate victory when nice things occur. You take the front line when there is danger. Then people will appreciate your leadership.
3529.author: Nelson Mandela

3530.quote: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
3530.author: Lao Tzu

3531.quote: If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.
3531.author: Henry Ford

3532.quote: Speak softly and carry a big stick; you will go far.
3532.author: Theodore Roosevelt

3533.quote: Leadership is not about the next election, it's about the next generation.
3533.author: Simon Sinek

3534.quote: Leadership is solving problems. The day soldiers stop bringing you their problems is the day you have stopped leading them. They have either lost confidence that you can help or concluded you do not care. Either case is a failure of leadership.
3534.author: Colin Powell

3535.quote: Don't find fault, find a remedy.
3535.author: Henry Ford

3536.quote: I know of no single formula for success. But over the years I have observed that some attributes of leadership are universal and are often about finding ways of encouraging people to combine their efforts, their talents, their insights, their enthusiasm and their inspiration to work together.
3536.author: Queen Elizabeth II

3537.quote: If a window of opportunity appears, don't pull down the shade.
3537.author: Tom Peters

3538.quote: Effective leadership is putting first things first. Effective management is discipline, carrying it out.
3538.author: Stephen Covey

3539.quote: When your values are clear to you, making decisions becomes easier.
3539.author: Roy E. Disney

3540.quote: Leadership is the capacity to translate vision into reality.
3540.author: Warren Bennis

3541.quote: Enlightened leadership is spiritual if we understand spirituality not as some kind of religious dogma or ideology but as the domain of awareness where we experience values like truth, goodness, beauty, love and compassion, and also intuition, creativity, insight and focused attention.
3541.author: Deepak Chopra

3542.quote: When the best leader's work is done the people say, 'We did it ourselves.'
3542.author: Lao Tzu

3543.quote: There is no greater name for a leader than mother or father. There is no leadership more important than parenthood.
3543.author: Sheri L. Dew

3544.quote: Leadership is practiced not so much in words as in attitude and in actions.
3544.author: Harold S. Geneen

3545.quote: Outstanding leaders go out of their way to boost the self-esteem of their personnel. If people believe in themselves, it's amazing what they can accomplish.
3545.author: Sam Walton

3546.quote: Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them.
3546.author: John C. Maxwell

3547.quote: You don't lead by hitting people over the head - that's assault, not leadership.
3547.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

3549.quote: Obstacles are things a person sees when he takes his eyes off his goal.
3549.author: E. Joseph Cossman

3550.quote: Effective leadership is not about making speeches or being liked; leadership is defined by results not attributes.
3550.author: Peter Drucker

3551.quote: Management is about arranging and telling. Leadership is about nurturing and enhancing.
3551.author: Tom Peters

3552.quote: High expectations are the key to everything.
3552.author: Sam Walton

3553.quote: It is essential to employ, trust, and reward those whose perspective, ability, and judgment are radically different from yours. It is also rare, for it requires uncommon humility, tolerance, and wisdom.
3553.author: Dee Hock

3554.quote: Go as far as you can see; when you get there, you'll be able to see farther.
3554.author: J. P. Morgan

3555.quote: Good management is the art of making problems so interesting and their solutions so constructive that everyone wants to get to work and deal with them.
3555.author: Paul Hawken

3556.quote: Problems are only opportunities in work clothes.
3556.author: Henry J. Kaiser

3557.quote: The speed of the leader is the speed of the gang.
3557.author: Mary Kay Ash

3558.quote: If you don't understand that you work for your mislabeled 'subordinates', then you know nothing of leadership. You know only tyranny.
3558.author: Dee Hock

3559.quote: I'm not a natural leader. I'm too intellectual; I'm too abstract; I think too much.
3559.author: Newt Gingrich

3560.quote: People ask the difference between a leader and a boss. The leader leads, and the boss drives.
3560.author: Theodore Roosevelt

3562.quote: Leadership cannot really be taught. It can only be learned.
3562.author: Harold S. Geneen

3563.quote: Affirmation without discipline is the beginning of delusion.
3563.author: Jim Rohn

3564.quote: Leadership is unlocking people's potential to become better.
3564.author: Bill Bradley

3565.quote: A man who wants to lead the orchestra must turn his back on the crowd.
3565.author: Max Lucado

3566.quote: Leadership can not be measured in a poll or even in the result of an election. It can only be truly seen with the benefit of time. From the perspective of 20 years, not 20 days.
3566.author: Marco Rubio

3567.quote: The function of leadership is to produce more leaders, not more followers.
3567.author: Ralph Nader

3568.quote: Leadership is getting someone to do what they don't want to do, to achieve what they want to achieve.
3568.author: Tom Landry

3569.quote: The signs of outstanding leadership appear primarily among the followers. Are the followers reaching their potential? Are they learning? Serving? Do they achieve the required results? Do they change with grace? Manage conflict?
3569.author: Max de Pree

3570.quote: Leadership is a privilege to better the lives of others. It is not an opportunity to satisfy personal greed.
3570.author: Mwai Kibaki

3571.quote: The test of leadership is not to put greatness into humanity, but to elicit it, for the greatness is already there.
3571.author: James Buchanan

3572.quote: We live in a society obsessed with public opinion. But leadership has never been about popularity.
3572.author: Marco Rubio

3573.quote: In order to cultivate a set of leaders with legitimacy in the eyes of the citizenry, it is necessary that the path to leadership be visibly open to talented and qualified individuals of every race and ethnicity.
3573.author: Sandra Day O'Connor

3574.quote: Leadership is about doing the right thing, even if it going against a vast number of naysayers and mediocre people.
3574.author: N. R. Narayana Murthy

3575.quote: To succeed in business it is necessary to make others see things as you see them.
3575.author: Aristotle Onassis

3577.quote: A leader who doesn't hesitate before he sends his nation into battle is not fit to be a leader.
3577.author: Golda Meir

3579.quote: Getting in touch with your true self must be your first priority.
3579.author: Tom Hopkins

3580.quote: To succeed, one must be creative and persistent.
3580.author: John H. Johnson

3581.quote: One of the tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.
3581.author: Arnold H. Glasow

3582.quote: The cardinal responsibility of leadership is to identify the dominant contradiction at each point of the historical process and to work out a central line to resolve it.
3582.author: Mao Zedong

3583.quote: Educationists should build the capacities of the spirit of inquiry, creativity, entrepreneurial and moral leadership among students and become their role model.
3583.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

3584.quote: Republican leadership in Congress let the energy companies write the energy bill that sent prices soaring, and has turned a blind eye to the struggles of working families trying to make ends meet.
3584.author: Sherrod Brown

3585.quote: A good objective of leadership is to help those who are doing poorly to do well and to help those who are doing well to do even better.
3585.author: Jim Rohn

3586.quote: In Britain, you do your job. When you do an American TV show, there is a sense of being one with the crew, and there is a leadership element, which was a learning curve for me because it is very different culturally. In Britain, you just do it, leave and say, 'Thanks.'
3586.author: Theo James

3587.quote: Many corporate leaders and employees have the right intentions, but it can be overwhelming when you consider how everything is affected from leadership styles, to organizational structure, to employee engagement, to customer service an marketplace.
3587.author: Simon Mainwaring

3588.quote: I think leadership is knowing what you want to achieve and then purposefully and sensibly taking steps to achieve it, remembering always that you have got to bring people with you if you are seeking to be a successful political leader.
3588.author: Tony Abbott

3589.quote: I don't want to over generalize, but I believe that women are typically drawn to leadership styles that focus on consensus building, effective listening and working in teams. That's certainly been my leadership style, and I think it's been very successful.
3589.author: Margaret Hamburg

3590.quote: Leadership is an act of submission to God. To be a leader means listening to all kinds of people and situations. Out of that listening, we are hoping to discern the mind of God as best we can. This is the price of leadership - it's an act of sacrifice. So leadership is part and parcel of the work of submission to God.
3590.author: Richard Foster

3591.quote: I think the currency of leadership is transparency. You've got to be truthful. I don't think you should be vulnerable every day, but there are moments where you've got to share your soul and conscience with people and show them who you are, and not be afraid of it.
3591.author: Howard Schultz

3592.quote: One of the lessons of leadership worth emphasizing is that you want to get to know other great leaders and take their advice. At some point in your development, it's only people who've been in the seat of having to be leaders who can help you in a deep way.
3592.author: Jim Yong Kim

3593.quote: As members of Congress, we take an oath to uphold the Constitution and bear true faith and allegiance to the United States, not the Republican or Democratic party. I have been willing to stand up to my own leadership when it's in the national interest.
3593.author: Jackie Speier

3594.quote: I think leadership is not something you learn; it's something you discover.
3594.author: Myles Munroe

3595.quote: No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself or get all the credit for doing it.
3595.author: Andrew Carnegie

3596.quote: The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.
3596.author: Andrew Carnegie

3597.quote: Millions saw the apple fall, but Newton was the one who asked why.
3597.author: Bernard Baruch

3598.quote: Leadership consists of picking good men and helping them do their best.
3598.author: Chester W. Nimitz

3599.quote: How we think shows through in how we act. Attitudes are mirrors of the mind. They reflect thinking.
3599.author: David Joseph Schwartz

3600.quote: I have always supported measures and principles and not men.
3600.author: Davy Crockett

3601.quote: My attitude is never to be satisfied, never enough, never.
3601.author: Duke Ellington

3602.quote: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it.
3602.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

3603.quote: When placed in command, take charge.
3603.author: Norman Schwarzkopf

3604.quote: Leadership to me means duty, honor, country. It means character, and it means listening from time to time.
3604.author: George W. Bush

3605.quote: The task of the leader is to get his people from where they are to where they have not been.
3605.author: Henry A. Kissinger

3606.quote: It is, after all, the responsibility of the expert to operate the familiar and that of the leader to transcend it.
3606.author: Henry A. Kissinger

3607.quote: A leader does not deserve the name unless he is willing occasionally to stand alone.
3607.author: Henry A. Kissinger

3608.quote: Hold yourself responsible for a higher standard than anybody expects of you. Never excuse yourself.
3608.author: Henry Ward Beecher

3609.quote: Give whatever you are doing and whoever you are with the gift of your attention.
3609.author: Jim Rohn

3610.quote: Good leadership consists of showing average people how to do the work of superior people.
3610.author: John D. Rockefeller

3611.quote: Lead, follow, or get out of the way.
3611.author: Laurence J. Peter

3613.quote: I suppose leadership at one time meant muscles; but today it means getting along with people.
3613.author: Mahatma Gandhi

3614.quote: Today a reader, tomorrow a leader.
3614.author: Margaret Fuller

3615.quote: Great companies in the way they work, start with great leaders.
3615.author: Steve Ballmer

3616.quote: If you command wisely, you'll be obeyed cheerfully.
3616.author: Thomas Fuller

3617.quote: The exercise of power is determined by thousands of interactions between the world of the powerful and that of the powerless, all the more so because these worlds are never divided by a sharp line: everyone has a small part of himself in both.
3617.author: Vaclav Havel

3618.quote: I am a general. My soldiers are the keys and I have to command them.
3618.author: Vladimir Horowitz

3619.quote: If you care enough for a result, you will most certainly attain it.
3619.author: William James

3620.quote: People buy into the leader before they buy into the vision.
3620.author: John C. Maxwell

3621.quote: Be careful the environment you choose for it will shape you; be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them.
3621.author: W. Clement Stone

3622.quote: Doing is a quantum leap from imagining.
3622.author: Barbara Sher

3623.quote: The amount of good luck coming your way depends on your willingness to act.
3623.author: Barbara Sher

3624.quote: It is better to have a lion at the head of an army of sheep, than a sheep at the head of an army of lions.
3624.author: Daniel Defoe

3625.quote: Everyone who's ever taken a shower has an idea. It's the person who gets out of the shower, dries off and does something about it who makes a difference.
3625.author: Nolan Bushnell

3626.quote: The art of leadership is saying no, not saying yes. It is very easy to say yes.
3626.author: Tony Blair

3627.quote: If you have ideas, you have the main asset you need, and there isn't any limit to what you can do with your business and your life. Ideas are any man's greatest asset.
3627.author: Harvey S. Firestone

3628.quote: Leadership is diving for a loose ball, getting the crowd involved, getting other players involved. It's being able to take it as well as dish it out. That's the only way you're going to get respect from the players.
3628.author: Larry Bird

3629.quote: Leadership does not depend on being right.
3629.author: Ivan Illich

3630.quote: Without initiative, leaders are simply workers in leadership positions.
3630.author: Bo Bennett

3631.quote: Leadership - leadership is about taking responsibility, not making excuses.
3631.author: Mitt Romney

3632.quote: It is rare to find a business partner who is selfless. If you are lucky it happens once in a lifetime.
3632.author: Michael Eisner

3633.quote: You have to lead people gently toward what they already know is right.
3633.author: Phil Crosby

3635.quote: One must be convinced to convince, to have enthusiasm to stimulate the others.
3635.author: Stefan Zweig

3636.quote: Honor bespeaks worth. Confidence begets trust. Service brings satisfaction. Cooperation proves the quality of leadership.
3636.author: James Cash Penney

3637.quote: The very essence of leadership is that you have to have vision. You can't blow an uncertain trumpet.
3637.author: Theodore Hesburgh

3638.quote: No institution can possibly survive if it needs geniuses or supermen to manage it. It must be organized in such a way as to be able to get along under a leadership composed of average human beings.
3638.author: Peter Drucker

3639.quote: Men make history and not the other way around. In periods where there is no leadership, society stands still. Progress occurs when courageous, skillful leaders seize the opportunity to change things for the better.
3639.author: Harry S Truman

3640.quote: I urge the Iraqi leadership for sake of its own people... to seize this opportunity and thereby begin to end the isolation and suffering of the Iraqi people.
3640.author: Kofi Annan

3641.quote: Leadership is intangible, and therefore no weapon ever designed can replace it.
3641.author: Omar N. Bradley

3642.quote: All of the great leaders have had one characteristic in common: it was the willingness to confront unequivocally the major anxiety of their people in their time. This, and not much else, is the essence of leadership.
3642.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

3643.quote: Leadership is a matter of having people look at you and gain confidence, seeing how you react. If you're in control, they're in control.
3643.author: Tom Landry

3644.quote: Leadership is a potent combination of strategy and character. But if you must be without one, be without the strategy.
3644.author: Norman Schwarzkopf

3645.quote: Divorced from ethics, leadership is reduced to management and politics to mere technique.
3645.author: James MacGregor Burns

3646.quote: Leadership is an active role; 'lead' is a verb. But the leader who tries to do it all is headed for burnout, and in a powerful hurry.
3646.author: Bill Owens

3647.quote: True leadership lies in guiding others to success. In ensuring that everyone is performing at their best, doing the work they are pledged to do and doing it well.
3647.author: Bill Owens

3648.quote: Vocational education programs have made a real difference in the lives of countless young people nationwide; they build self-confidence and leadership skills by allowing students to utilize their unique gifts and talents.
3648.author: Conrad Burns

3649.quote: Leaders of the future will have to be visionary and be able to bring people in - real communicators. These are things that women bring to leadership and executive positions, and it's going to be incredibly valuable and incredibly in demand.
3649.author: Anita Borg

3650.quote: Public office is supposed to be a public trust. This is a clear sign of the rampant corruption at the highest levels of the Republican leadership.
3650.author: Bob Etheridge

3651.quote: Servant leadership is the foundation and the secret of Sam Walton's ability to achieve team synergy.
3651.author: Michael Bergdahl

3652.quote: I think it is quite dangerous for an organisation to think they can predict where they are going to need leadership. It needs to be something that people are willing to assume if it feels relevant, given the context of any situation.
3652.author: Margaret J. Wheatley

3653.quote: The 9/11 Commission recently released their report, citing important changes which need to be made to improve our nation's homeland security. I voiced my disappointment with the House leadership when this report was left until after the August recess for action.
3653.author: Leonard Boswell

3654.quote: The key to successful leadership today is influence, not authority.
3654.author: Ken Blanchard

3655.quote: If there is such a thing as good leadership, it is to give a good example. I have to do so for all the Ikea employees.
3655.author: Ingvar Kamprad

3656.quote: The biggest difference is in the leadership. It was better for us. We had more coaches and mentors to help us. A lot of the younger players today suffer from a lack of direction.
3656.author: Isaiah Thomas

3657.quote: We must recognize that as the dominant power in the world we have a special responsibility. In addition to protecting our national interests, we must take the leadership in protecting the common interests of humanity.
3657.author: George Soros

3658.quote: The secret to success is good leadership, and good leadership is all about making the lives of your team members or workers better.
3658.author: Tony Dungy

3659.quote: Not everybody is created equal, and it's important for companies to identify those high potentials and treat them differently, accelerate their development and pay them more. That process is so incredibly important to developing first-class leadership in a company.
3659.author: Anne M. Mulcahy

3660.quote: In addition to removing our democratically elected government, Israel wants to sow dissent among Palestinians by claiming that there is a serious leadership rivalry among us. I am compelled to dispel this notion definitively.
3660.author: Ismail Haniyeh

3661.quote: The person who takes the oath of office in the next four months will shape not just the next four years, but the next forty years of our nation. In these next four years, we need proven leadership, proven judgment and proven values. America needs four more years of President Barack Obama.
3661.author: Rahm Emanuel

3662.quote: It's a different era. Our job now is to show leadership and vision and to help the next generation of artists.
3662.author: Karen Kain

3663.quote: If a guy is intimidated by a woman in leadership, he has real problems with his own concepts of masculinity. That's a harsh statement, but I believe it to be true.
3663.author: Tony Campolo

3664.quote: Well, I think that - I think leadership's always been about two main things: imagination and courage.
3664.author: Paul Keating

3665.quote: Leadership is working with goals and vision; management is working with objectives.
3665.author: Russel Honore

3666.quote: Sitting at a candidate rally is similar to sitting in a ballyard. Both give you the opportunity to assess the technical metrics and reflect on the intangibles - what baseball calls 'make up' and politics calls 'character' - the leadership, talent and maturity to add value to a venture.
3666.author: Christine Pelosi

3667.quote: If I were not African, I wonder whether it would be clear to me that Africa is a place where the people do not need limp gifts of fish but sturdy fishing rods and fair access to the pond. I wonder whether I would realize that while African nations have a failure of leadership, they also have dynamic people with agency and voices.
3667.author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

3668.quote: Most leadership strategies are doomed to failure from the outset. As people have been noting for years, the majority of strategic initiatives that are driven from the top are marginally effective - at best.
3668.author: Peter Senge

3669.quote: Pay attention to those employees who respectfully ask why. They are demonstrating an interest in their jobs and exhibiting a curiosity that could eventually translate into leadership ability.
3669.author: Harvey Mackay

3670.quote: Beginning under the Roman Empire, intellectual leadership in the West had been provided by Christianity. In the middle ages, who invented the first universities - in Paris, Oxford, Cambridge? The church.
3670.author: Nancy Pearcey

3671.quote: I think for me, or for anyone who plays the quarterback position, it's almost an unspoken word when you think about leadership. Some guys can be a leader and be a running back or a lineman, or wide receiver, strong safety, or linebacker. But when you speak of quarterbacks, it's automatically a default that you're supposed to be a leader.
3671.author: Cam Newton

3672.quote: We need leadership that can elevate religion and morality to their position of paramount importance and thus eliminate growing selfishness, immorality and materialism.
3672.author: George W. Romney

3673.quote: I don't think leadership demands 'yes' or 'no' answers; I think leadership is providing the forum for making the right decision, which doesn't demand unanimity.
3673.author: Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, Jr.

3674.quote: As a woman leader, I thought I brought a different kind of leadership. I was interested in women's issues, in bringing down the population growth rate... as a woman, I entered politics with an additional dimension - that of a mother.
3674.author: Benazir Bhutto

3675.quote: Leadership is absolutely about inspiring action, but it is also about guarding against mis-action.
3675.author: Simon Sinek

3676.quote: Uncertainty is a permanent part of the leadership landscape. It never goes away.
3676.author: Andy Stanley

3677.quote: There are good leaders who actively guide and bad leaders who actively misguide. Hence, leadership is about persuasion, presentation and people skills.
3677.author: Shiv Khera

3678.quote: Lead yourself whenever your boss' leadership deteriorates. When your boss doesn't praise what you do, praise yourself. When your boss doesn't make you big, make yourself big. Remember, if you have done your best, failure does not count.
3678.author: Mario Teguh

3679.quote: The topic of leadership is a touchy one. A lot of leaders fail because they don't have the bravery to touch that nerve or strike that chord. Throughout my years, I haven't had that fear.
3679.author: Kobe Bryant

3680.quote: Power should be reserved for weightlifting and boats, and leadership really involves responsibility.
3680.author: Herb Kelleher

3681.quote: Globalisation means many other countries are asserting themselves and trying to take over leadership. Please don't ask Americans to let others assume the leadership of human exploration. We can do wonderful science on the Moon, and wonderful commercial things. Then we can pack up and move on to Mars.
3681.author: Buzz Aldrin

3682.quote: A good cult delivers on its promises. A good cult nourishes the needs of its members, has transparency and integrity, and creates provisions for challenging its leadership openly. A good cult expands the freedoms and well-being of its members rather than limits them.
3682.author: Philip Zimbardo

3683.quote: My height doesn't define my skill set. To be a great quarterback, you have to have great leadership, great attention to detail and a relentless competitive nature - and I try to bring that on a daily basis.
3683.author: Russell Wilson

3684.quote: By giving the leadership to the private sector in a capitalistic society, we're going to measure the value of art by how many products we can sell.
3684.author: Robert Wilson

3685.quote: I think that in any group activity - whether it be business, sports, or family - there has to be leadership or it won't be successful.
3685.author: John Wooden

3686.quote: Leadership is not a popularity contest; it's about leaving your ego at the door. The name of the game is to lead without a title.
3686.author: Robin S. Sharma

3687.quote: A leadership culture is one where everyone thinks like an owner, a CEO or a managing director. It's one where everyone is entrepreneurial and proactive.
3687.author: Robin S. Sharma

3688.quote: Showing leadership doesn't mean every employee will run the organization; that would lead to chaos. Businesses do need someone to set the vision and then lead the team to it.
3688.author: Robin S. Sharma

3689.quote: We're trained to see the world in terms of charismatic organizations and charismatic people. That's who we look to for leadership and change, for transformation. We're awaiting the next J.F.K., the next Martin Luther King, the next Gandhi, the next Nelson Mandela.
3689.author: Paul Hawken

3690.quote: Leadership is an intense journey into yourself. You can use your own style to get anything done. It's about being self-aware. Every morning, I look in the mirror and say, 'I could have done three things better yesterday.'
3690.author: Jeffrey R. Immelt

3691.quote: No matter how good you think you are as a leader, my goodness, the people around you will have all kinds of ideas for how you can get better. So for me, the most fundamental thing about leadership is to have the humility to continue to get feedback and to try to get better - because your job is to try to help everybody else get better.
3691.author: Jim Yong Kim

3692.quote: Leadership is something you earn, something you're chosen for. You can't come in yelling, 'I'm your leader!' If it happens, it's because the other guys respect you.
3692.author: Ben Roethlisberger

3693.quote: The country has sorted itself ideologically into the two political parties, and those partisan attachments have hardened in recent years. It will take an extraordinary event and act of leadership to break this partisan divide. I thought 9/11 might provide such an opportunity, but it was not seized.
3693.author: Thomas E. Mann

3694.quote: To me, leadership is about encouraging people. It's about stimulating them. It's about enabling them to achieve what they can achieve - and to do that with a purpose.
3694.author: Christine Lagarde

3695.quote: The function of combat is not merely to perpetrate violence, but to perpetrate violence on command, instantaneously and reflexively. The function of the service academies is to prepare men for leadership positions where they may someday exercise that command.
3695.author: Jim Webb

3696.quote: I think America is in trouble, but it's not beyond repair. But it's going to take leadership who sees the greatness of this country and who believes that, once again, we can be one nation under God.
3696.author: Mike Huckabee
